story:
Every business’s story begins somewhere. For me, the story begins with my Nana’s tortillas. 

 

 

My name is Abel Ramos, and I just turned 12 years old. And, ever since I can remember, the smell of those tortillas has been my favorite thing in the world. 

I grew up with those tortillas. It’s a big part of my culture. It's hard for me to imagine my life without them.

When my Nana told me I was going to learn about entrepreneurship and start my own business last summer, I knew right away what I wanted to do. I wanted to share those delicious tortillas with the world.

 

 

Every day that summer, my Nana and I spent hours preparing and cooking tortillas.

 

 

Then I met Don Guerra of Barrio Bread, and he invited me to sell my tortillas at his shop. We sold out within a half-hour on the first day. 

 

 

Chef Abel's Tortillas was just supposed to be a summer project. But, by the time summer was over, it had turned into a thriving small business! The money was going to my college fund, but it was also raising money for a cause that is close to my heart: prostate cancer awareness.

You see, my Tata was battling stage 4 prostate cancer and I had accepted a challenge from the Prostate Cancer Foundation to raise money for research and awareness. Then, our local news station picked up the story about my tortillas and the cause. Soon, the demand for my tortillas was too much to handle, so we limited the retailers carrying my tortillas. We had to turn away many orders. 

When it was time to head back to school, we were having too much fun to stop. It had also become my Tata's will to live and his inspiration to keep fighting. So I decided to keep making tortillas. 

 

 

That was a year ago. My Tata has since passed away, and I made a commitment to him to carry the business forward. 

 

 

Today, you can find my tortillas at Food Conspiracy Co-Op, Barrio Bread, Tucson Tamale Company, 5 Points Market & Restaurant, and Tucson CSA. 

 

 

The tortillas, which currently come in 4-inch, 6-inch, and 8-inch sizes, are perfect for everything from tacos to cheese crisps to afternoon snacks.

 

 

So, what’s so different about my tortillas?

If you’re like most people, most of the tortillas you’ve eaten have probably been made and cooked by a machine with preservatives to make them last longer. If that's the case, then one bite of my handmade tortillas will show you what you've been missing. These aren't like any tortillas you've ever tasted! 

There’s a reason for that. The heirloom tortilla recipe was handed down by my great-great grandmother, who was making tortillas in Southern Arizona in the late 1800s. She lived in Santa Cruz County, the birthplace of the modern-day flour tortilla.

 

 

Like my great-great grandmother, I use locally grown white Sonora heritage wheat to make the heirloom tortillas. This wheat was first brought to Arizona hundreds of years ago by Father Kino, making it the oldest wheat in the Americas. Why do I use it? Because it’s the original grain used to make the first flour tortilla, and because it has a unique flavor that no other flour has.

There's one difference, though. When my Tata was undergoing treatment for his prostate cancer, he switched to a vegan diet. That inspired my Nana and I to update our recipe to make the tortillas as nutritious as possible and vegan, so everybody can enjoy them. 

My tortillas' ingredients couldn’t be simpler: Along with the heritage wheat, they’re made with filtered water, natural solar dried Sea of Cortez salt, and pure avocado oil.

I have worked to research and perfect my family heirloom recipe, so that everyone can enjoy the tortillas I make. I have loved to make tortillas since I was six years old. I believe that my customers can feel the history, joy, and passion that I have in making these tortillas, and that is why they keep coming back for more. 

 

 

I am committed to using ingredients that are 100% clean, unrefined, pure, and mostly local. My tortillas will never contain artificial flavors or preservatives of any kind. They will never be made with weird chemical stabilizers or low-quality ingredients. They will always be tortillas that my family can be proud of.

 

 

What Do I Need Help With? 

I have already been able to bring my tortillas to so many people in Tucson. But now, I want to grow my business. I want to be able to keep up with the current orders and for even more people throughout Arizona to be able to enjoy the taste of my handmade tortillas. Taking a cue from my mentor, Don Guerra of Barrio Bread, a little tortilla factory is being built in my Nana’s garage.

But in order for me to complete it, I need to buy commercial equipment. I’m hoping to be able to triple the number of tortillas my Nana and I can make in a day, so we can get my tortillas into more local stores, to all of Arizona—and onto more plates!

I need commercial equipment to put in my new kitchen space: 

  • A large commercial mixer so I can make bigger batches of tortillas. Nana’s KitchenAid worked great to begin with, but now it’s too small for my needs. 
  • A large flat-top griddle so I can cook more and bigger tortillas. I think I have killed Nana’s stove! 
  • And the most time-saving piece of equipment I need is a dough cutter and rounder. It takes forever to make and weigh each dough ball by hand! 

 

 

Your help will get me back to making the tortillas you already love faster, and give me time to do my schoolwork. With our brand-new kitchen equipment, we will be able to make many, many more tortillas—and make many, many more people happy! 

I want you to join me on this adventure. With your help, I can take my little company to the next level, and introduce my tortillas to more stores, more restaurants, and more dining room tables. I can also honor my Tata, who inspired me to keep going with my business. 

The story of Chef Abel’s Tortillas is already hundreds of years old. Would you like to become a part of the next chapter?

story:
What the woof is a Woofie Pie?

Woofie Pie was inspired by the founder, Liz's dog Winnie and her background in baking. For years, people talked about how much they loved Liz's whoopie pies (for those unfamiliar, a whoopie pie is a traditional New England treat for humans consisting of a whipped or cream cheese-based filling, sandwiched between two cakes). People loved her whoopie pies and she loved her pup so she asked herself, "How can I marry these loves?" Then came the spark for the Woofie Pie, a dog-friendly baked good inspired by the traditional whoopie pie recipe. 

Each treat is hand made from high quality, locally sourced, human-grade ingredients. It's so good that doggos are already itching to get their paws on it.

 

How your gift will help Woofie Pie 

Every dollar invested in Woofie Pie will go toward critical start-up costs required to get these tasty treats into the paws of good doggos everywhere. It takes a lot of cheddar to launch a business and while we strive to keep overhead extremely low, we still need to spend a little money to get started. 

 

Your gifts will go toward: 

- New business legal fees

- Our work with Oregon's Food Innovation Center to continually refine and craft the best possible recipes for the best pupperinos

- Packaging, trademark and website costs

- Ingredients to cover our first year of operations

 

Gift your perks to a pup in need

Don't have a dog of your own but still want to help me make Liz's dream a reality? You can always have your perks shipped to a friend for their dog to enjoy, or you can request to have your perks sent to your local animal shelter. Check out the FAQ section for details on how to make that happen.

story:
BACKGROUND

The idea of HopLore was born nearly a year ago when former schoolmates with similar interests in craft beer sat down and discussed aspirations to take a hobby and turn it into a profession.  Much time has been spent visiting breweries, comparing quality against the best in the industry. We reached out to brewers, owners and employees of successful small breweries and asked important questions that included what they felt was done right, what surprised them, and what they would have done differently. As with anything, learning from others is better than taking the more difficult path and learning through hard knocks.

We have spent countless hours working on our business plan tweaking, adjusting and streamlining the business.  We have brewed numerous batches of beer to develop high quality recipes in various styles. We have developed our own proprietary methods to developing our own tastes. We have spent hours researching brewery set ups, had meetings with advisors, investors and supporters. 

HopLore is closer to reality than ever before. 

THE CONCEPT

The most amazing part of the craft beer industry is that it is rooted in things we all hold dear: Family, Friendship, and Community. 

As the concept for HopLore became more concrete it was apparent that we had to have those things at our core. As a brewpub we are creating a setting to share a unique experience with friends and family.  HopLore is not only a place to enjoy great food produced largely from local sources, but great beer made in house for the beer geeks of the world. It a great hang out with the guys, but also to take the Mrs. that doesn't drink beer because local wines will be available.  HopLore will be a place to explore new beer styles, but will also offer something for those that aren't feeling as adventurous.

We believe that a setting in the middle of farm country at a historic mill is ideal and sets the scene for a unique experience that only a destination brewpub can provide. 

Besides being a production brewery, HopLore will also offer a full kitchen, relaxing outdoor dining space and space for live music.

DINING

Nothing goes with beer quite like barbecue! We will be sourcing as many local ingredients as possible. We will be exploring traditional as well as chef driven dishes with a down home feel. We will seek to utilize local growers for seasonal offerings. Once open we will look to source beef and pork from local farms while providing them with spent grain from the brewing process for feed. 

ENVIRONMENTAL SUSTAINABILITY

We feel strongly about sustainability and being environmentally friendly. We will recycle as much as we can, for example using the spent grain from brewing for farmers feed. We will utilize water from the brewing process to water our hops. We will seek to responsibly use energy and eventually become self sustaining with solar power. 

SPECIAL EVENTS & OUTDOOR SPACE

HopLore's outdoor space will be a friendly dining environment with space for some live music, firepit, outdoor games. We will also utilize this space for special events, releases, and charitable events.  As a business we believe that giving back to the community is essential to what we hold dear: Family, Friendships, and Community. 

What can I do to help? 

Indiegogo helps start-up businesses like HopLore create and bring to market projects with the help of the community.

We need lots of small donations from people who love small business, local food and drink, live music and share our belief in becoming like family, cultivating friendships and strengthening the community. 

 WHERE DOES THE MONEY RAISED GO?

Opening a brewery is not easy. With your help, we will build our brewpub from the ground up. But, before we can begin commercial production of our beer, HopLore needs to become licensed with the State and Federal Government. 

The money raised from this campaign will provide the capital required to take the next steps and show the demand for this type of business in the lakes area. 

The other things we need capital for are:

- Licensing and Bonding fees   - Legal services

REWARDS

Indiegogo doesn't allow us to give alcohol as a reward, but we reward with things to open beer, drink beer out of and an opportunity to be a part of HopLore for years to come.

story:
Sweet Cakes Supplies, LLC has been created to provide hobbyists, bakers and professional cake designers with quality supplies, tools and instruction. Whether one is looking to supplement their toolbox, learn the basics of cake and cupcake design or take a masterclass that will develop and enrich their skill set, Sweet Cakes Supplies will be the primary location for all. Additionally, we will offer cupcake decorating birthday parties where children can celebrate their special day while learning an exciting new skill.

Sweet Cakes Supplies, LLC is woman-owned partnership comprised of two locally successful, professional businessowners: Vanessa Ross and Ashley Desjardins. In addition, to creating award winning cakes and cupcakes, Vanessa and Ashley already conduct cupcake decorating classes at the local wineries, florists and breweries. Students surveyed have expressed a desire to return for more advanced level instruction. 

Market

The target market for Sweet Cakes Supplies will be three-fold:

1. Hobbyists looking for exciting new skills in the form of cake and cupcake decorating. 

2. Parents looking for an innovative environment for their child’s birthday party. 

3. Industry professionals in need of supplies. 

By providing baked goods, classes, parties, retail and commercial sales we will have a multi-faceted approach to business that will provide protection in fluctuating markets. First Fridays, Festivals and Car Shows will give us exposure as a primary attractive downtown business. As we grow, we look forward to adding a variety classes, bring in higher exposure instructors, add themed parties, ladies or men’s events, children’s classes, corporate team building, etc. 

Competition

There is no other known cake decorating business within a two-hour drive offering cupcake or cake decorating classes. While the local Walmart offers decorating supplies, their inventory is very limited and often out of stock. The nearest hobby stores are more than a one-hour drive in opposite directions. Neither Walmart, Hobby Lobby or Michaels offers classroom instruction. 

Why Us?

Vanessa has successfully operated Vanessa Ross Cakes for over eight years and has been commissioned to create cakes for wedding designers Hayley Paige, Lazaro and Matthew Christopher. 

Ashley createdd Simply Sweet in early 2020 and, despite Covid-19 restrictions, has had an amazing year that included a drive-thru cupcake stand and cupcakes in Toot Sweets in Oxford. 

Vanessa and Ashely are well known and respected business owners with deep ties to the community and the cake industry. 

Financial Need

Based on the cost of the equipment and tools, inventory and our first month’s expenses we anticipate a total of $35,000 instartup costs. 

While we have included the cost of cabinets and a triple sink in the equipment list the actual construction of the kitchenette and additional plumbing expenses remain unknowns to date. 

We will take every step necessary to save money by purchasing excellent used equipment. With the exception of the plumbing work needed, we will be doing all the demolition, construction, painting and floor installation ourselves. 

We are seeking to raise $15,000 in capital to bring this project to fruition.

story:
Urban Hang Suite is determined to become a daily necessity for Richmond’s coffee aficionados, a place to network and meet new people as you try to escape the daily stresses of life. A place to drink coffee, make human connections and thereby create the ripple that will impact the culture of Richmond. Additionally, in service as a cultural and social repository, the Urban Hang Suite will offer the internet and the latest periodicals for use during visits, as well as a free book exchange. A live DJ and podcast setup complemented by rotating art and private events will further enhance its burgeoning role as RVA's preeminent social gathering locale. 

When designing a cultural hub like Urban Hang Suite, it’s success depends greatly on the thought given to it’s context and history. In a historic neighborhood like Jackson Ward with such a storied and impactful past, there is much to consider. Jackson Ward was once at the epicenter of black commerce, religion,entertainment and civil rights in Richmond and its current revival is gaining momentum rapidly. There are new businesses, residences, public spaces and cultural events emerging every day that embrace a broad and diverse demographic, connecting business and culture. The Urban Hang Suite will not only embrace it’s history, but strive to become a part of the tapestry that was and is Jackson Ward. CONNECTION.COFFEE.CULTURE.

story:
Meet the Beans  

       Describing the health and environmental benefits of beans is so fantastical it starts sounding cliché… but it is TRUE.  Beans are an amazingly sustainable crop producing little relative carbon and providing soil with loads of beneficial nutrients.

Beans are full of protein, fiber, iron, potassium and have unique properties that help to regulate blood sugar. We have sourced Pinto Beans, Great-Northern White Beans, and Turtle Black Beans, all grown in the United States.

We spent a year in formulation to ensure we had perfected each flavor before even bringing it to market.  We scoured around the globe searching for flavors that would perfectly mix with the incredible properties of beans.  In only a few months of launching, BeanVivo® is now sold at natural retail stores with solid momentum of growth!

 

Meet all 6 Flavors of BeanVivo®

Our initial goal with the development of BeanVivo® was to create flavors using inspiration from some of the worlds top dishes and pair them with the healthiest food on the planet. BeanVivo® translates to Bean-Alive because Beans are the number one food tied to living longer!

Each pack of BeanVivo® is a powerhouse of nutrition, all Organic, Vegan and Gluten Free!  Each and every one of our 6 flavors was thoughtfully crafted to provide a nourishing meal on-the-go, while offering an incredible flavor experience.

 

Meet the Rewards!

The following rewards were mindfully selected to reflect our vision of eco-friendly, sustainability, innovation and adventure. Embrace the movement —join the tribe. 

**Because our BeanVivo® is a fresh product, it requires 2-day shipping to ensure it arrives at peak tastiness (unfortunately, this can be a bit costly).  We ship it cold in insulated packages to provide the absolute best!  BeanVivo® will only ship to the United States for this reason.  International backers will still receive all other rewards in each tier claimed.**

 

Meet the Reason!  

Unfortunately, it isn’t enough to develop a delicious product. You need to scale it, sell it and sometimes educate the public about it AND continue to innovate.

1. Production Scaling: In order to provide the finest food product we possibly can, we have sourced only high quality, organic ingredients. This is not just expensive, it is also a logistical puzzle. Each flavor costs thousands of dollars in ingredients alone. 

2. Sales Support: We have been approached by countless stores requesting that we begin stocking their shelves with our BeanVivo®. With a strong emphasis on in-store demos (sampling) to assure customers are able to try our beans, it is a costly uphill climb ahead.  To scale our sales efforts, marketing, packaging and deliver our products to stores, we will be requiring large investments to support our growth ahead.  

3. Education: “What more do I need to know about beans?” We are producing recipes, blog articles and now more recently, animated ‘explainer’ videos about beans. Each of the animated explainers are heavily researched and hand drawn to make the information… digestible? To produce additional explainer videos and blogs, we will need to strategically allocate more resources. 

4. Innovation: We have a large list of innovative products that use these incredible super foods.  We are eager to share our innovation pipeline we are already working on.  Innovation is embedded in our core, and we will need to destine more capital to new product launches.

 

Meet the Tribe!  

We are adventurers, flavor hunters, snack lovers, and health nuts!.  We are a small team of energetic and enthusiastic, food loving, fun seeking friends who have come together to fill a growing need. 

Our travels have brought us from the far corners of the globe to San Diego where we have strengthened our passion for clean eating and strong community. Our team has spent the last year developing flavors and creating strategic partnerships.  Our team is made up of experts each with a unique skillset and decades of experience in food science, food marketing & sales, fitness art and technology.

 

Hear the call, join the tribe and meet the cause!  

We are so thankful to you for visiting our crowdfunding page. It has been an honor to have such a strong outpouring of support and strength with our community of friendly foodies. Crowdfunding offers the world a chance to recognize the projects that help drive a positive change and show their passion by providing capitol to growing businesses.

Thank you!

 

Risks and challenges

If you are reading this, you are seriously considering supporting us, and we thank you. We want you to know we are working diligently to make BeanVivo® a huge success. Some of the risks and challenges ahead depend on production scale (co-packer) and fulfillment of a refrigerated product. For instance, shipping our product across the US inside insulated packaging requires proper timing of delivery.

We have performed countless tests to make absolutely certain that products arrive cold and fresh. Though our product is kept fresh using state-of-the-art methods such as HPP, we understand that Murphy's Law requires that mistakes be made every once in a while. Our team is dedicated to ensuring that every backer receives their proper reward, so please contact us in the case that yours arrives in less than satisfactory condition.

(Note: Backers outside of the US will not receive BeanVivo® product due to shipping constraints, but are welcome to partake in other rewards and apparel offered.)

We have sourced Pinto Beans, Great-Northern White Beans, and Turtle Black Beans, all grown in the United States.We spent a year in formulation to ensure we had perfected each flavor before even bringing it to market.  We scoured around the globe searching for flavors that would perfectly mix with the incredible properties of beans.  In only a few months of launching, BeanVivo® is now sold at natural retail stores with solid momentum of growth! Meet all 6 Flavors of BeanVivo®Our initial goal with the development of BeanVivo® was to create flavors using inspiration from some of the worlds top dishes and pair them with the healthiest food on the planet. BeanVivo® translates to Bean-Alive because Beans are the number one food tied to living longer!Each pack of BeanVivo® is a powerhouse of nutrition, all Organic, Vegan and Gluten Free!  Each and every one of our 6 flavors was thoughtfully crafted to provide a nourishing meal on-the-go, while offering an incredible flavor experience. Meet the Rewards!The following rewards were mindfully selected to reflect our vision of eco-friendly, sustainability, innovation and adventure. story:
Short Summary

Reliable, Traceable, High Quality, Specialty Coffee. It’s what drives us and what drove one family to move 10,000 miles to impact the lives of coffee growers. Bright Java exists to equip Indonesian farmers with better tools and education and to add value to the work they are already doing. We believe in building relationships with those we work with.Want to see what this coffee is about? Donate so we can send some to you.

Who We Are

We are Troy and Renda, Americans who have been on an incredible journey that has taken us to the center of the 4th largest coffee producing nation in the world.  In 2013 Troy retired from a career in the US Marines thinking there must be a better way to solve problems with people who don’t agree with us than Predator drone strikes and AC-130 Gunship runs.  After spending 18 months in an RV traveling the US we, with our family of five children they moved to Thailand to take a course in how to use business to help solve the most intractable development problems in the world.  Post that we ended up in Central Java, Indonesia to put into practice the skills we learned.

Indonesia falls only behind Brazil, Vietnam and Columbia as the largest coffee exporting nation in the world and was the first place outside of the Arabian Peninsula where coffee was cultivated.  Even now in America the name of Indonesia’s most populous island is synonymous with the word coffee.  While still studying language and culture Troy met Aswan, who shared a desire to help Indonesian peoples through social business and a love of all things coffee.  In May 2017 we partnered with Aswan to form Bright Java.  Since then we have added to our team with Desi who does our accounting, admin and compliance, Eko who engages with grower communities and Taylor, roaster and social media engagement guru.  We have come far in that time from exporting our first ton of coffee to the USA to exporting and entire shipping container’s (eighteen tons) worth of coffee.

What we Do

Bright Java exists to equip Indonesian farmers with better tools and education and to add value to the work they are already doing. When we find a producer, be it a single family, a small milling operation, or a cooperative group, we first evaluate their coffee. If it’s specialty grade we then find markets for it among our buyer networks. Outside of that we try to make a long term arrangement with a grower who will agree to stringent quality standards to produce the best possible coffee.  Once ready we bring that coffee to international markets. We aim to give vision to the supply chain and show the connection to the grower for all our sourced coffees.  Think about how you want your next coffee a nondescript product served up by a mega retailer, or a connection with a family laboring thousands of miles away?

We partner with Indonesian small holder coffee farmers and form long term, beneficial relationships with them.  We are dedicated to helping farmers improve their coffees to specialty quality and bring their product to a global audience. We believe when we’ve been given more than we need we have a responsibility to help others; we want to create better lives for generations to come and leave an impact that outlives us.

Coffee is about connecting people, whether through sitting down at a latte in a café or purchasing a ton of red cherries from a grower for further processing.  We want the locals to be proud of what they are producing, we want them to have a fair chance among the bigger players. We provide a channel to outside markets while giving fair buying prices.  We believe in being connected to our coffee farmers and their lives as they produce some of the best coffee Indonesia has to offer.

What We Believe

We believe:

  • That business, specifically the business of specialty coffee export, can be used as a tool to help alleviate the intractable problems faced in the developing world: war, poverty, disease and hunger
  • That cultivating real relationships with our coffee farmers and building this business on transparency, trust and equality is beneficial for everyone in the coffee value chain
  • That by residing at origin we can provide accountability and traceability in delivering high quality coffee.

 

Why You Should Care          

Did you know that you, the consumer, can drink amazing coffee while having a direct impact on the lives of those that produce it?  We do it without expensive and hard-to-verify certification schemes that smallholder farmers cannot afford.  We do that through relationship. 

It’s all about sustainability. We care about the people we source from, and believe you should too.  A broker or middle man may offer a farmer an insanely low price for their red cherries before they are even harvested.  We would prefer that farmer process his own or set up a co-op with neighbors and keep more of the available profit. Partner with us to see that our producers can attain a better life through coffee.

Our Coffees

We are currently sourcing green coffee from small holders in the following regions:

Sumatra; Aceh Gayo

Sumatra; North Sumatra Simalungun

West Java; Preangar

Central Java; Merbabu

Bali; Kintamani

Sulawesi; Toraja

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to prepare for the 2019 harvest. Inventory from 2018 has got to go so we can position ourselves in early May 2019 to invest into the following:

  • Purchase 4-10 tons of West Java green beans— We found a great co-op that we want to begin working at the end of the 2018 harvest, too late to buy their beans.  This co-op already has a processing station and stringent production standards.  What they lack is a viable market for their beans. We can provide that with our network of green importers.  $20,700 USD
  • Purchase a 300kg Central Java microlot—A microlot is a smaller consignment of coffee, usually much less than a shipping container's worth.  We have the option to purchase one of the best microlots we found during the end of the 2018 season.  $2,300 USD
  • Build our own processing plant— We have the opportunity to increase the coffee quality in the growing area nearest to us by actually installing our own wash station.  By buying up the freshest red cherries from the individual farmers we can process their harvest to a stringent, uniform quality standard and net top dollar in order to give back a percentage to the grower. $7,000 USD

Perks

For contributing to our campaign you can get the following. Amounts in US dollars.

5

  

A personalized thank you card from us

10

  

A Cool Batik Map of Indonesia

25

  

A 12oz bag of our coffee, roasted whole bean

40

  

Two 12oz bags of coffee

100

  

1 kg coffee + map + mug

3500

  

Origin Trip

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Tell all your friends. And we do mean all of the. Get the word out.  Everyone deserves good coffee
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's about it. Thanks for making it all the way to the bottom of this document.  We look forward to sending you some of our coffee.

story:
Short Summary 

  • My name is Ron Reaves, chef owner/operator, and proud veteran. Upon my service completion, I experienced difficulties dealing with the affects of PTSD which made it very difficult to maintain employment. It was not until I took the control of the reigns and became an entrepreneur that I was able to gain a sense of control of my destiny. 
  • My goal is to raise enough funds to hire two veterans affected by the affects of PTSD, and expand my company from a one man operation working out of a home kitchen,  to a full service personal chef/catering company. 
  • The magnitude of achieving my goal of expanding my company, and hiring veterans who have traveled the same journey of putting their lives back together is immeasurable. This is a win win for the veteran community I care deeply about. To be able to employ a veteran who gains a sense of control back over his/her life and is able to provide for their family is what kitchen Veteran LLC is about. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Looking to raise 200K which will be used to cover fixed expenses for commercial kitchen,  hire two veterans, marketing and branding, catering equipement.
  • To raise the capital need kitchen Veteran LLC is offering potential investors three ways to contribute. 1. Pre-order a bottle of jerk truffle infused hot sauce,  2. Personal chef services: three course dinner for two with complimentary wine, 3. Book catering services (75 guests)
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Kitchen Veteran LLC is for veterans,  created by veterans,  making a social impact in the lives of veterans. A portion of our profits help to fight against veterans dealing with food insecurity, and women's transition shelters:

  • Set percentage of profits go to providing food for current serving service members families dealing with food insecurity, and employing veterans.
  • To date, we have feed 700 veterans dealing with food insecurity.
  • Recent partnership with a veteran womans transition facility which allows women in need of shelter to reside with their children.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share the kitchen Veteran Indiegogo link with friends and your networks on social media
  • Cash app $KitchenVet

story:
My name is William Bryant and I’m a husband, father of 3 boys, DJ for over twenty years, and living a plant-based lifestyle for over six years. I created Juiceade to empower communities to take control of their health. I want to provide a cold-pressed juice bar in neighborhoods where it’s hard to find healthy food options. With your assistance I will create healthy and delicious juices and smoothies while educating and demonstrating how eating healthy can empower you.

 

The money raised will go towards the purchase of a new commercial grade cold press juicer and to the plumbing costs associates with the installation of two service sinks. As a “Thank you” for you much appreciated donation, we are offering enamel pins, hats, and t-shirts, and personal juice cleanse plans based on your donation level. If our full goal is not met, then the funds will go towards the purchase of used equipment and to start the plumbing process.

 

In a society ruled by cheap fast food franchises, I hope Juiceade can become a beacon on the road to getting healthy instead of swimming in a sea of junk food. Your body is your temple and we want to empower those that are looking for guidance to keep their temple running like a well-oiled machine. I speak from experience; through juicing and adopting a plant-based diet, I lost over 50 pounds without any exercise. I grew up in neighborhoods that didn’t have a lot of healthy options, you’d be hard pressed to find a piece of fruit in the local bodega. Most chronic diseases that affect the Black and Latino communities are preventable and directly related to the food you eat. That’s why I have made it my mission to empower these communities to take charge of their health.

 

I have experience working in a juicebar and plant-based restaurants to learn the business hands on and I can’t wait to embark on this journey with Juiceade. I appreciate any donation, big or small, it’s all love. Please help spread the word about my campaign on your social media, even if you can’ provide financial support at this time. Thank you!

story:
Calling all parents! Introducing the Hive, the only café and coworking space that gives you both the office and coffee shop vibe while also giving you last-minute care for your kids. We are so excited to be able to provide a hub for parents to work, visit, create, or just chill! Our goal is that when each of our customers walks in, they take a deep sigh of relief...similar to when your little one finally goes down for a nap.

Why did I create The Hive?

During the first few years when I became a mom, I was simply surviving. The stress from lack of having any time to myself began to overflow into my kids. I couldn’t be fully present with them, because I had so many other things on my mind. With zero form of normalcy and no real time to be an adult, I was forgetting the woman I was before I became a mom. That’s when I knew things had to change.

I believe it’s possible to become the strong woman you want to be — in addition to being a strong mom.  It starts by being able to find time to balance the roles of woman and mother, or parent and person, separately. You need time to be a human being!

Whether reading a book, watching a show, doing work, spending time with a friend where your attention isn’t distracted by keeping an eye on a roving toddler, The Hive in Austin is a space for you to explore whatever your heart desires to help you feel balanced, sane, and connected again.

What We Need & What You Get

Quick list of our perk options:

  • $20: Your buzz, our treat! You’ll receive a free coffee drink of your choice when you visit The Hive.
  • $60: Buzz and Play Hive coffee tumbler and 1 free hour of child play
  • $120: Childcare on us! You’ll get 3 hours of free childcare for 1 child.
  • $180: Childcare on us x2! You’ll get 3 hours of free childcare for 2 children.
  • $300: Wine and Earring Party Grab 10 of your friends and have some wine while making some fun jewelry
  • $400: Buzz for a Year Hive coffee tumbler and refills for a year (limit 2/mth)
  • $500: Get Your Party On Choose an after-hours adult party with $100 bar credit or a weekend kids party with snacks and juice
  • $1,000: Hive Signature Table Have a table at The Hive personalized with your company's logo for constant visibility
  • $2,000: After Hours party for 30! Free after hours adult party for up to 50 people with a $500 bar tab

Your dollars count! With YOUR support, we can invest in the vital tools of parental sanity restoration:

  • Places to be(e) like furniture & equipment essential for the café, lounge, patio, and play areas.
  • Ways to munch, including equipment and goodies for the food trailer.
  • Gettin’ the good stuff, like ample amounts of coffee, wine, and craft beer for all our incredible patrons — including you!

Don't have the funds right now?

That’s okay! Your word is worth gold! If you could please share our Indiegogo campaign (there are easy tools to do so) and get the word out to AS MANY PEOPLE AS POSSIBLE that would truly help our campaign.  Even if they don't live in Austin, you can pass it along to anyone that may want to support a young family trying to make a big impact for so many other parents!
story_txt:
Calling all parents! Introducing the Hive, the only café and coworking space that gives you both the office and coffee shop vibe while also giving you last-minute care for your kids. We are so excited to be able to provide a hub for parents to work, visit, create, or just chill! Our goal is that when each of our customers walks in, they take a deep sigh of relief...similar to when your little one finally goes down for a nap.Why did I create The Hive?During the first few years when I became a mom, I was simply surviving. The stress from lack of having any time to myself began to overflow into my kids. I couldn’t be fully present with them, because I had so many other things on my mind. With zero form of normalcy and no real time to be an adult, I was forgetting the woman I was before I became a mom. That’s when I knew things had to change.I believe it’s possible to become the strong woman you want to be — in addition to being a strong mom.  It starts by being able to find time to balance the roles of woman and mother, or parent and person, separately. You need time to be a human being!Whether reading a book, watching a show, doing work, spending time with a friend where your attention isn’t distracted by keeping an eye on a roving toddler, The Hive in Austin is a space for you to explore whatever your heart desires to help you feel balanced, sane, and connected again.What We Need & What You GetQuick list of our perk options:

$20: Your buzz, our treat! You’ll receive a free coffee drink of your choice when you visit The Hive.

$60: Buzz and Play Hive coffee tumbler and 1 free hour of child play

$120: Childcare on us! You’ll get 3 hours of free childcare for 1 child.

$180: Childcare on us x2! You’ll get 3 hours of free childcare for 2 children.

$300: Wine and Earring Party Grab 10 of your friends and have some wine while making some fun jewelry

$400: Buzz for a Year Hive coffee tumbler and refills for a year (limit 2/mth)

$500: Get Your Party On Choose an after-hours adult party with $100 bar credit or a weekend kids party with snacks and juice

$1,000: Hive Signature Table Have a table at The Hive personalized with your company's logo for constant visibility

$2,000: After Hours party for 30! Free after hours adult party for up to 50 people with a $500 bar tab
Your dollars count! With YOUR support, we can invest in the vital tools of parental sanity restoration: 
Places to be(e) like furniture & equipment essential for the café, lounge, patio, and play areas.
Ways to munch, including equipment and goodies for the food trailer.
Gettin’ the good stuff, like ample amounts of coffee, wine, and craft beer for all our incredible patrons — including you!
Don't have the funds right now?That’s okay! Your word is worth gold! If you could please share our Indiegogo campaign (there are easy tools to do so) and get the word out to AS MANY PEOPLE AS POSSIBLE that would truly help our campaign.  Even if they don't live in Austin, you can pass it along to anyone that may want to support a young family trying to make a big impact for so many other parents!

story:
What is Steve Buresh's Cheesecake Store & Sandwich Shop all about?

After losing my job in 2011 I felt I was going to lose everything. I started the Cheesecake Store to help to support my family while I looked for a new job. Jobs were hard to obtain with such a high unemployment rate, at the time. So, I strapped on my boots and walked and talked The Cheesecake Store to anyone that would listen. With help from my friends I kept going. On my own, I built a website to sell my products.  In order for me to sell to the public, I used a community commercial-rental kitchen.  I transformed my family vehicle into the the Cheesecake mobile, which then became a certified mobile vendor vehicle! The rental kitchen I used was far away from home, so I really needed a closer shop so everyone in Chicago can stop and have a cheesecake jar ,an awesomely fresh meal and a place to sit and chat. This place is now my home in Plainfield Illinois, but there's so many people that want a Cheesecake Store and Sandwich Shop in their neighborhood. I focus on my fan's needs, my staffers well being, and the entire community surrounding my shop. I want to keep building and helping more communities in the Chicagoland area. 

What We Need & What You Get.

The $9,000 that I am seeking will help me buy the equipment I need for the kitchen and all the ingredients I need to make food. I will have to find a location that is already health dept. certified and needs just paint and cleaning. I know I can do it with your help.

Even if I don't reach my funding goal, every little bit helps to get a step closer to making another store a reality in your community.

I've made some awesome perks for you helping me, and those are just the starting points. You will always be remembered as a part of my cheesecake family with many more perks after these.

Even if you can’t financially contribute, there are other ways to help:

Please help me get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.

Please use the Indiegogo share tools and Facebook share!

You can also message me if you would like to discuss helping out at fairs and events.

story: NA

The story so far...

Domenic and his wife, Tina, have been western PA natives since birth.  He’s been a butcher by trade since high school, and she’s done everything from food trucks to catering to running a coffee shop.  Now by their awesome powers combined, they plan to create their own business, one that provides a much-needed service to the neighborhood of Allentown.

The Black Market is a one-stop shop for deli meats and cheeses, fresh-cut meat, prepared foods, and other essential groceries.  We even offer a comfy space to sit down and enjoy a fresh cooked dinner.  It all started with our famous beef jerky we’ve been crafting for several years now.  From that simple venture, a flood of new ideas flowed.  A plan was in place to create everything in-house, from fresh oven-roasted turkey breast, to corned beef, to a bevy of sausages, and so much more.

All our ideas needed was a home, and as luck would have it, they would find a home inside “Breakfast at Shelly’s”.  An amazing diner with an unused deli space, sitting in the heart of a neighborhood desperately in need of a deli.

 It was perfect.  Well, almost perfect…

 

This is where you come in.

You see, the deli isn’t ready to go just quite yet.  Some work still needs done before we can get the green light and all the permits in place.  The floor will need retiled and the countertops will need refinished.  One of the deli cases also needs a little love from our friendly neighborhood HVAC man.  On top of this, we will need startup funds to build inventory, to spread the good word through advertising, and to buy some necessary pieces of equipment.

So, we turn to you for help.  But don’t think your financial assist won’t go unrewarded.  Aside from the obvious good karma and having a fantastic new place to eat, we plan to offer a ton of great unique rewards.  Ones that we feel will really get those charitable juices flowing.   

If we reach our goals, not only will you still have Shelly to provide some of the best breakfast and lunch in town for years to come, but now you can fill your fridge at home with some fantastic, one-of-a-kind products, created with the love and skill brought about by years of training and family tradition.  It’s our belief that not only will this benefit the people of Allentown dramatically, but this will bring men and woman from all over the city of Pittsburgh as well.

 Even if we don't reach our financial goal, we will put every dollar donated towards the most essential parts of our project to get ourselves up and running.  

And on the other side, if we exceed our goal, we will use that extra money to upgrade and purchase brand new equipment that will further expand what we can do in our establishment.  If we get enough extra cash, expect to see things like special humidity controlled coolers that help us craft dry-cured delights like salami and Prosciutto.     

 

Any new business faces plenty of risks and challenges, of course. 

One of our biggest risks is going up against the corporate food chains like Giant Eagle and Whole Foods.  It is our belief, though, that our products will be more than competitive, not just in price, but in quality and commitment.  We are confident we will earn the local support, not just of those on the hilltop, but of those across the city.

Another challenge we face comes from the building itself.  It, along with much of the equipment in it, has been around for a while and maintenance costs will be a concern.  In our business plan projections, I’ve factored those costs in and we still forecast to be on very stable footing.  

Lastly, as we progress, we will be working with the USDA to gain an important license that will help us sell key products outside of our shop.  This process, while somewhat daunting, has been one that I have worked on for years now and feel very confident (with the building in place) that we can now complete.  The benefit is that our brand will reach out, not just through the city, but over time, through other states as well.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate any and all contributions, but understand that some people can’t really commit financially.  Trust us, we get it.  But there are plenty of other ways you can help.  The biggest?  Spread the word.  Tell as many people you can.  The more the merrier.  Share this fundraiser with everyone you know and any local business that will listen.  Also, there may be a time when we need some help with renovations or a project.  If you got the talent and free time, hit us up!  We can pay you in meat and beer. 

 

LASTLY, THANK YOU

Thanks for reading this and helping in any way.  From the bottom of our meat-filled hearts, thank you.

 

Domenic & Tina Betters        

 

P.S. Special thanks to Brian Keegan of BrianKeeganVisuals.com for the great video, and Dougie Duerring of duerringphoto.com for the great jerky photos.

story:
Our new shop & workshop

Hey, I am Martina, owner of My3Cakes. I started my company 6 months ago with a goal that everyone can create their own cupcake flavor. In just a few months I wrote a business plan, put my idea into action and started off as an entrepreneur. I found myself doing the job of my dreams, I found my strengths, my qualities and my abilities to create a new and successful entrepreneurial story. My3Cakes are growing, developing and finding their place under the sun. Meetings, various events, conferences, networking, I am everywhere because I believe in my products and I want everyone to hear about them and try them. Many newspapers and media outlets have recognized my persistence and commitment and have written about my entrepreneurial venture which I am very grateful for. Big future awaits My3Cakes.

Now I want to expand and open a shop & workshop where you would literally be able to create your own cupcake. You found a recipe, decided to go and make a cupcake and then realized that either you didn't have the right sized pan, you were missing a decorating tip, or that you made a mistake during preparation and cupcakes were ruined.

For these reasons I want to create a space where you would get everything at one place: a place to work, all the necessary equipment and appliances, groceries and expert guidance so that you wouldn't have another cupcake catastrophe. Also, it would be a place where your kids could let their imagination go and create their own special cupcakes or cakepops.

I have a team who share my passion and want to see that dream transforming into reality. They are helping that everything goes right through this campaign and I am very grateful for their support.

You can support us as well by choosing one of the perks on the right. And make sure to tell your friends about My3Cakes shop & workshop by sharing our campaign through your social media profiles!

What's in it for me?

We're really excited to be able to offer our supporters the chance to be a part of the opening of our first shop & workshop. We have prepared lots of special rewards to thank them for getting involved.

Everyone who contributes will be able to enjoy badges, tea towels, aprons, tote bags, and copies of My3Cakes recipe book, along with boxes of cupcakes, and free baking classes. Special My3Cakes cupcake in a form of a stuffed toy will be offered in a limited edition, as a perfect present for our little ones.

We'll get in touch immediately following the end of the campaign to give you everything you need to come and claim your cupcakes once the shop & workshop opens. All Indiegogo supporters will have one year to claim their cupcakes, and can claim a maximum of two boxes per visit.

Why open shop & workshop?

The shop would have a commercial area and a separate area for production. Since the story about cupcakes is spreading very quickly we want to hire more people so that My3Cakes would become a brand famous for its quality and tasty products. For this reason we need more space to start a bigger production and to hire at least two more people. Cupcakes, cupcake cakes & cakepops will be sold in front of the production area. We will have a daily offer from our wide range of cupcake flavors. Since we plan to open around Christmas we will have lots of work, but we are excited to see lots of families enjoy our special cupcakes soon.

 

In the commercial area of the shop we will plan to hold cupcake classes, workshops and cupcake birthdays for children. Here, people would have the opportunity to come and rent a kitchen for a few hours and make their own cupcakes using all available tools and equipment.

Risks & Challenges

We want to raise money to buy professional appliances and to open a new shop & workshop. We have few locations on hold and in the next month we will decide where to open the new My3Cakes shop & workshop. We are very determined and ready to start this project and finish it by December 2018. 

We know that the timeline might be tight, but we have already contacted contractors and architects who are waiting our confirmation about the location so the work can start. We are confident we can hit our goal of opening in time for Christmas, but any delays we do incur will not affect our supporters' ability to redeem their rewards when the shop & workhop does open.

We're ready to face the multitude of risks and challenges that are sure to come with the opening of our first shop & workshop, but we believe that we can achieve our goal and set our first My3Cakes shop & workshop in Zagreb.

Foto: Martina Cvek photography

Let's make the world a better place, one cupcake at a time!

Support us by choosing one of the perks on the right. Make sure to tell your friends about My3Cakes shop & workshop by sharing our campaign through your social media profiles!

YOU CAN READ ABOUT MY3CAKES AT:

http://my3cakes.hr/

https://www.facebook.com/my3cakes/

 

YOU HAVE ADDITIONAL QUESTION? 

Feel free to contact us for any questions regarding My3Cakes shop & workshop at martina@my3cakes.hr  

********************************************************************

Naš novi prodajni prostor i radionica

Bok, ja sam Martina, vlasnica My3Cakes. Pokrenula sam vlastitu tvrtku prije 6 mjeseci s ciljem da svatko može kreirati slasticu po svojem ukusu. U samo nekoliko mjeseci napisala sam poslovni plan, pokrenula svoju ideju i krenula u poduzetništvo. Pronašla sam se u tome, otkrila svoju snagu, svoje prednosti, kvalitete i sposobnosti da kreiram jednu novu i uspješnu poduzetničku priču. My3Cakes raste, razvija se, pronalazi svoje mjesto pod suncem. Sastanci, razni eventi, konferencije, networking, svugdje sam jer vjerujem u svoje proizvode i želim da svi čuju o njima i da ih probaju. Mnoge novine i portali prepoznali su moju upornost i predanost te pisali o mom poduzetničkom pothvatu na čemu sam im iznimno zahvalna. My3Cakes čeka velika budućnost, u to sam uvjerena.

Želim otvoriti prodavaonicu i radionicu u koju ćete vi moći doći i doslovno napraviti cupcake baš po svojem ukusu. Sigurno vam se dogodilo da ste odlučili napraviti cupcake po nekom receptu i onda shvatili da ili nemate odgovarajući kalup za izradu, ili vam nedostaje neki nastavak za ukrašavanje, ili se prilikom izrade dogodila neka pogreška i cupcake nije uspio.

Iz tih razloga želim otvoriti kuhinju u kojoj ćete dobiti sve na jednom mjestu: prostor za rad, opremu i aparate, namirnice i stručno vodstvo da se ne dogodi cupcake katastrofa. To bi također bilo i mjesto gdje bi i vaši klinci mogli pustiti mašti na volju i kreirati svoje posebne cupcakese ili cakepopse.

Imam iza sebe tim ljudi koji dijeli moj entuzijazam i želi vidjeti kako moj san postaje stvarnost. Pomažu mi da sve prođe kako treba u ovoj kampanji i na tome sam im neizmjerno zahvalna.

Možete nas podržati odabirom jednog od perk-ova na desnoj strani. I recite svojim prijateljima o priči My3Cakes prodavaonice & radionice tako da podijelite našu kampanju preko svojih profila na društvenim mrežama!

 

Što dobivate ovom kampanjom?

Jako smo uzbuđeni što možemo našim pokroviteljima dati priliku da postanu dio priče otvaranja naše prve prodavaonice & radionice. Pripremili smo mnoštvo specijalnih nagrada kako bismo im zahvalili na sudjelovanju.

Kao znak zahvale predviđene su brojne nagrade: specijalni bedževi, kuhinjske krpe, pregače, velike torbe, My3Cakes kuharice, kutije cupcakesa te besplatni tečajevi izrade cupcakesa. Poseban My3Cakes plišanac bit će u ograničenoj ponudi kao idealan dar za najmlađe.

Kontaktirat ćemo vas odmah po završetku kampanje kako biste dobili sve potrebne informacije za preuzimanje svoje nagrade u trenutku kada se prodavaonica & radionica otvori. Svi Indiegogo pokrovitelji imat će godinu dana za prikup svojim cupcakesa, i mogu zatražiti najviše dva pakiranja po dolasku.

 

Zašto otvaramo prodavaonicu & radionicu?

Prostor bi sadržavao kuhinju za komercijalne svrhe te kuhinju za proizvodnju. Budući da se priča o cupcakesima uspješno širi želimo zaposliti još ljudi kako bi My3Cakes postao sinonim kvalitetnih i ukusnih proizvoda. Zato trebamo veći prostor kako bismo mogli povećati proizvodnju i zaposliti najmanje dvoje ljudi. Cupcakesi, cupcake torte & cakepopsi bi se prodavali ispred proizvodnog dijela. Imali bismo dnevnu ponudu raznovrsnih slastica. Budući da je planirano otvorenje do Božića imati ćemo puno posla, ali smo jako uzbuđeni uskoro vidjeti brojne obitelji kako dolaze uživati u posebnoj cupcake ponudi.  

U komercijalnom prostoru prodavaonice planiramo održavati tečajeve, radionice i cupcake rođendanske proslave za djecu. Ovdje bi ljudi imali mogućnost unajmiti kuhinju na nekoliko sati i prirediti vlastite cupcakese koristeći svu potrebnu opremu.

 

Rizici i izazovi

Želimo prikupiti novac za nabavku profesionalne slastičarske opreme te kako bismo mogli otvoriti novu prodavaonicu & radionicu. Trenutno je nekoliko potencijalnih lokacija na čekanju te ćemo u sljedećih mjesec dana odlučiti gdje ćemo otvoriti My3Cakes prodavaonicu & radionicu. Odlučno započinjemo ovaj projekt i planiramo ga završiti do prosinca 2018. godine.

Svjesni smo da je vremenski rok malo kratak, ali već smo kontaktirali sve izvođače i arhitekte koji čekaju potvrdu lokacije kako bi radovi mogli početi. Uvjereni smo da možemo dostići cilj otvorenja do Božića, a bilo koja zakašnjenja u rokovima do kojih bi moglo putem doći neće utjecati na naše pokrovitelje koji će moći prikupiti svoje nagrade čim se prodavaonica & radionica otvori.

Spremni smo suočiti se s mnoštvo rizika i izazova koji će doći s otvaranjem prodajnog prostora, ali vjerujemo da možemo postići sve što smo si zacrtali i otvoriti prvi My3Cakes prodavaonicu & radionicu u Zagrebu.

Učinimo svijet ljepšim, cupcake po cupcake!

Podržite nas odabirom jedne od nagrada na desnoj strani. I recite svojim prijateljima o priči My3Cakes prodavaonice & radionice tako da podijelite našu kampanju preko svojih profila na društvenim mrežama!

Više informacija o My3Cakes možete pronaći na:

http://my3cakes.hr/

https://www.facebook.com/my3cakes/

 

Imate li dodatnih pitanja? 

Slobodno nam se javite za sva pitanja vezana uz My3Cakes prodavaonicu & radionicu na martina@my3cakes.hr

You can support us as well by choosing one of the perks on the right. And make sure to tell your friends about My3Cakes shop & workshop by sharing our campaign through your social media profiles!

What's in it for me?

We're really excited to be able to offer our supporters the chance to be a part of the opening of our first shop & workshop. We have prepared lots of special rewards to thank them for getting involved.
Everyone who contributes will be able to enjoy badges, tea towels, aprons, tote bags, and copies of My3Cakes recipe book, along with boxes of cupcakes, and free baking classes. Special My3Cakes cupcake in a form of a stuffed toy will be offered in a limited edition, as a perfect present for our little ones.
We'll get in touch immediately following the end of the campaign to give you everything you need to come and claim your cupcakes once the shop & workshop opens. All Indiegogo supporters will have one year to claim their cupcakes, and can claim a maximum of two boxes per visit.


Why open shop & workshop?
The shop would have a commercial area and a separate area for production. Since the story about cupcakes is spreading very quickly we want to hire more people so that My3Cakes would become a brand famous for its quality and tasty products. For this reason we need more space to start a bigger production and to hire at least two more people. Cupcakes, cupcake cakes & cakepops will be sold in front of the production area. We will have a daily offer from our wide range of cupcake flavors. Since we plan to open around Christmas we will have lots of work, but we are excited to see lots of families enjoy our special cupcakes soon.
 
In the commercial area of the shop we will plan to hold cupcake classes, workshops and cupcake birthdays for children. Here, people would have the opportunity to come and rent a kitchen for a few hours and make their own cupcakes using all available tools and equipment.


Risks & Challenges
We want to raise money to buy professional appliances and to open a new shop & workshop. We have few locations on hold and in the next month we will decide where to open the new My3Cakes shop & workshop. We are very determined and ready to start this project and finish it by December 2018. 
We know that the timeline might be tight, but we have already contacted contractors and architects who are waiting our confirmation about the location so the work can start. We are confident we can hit our goal of opening in time for Christmas, but any delays we do incur will not affect our supporters' ability to redeem their rewards when the shop & workhop does open.
We're ready to face the multitude of risks and challenges that are sure to come with the opening of our first shop & workshop, but we believe that we can achieve our goal and set our first My3Cakes shop & workshop in Zagreb.

Foto: Martina Cvek photography

Let's make the world a better place, one cupcake at a time!
Support us by choosing one of the perks on the right. Make sure to tell your friends about My3Cakes shop & workshop by sharing our campaign through your social media profiles!
YOU CAN READ ABOUT MY3CAKES AT:
http://my3cakes.hr/
https://www.facebook.com/my3cakes/
 
YOU HAVE ADDITIONAL QUESTION? 
Feel free to contact us for any questions regarding My3Cakes shop & workshop at martina@my3cakes.hr  
********************************************************************
Naš novi prodajni prostor i radionica
Bok, ja sam Martina, vlasnica My3Cakes. Pokrenula sam vlastitu tvrtku prije 6 mjeseci s ciljem da svatko može kreirati slasticu po svojem ukusu. U samo nekoliko mjeseci napisala sam poslovni plan, pokrenula svoju ideju i krenula u poduzetništvo. Pronašla sam se u tome, otkrila svoju snagu, svoje prednosti, kvalitete i sposobnosti da kreiram jednu novu i uspješnu poduzetničku priču. My3Cakes raste, razvija se, pronalazi svoje mjesto pod suncem. Sastanci, razni eventi, konferencije, networking, svugdje sam jer vjerujem u svoje proizvode i želim da svi čuju o njima i da ih probaju. Mnoge novine i portali prepoznali su moju upornost i predanost te pisali o mom poduzetničkom pothvatu na čemu sam im iznimno zahvalna. My3Cakes čeka velika budućnost, u to sam uvjerena.
Želim otvoriti prodavaonicu i radionicu u koju ćete vi moći doći i doslovno napraviti cupcake baš po svojem ukusu. Sigurno vam se dogodilo da ste odlučili napraviti cupcake po nekom receptu i onda shvatili da ili nemate odgovarajući kalup za izradu, ili vam nedostaje neki nastavak za ukrašavanje, ili se prilikom izrade dogodila neka pogreška i cupcake nije uspio.
Iz tih razloga želim otvoriti kuhinju u kojoj ćete dobiti sve na jednom mjestu: prostor za rad, opremu i aparate, namirnice i stručno vodstvo da se ne dogodi cupcake katastrofa. To bi također bilo i mjesto gdje bi i vaši klinci mogli pustiti mašti na volju i kreirati svoje posebne cupcakese ili cakepopse.
Imam iza sebe tim ljudi koji dijeli moj entuzijazam i želi vidjeti kako moj san postaje stvarnost. Pomažu mi da sve prođe kako treba u ovoj kampanji i na tome sam im neizmjerno zahvalna.
Možete nas podržati odabirom jednog od perk-ova na desnoj strani. I recite svojim prijateljima o priči My3Cakes prodavaonice & radionice tako da podijelite našu kampanju preko svojih profila na društvenim mrežama!
 
Što dobivate ovom kampanjom?
Jako smo uzbuđeni što možemo našim pokroviteljima dati priliku da postanu dio priče otvaranja naše prve prodavaonice & radionice. Pripremili smo mnoštvo specijalnih nagrada kako bismo im zahvalili na sudjelovanju.
Kao znak zahvale predviđene su brojne nagrade: specijalni bedževi, kuhinjske krpe, pregače, velike torbe, My3Cakes kuharice, kutije cupcakesa te besplatni tečajevi izrade cupcakesa. Poseban My3Cakes plišanac bit će u ograničenoj ponudi kao idealan dar za najmlađe.
Kontaktirat ćemo vas odmah po završetku kampanje kako biste dobili sve potrebne informacije za preuzimanje svoje nagrade u trenutku kada se prodavaonica & radionica otvori. Svi Indiegogo pokrovitelji imat će godinu dana za prikup svojim cupcakesa, i mogu zatražiti najviše dva pakiranja po dolasku.
 
Zašto otvaramo prodavaonicu & radionicu?
Prostor bi sadržavao kuhinju za komercijalne svrhe te kuhinju za proizvodnju. Budući da se priča o cupcakesima uspješno širi želimo zaposliti još ljudi kako bi My3Cakes postao sinonim kvalitetnih i ukusnih proizvoda. Zato trebamo veći prostor kako bismo mogli povećati proizvodnju i zaposliti najmanje dvoje ljudi. Cupcakesi, cupcake torte & cakepopsi bi se prodavali ispred proizvodnog dijela. Imali bismo dnevnu ponudu raznovrsnih slastica. Budući da je planirano otvorenje do Božića imati ćemo puno posla, ali smo jako uzbuđeni uskoro vidjeti brojne obitelji kako dolaze uživati u posebnoj cupcake ponudi.  
U komercijalnom prostoru prodavaonice planiramo održavati tečajeve, radionice i cupcake rođendanske proslave za djecu. Ovdje bi ljudi imali mogućnost unajmiti kuhinju na nekoliko sati i prirediti vlastite cupcakese koristeći svu potrebnu opremu.
 
Rizici i izazovi
Želimo prikupiti novac za nabavku profesionalne slastičarske opreme te kako bismo mogli otvoriti novu prodavaonicu & radionicu. Trenutno je nekoliko potencijalnih lokacija na čekanju te ćemo u sljedećih mjesec dana odlučiti gdje ćemo otvoriti My3Cakes prodavaonicu & radionicu. Odlučno započinjemo ovaj projekt i planiramo ga završiti do prosinca 2018. godine.
Svjesni smo da je vremenski rok malo kratak, ali već smo kontaktirali sve izvođače i arhitekte koji čekaju potvrdu lokacije kako bi radovi mogli početi. Uvjereni smo da možemo dostići cilj otvorenja do Božića, a bilo koja zakašnjenja u rokovima do kojih bi moglo putem doći neće utjecati na naše pokrovitelje koji će moći prikupiti svoje nagrade čim se prodavaonica & radionica otvori.
Spremni smo suočiti se s mnoštvo rizika i izazova koji će doći s otvaranjem prodajnog prostora, ali vjerujemo da možemo postići sve što smo si zacrtali i otvoriti prvi My3Cakes prodavaonicu & radionicu u Zagrebu.
Učinimo svijet ljepšim, cupcake po cupcake!
Podržite nas odabirom jedne od nagrada na desnoj strani. I recite svojim prijateljima o priči My3Cakes prodavaonice & radionice tako da podijelite našu kampanju preko svojih profila na društvenim mrežama!
Više informacija o My3Cakes možete pronaći na:
http://my3cakes.hr/
https://www.facebook.com/my3cakes/
 
Imate li dodatnih pitanja? 
Slobodno nam se javite za sva pitanja vezana uz My3Cakes prodavaonicu & radionicu na martina@my3cakes.hr

story:
Who we are

As a group of friends who have been making craft beer using a natural method at home for over ten years, we kept hearing the same concerns when we tried to persuade others to do the same -it is too complicated, messy, time-consuming and makes poor results. 
We set out to develop a method as uncomplicated, jargon-free and as easy to follow as possible -without compromising quality. We wanted people to realise, especially more younger and female craft beer fans, that there is a better way to brew.

We wanted our kit to be convenient, practical and to have great design values. We wanted to break away from the stigma of brewing at home as the preserve of old men. After more than two years of research, sourcing and testing, speaking to many professional and amateur brewers along the way, we came up with The Kitbag Brewery

Our kit makes a really good volume of really high quality beer (over 13 Litres, more than most stove-top kits), with recipes specially adapted for us by our friends at Northern Monk Brew Co.


We aim to run a highly ethical and sustainable business. Wherever possible we've used natural materials and local suppliers for our kit (such as our lovely friends in Lancashire who make and embroider our Kitbags by hand).

 

How you can help us

We have no other financial backers and need your funding to help us secure the premises we need (from which to run our business and for our future plans to run beer making workshops). We have a target of £12,000 to cover initial rent, stock and other overheads. 

You can support us in three ways:

  • Buy our Kitbag Brewery ( A limited-edition hand-embroidered bag at a special discount) via this page
  • Buy an item of our merchandise or other rewards, including some organic cotton T-Shirts, embroidered hats, Aprons and our luxury mini-Kitbag and a very special brewday at Northern Monk brewery in Leeds
  • Make a donation (any amount) for a special mention on our website
  • Help us by spreading the word

We will only access the funds if we are in a position to deliver the rewards to our backers on time. If we are unable to deliver the rewards all funds will be returned to our backers. 

 

What your help will mean to us 

We really believe in what we do and see The Kitbag Brewery as potentially changing people's attitudes to brewing at home. Your help is vital to us.
We have some very exciting development ideas including having a dedicated workshop space and exciting collaborations.

story:
Let’s get saucy ...

Reo, more famously known as Uncle Reo (Snoop Doggs Uncle) is a simple man who sings like an angel and spreads his love of family, friends and gospel through his passion of cooking.

My name is Lisa Jolly and I met Reo last year in Inglewood Los Angeles, funny story ..I met him on a park bench after I had been for a run! We got talking and before I knew it Reo had invited me to Snoop Doggs House for a family BBQ! 

Who would know a girl from New Zealand would end up at Snoop Doggs house for a family BBQ!  

Anyway, I went by myself, very scared actually and Reo met me at the gate, Reos family and friends and Snoop embraced my company and we spent time around the grill laughing, singing and sharing Reos heavenly cooking and sauce!!!!  

Reo was still very emotional about his beloved restaurant burning to the ground, as it was a fresh situation at that time, so after many chicken wings, ribs and sauce I piped up the courage to tell him we should bottle this sauce, sell it and get this restaurant up and running again ...so here we are!

So for me, I’m now walking the walk and thought what better way to launch the sauce than to also mean the funds can be used for the rebuild, help Reo get back into his passion of being the much loved soulful singing cook in the community whilst taking the BEST BBQ sauce to the nation! 

Its a win win... saucy grin! 

 

What we need ... what you will get ..time to #dropitlikeitshot!

It’s pretty simple really ..

We need to ...

- Sell 10000 bottles of Reos Mississippi Sauce

This will mean ...

- You get a bottle of the BEST BBQ sauce in the entire world as said by myself, and as featured on Martha Stewart’s cooking Show.

- Uncle Reo can purchase a new walk refrigerator for the restaurant, contribute to the steal metal frames for the structure of the restaurant as now required by the city.

- Reo can sing happy songs instead of sad songs and make more sauce.

- Myra, Reos business partner in the restaurant can stop using the grill at her house, and stop worrying about the wages which are still being paid, even though the restaurant rebuild is 6 months behind schedule.

- I myself will hopefully get another invite to Snoops House! 

Risks & Challenges

The only risk Is that I see is sauce addiction ... a real thing! I took 6 bottles back to New Zealand to my husband and family and now when I’m cooking everyone calls out ...’make sure it’s got Reos on it’ ....now I’ve run out!!!!  It could be a serious risk!

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course your help will be cherished!

We would love it when you buy your Reos Mississippi BBQ sauce if you could help us launch a fun campaign on instagram!

Simply post a cool pic of your Reos Sauce in a sassy location with the #whereisunclereo and tell everyone how yummy the sauce is! Trade secret Beyoncé is even a fan of Reos Cooking!

Or surprise us and be into win T shirts and other fun prizes for the best pic! 

 

 

So so as a final note, meeting Reo, Myra and his sauce has changed my life! From New Zealand to here and loving every minute I hope you will support us and our saucy team to make this campaign a big success!

With Love and thanks 

Reo, Lisa and Myra x o

story:
Notre mission

L'équipe de La Cuillère Gourmande se donne pour mission de faire découvrir ou redécouvrir au Montréalais  la richesse de la cuisine haïtienne, tout en apportant un brin de nouveauté et en ayant le souci d’une cuisine plus santé.

Notre équipe 

L'équipe de La Cuillère Gourmande se compose, entre autres, de Marcathia Chalut, instigatrice du projet, promotrice principale et propriétaire; d'Emmanuella Chalut, cuisinière d'expérience, présentement cuisinière au restaurant Foiegwa dans Saint-Henri; et de Ralph Roméus, administrateur et passionné d’art culinaire.  

À ce noyau se greffent plusieurs autres personnes, que vous aurez l'occasion de rencontrer lors de nos événements et, bientôt, comme nous l'espérons, à notre restaurant sur le Plateau.  

Nous nous sommes aussi entourés de mentors, entre autres Marcus Sahou, chef et propriétaire du Foiegwa, qui s'intéresse à notre projet et veut nous épauler. Ces mentors sauront nous guider et nous conseiller tout au long de cette grande aventure. 

Résumé du projet

La Cuillère Gourmande est un service de traiteur qui s’inspire de la cuisine haïtienne pour son menu, tout en tenant compte de l'évolution des goûts : certains plats sans porc, végétariens ou végétaliens pour les clients qui le désirent, ainsi que cuisine totalement sans GMS.

La Cuillère Gourmande a débuté le 28 novembre 2015 avec la livraison à domicile de plats cuisinés, à laquelle s'est ajouté un service de traiteur pour des événements culturels ou autres.

Depuis 2015, notre service de traiteur a été choisi pour de nombreux événements (dont le festival de films Massimadi, la Fête des familles de Mercier, etc.). De plus, nous vendons certains produits  comme le pikliz, la crémasse (auquel on n'a qu'à ajouter l'alcool), la chiquetaille et la  marinade «tout trempé», des classiques de la cuisine haïtienne. 

En 2018, l'équipe désire aller plus loin dans son projet en louant un espace commercial sur le Plateau pour y tenir un restaurant ayant une salle à manger de 20 à 30 personnes, un permis d’alcool et, si possible, une terrasse. [Mise à jour: nous opterons non pas pour un restaurant, mais plutôt pour un comptoir, dans un premier temps.] 

En ce moment, nous sommes en campagne de financement pour diverses raisons, dont les suivantes: 

• acheter de l'équipement de cuisine (poêle au gaz, friteuses, frigos, comptoirs, vaisselle et instruments divers);

• payer les premiers mois de loyer et les premières taxes commerciales associées au local; 

• payer les denrées et rémunérer les employées pendant les premiers mois, jusqu'à ce que le restaurant soit davantage connu et qu'une clientèle soit établie. 

Pour amasser des fonds, nous effectuons, en plus de cette campagne de financement participatif sur indiegogo, les démarches suivantes: 

• Participation au concours Portes ouvertes sur Saint-Denis (possibilité d'obtenir une bourse de 10 000$ à 25 000$), où nous avons réussi à accéder à la deuxième étape [mise à jour: nous n'avons pas obtenu de bourse, mais nous allons bien sûr continuer à faire avancer notre projet]; 

• Démarches auprès de différents organismes, comme le SAJE, la JCCH, la Fondation du maire pour la jeunesse (bourses pour les jeunes artistes et entrepreneurs), diverses associations d’entrepreneurs du Québec, la BDC et Futurpreneur Canada (anciennement FCJE).

Bref, nous faisons tout ce que nous pouvons pour obtenir du soutien financier pour notre projet. 

Contreparties

Vous pouvez faire des dons de n'importe quel montant, sans associer votre don à une «contrepartie» (en cliquant sur le carré rose où il est inscrit «Soutenez ce projet», juste à droite du bas de la première photo). Cependant, pour remercier les personnes qui font des dons un peu plus substantiels, nous offrons des contreparties:

à partir d'un don de 100 $, vous recevrez un panier-cadeau contenant du pikliz, de la chiquetaille et de la marinade tout trempé;

à partir d'un don de 500 $, nous vous donnerons un panier-cadeau contenant les trois produits mentionnés et une bouteille de crémasse;

à partir d'un don de 1000 $, vous obtiendrez le panier avec les trois produits, la crémasse et un repas pour deux personnes (entrées, plat principal, dessert et deux consommations).

Si jamais l'objectif n'était pas atteint...

Nous avons choisi une campagne «flexible», ce qui fait que nous recevrons les dons, que l'objectif soit atteint ou non (contrairement à ce qui arrive dans les campagnes «fixes»). De plus, nous allons continuer les démarches pour trouver des investisseurs et des partenaires pour réaliser notre grand rêve.

Nous croyons réellement en notre projet et nous espérons que vous y croirez aussi!
