• payer les denrées et rémunérer les employées pendant les premiers mois, jusqu'à ce que le restaurant soit davantage connu et qu'une clientèle soit établie. 
Pour amasser des fonds, nous effectuons, en plus de cette campagne de financement participatif sur indiegogo, les démarches suivantes: 
• Participation au concours Portes ouvertes sur Saint-Denis (possibilité d'obtenir une bourse de 10 000$ à 25 000$), où nous avons réussi à accéder à la deuxième étape [mise à jour: nous n'avons pas obtenu de bourse, mais nous allons bien sûr continuer à faire avancer notre projet]; 
• Démarches auprès de différents organismes, comme le SAJE, la JCCH, la Fondation du maire pour la jeunesse (bourses pour les jeunes artistes et entrepreneurs), diverses associations d’entrepreneurs du Québec, la BDC et Futurpreneur Canada (anciennement FCJE).
Bref, nous faisons tout ce que nous pouvons pour obtenir du soutien financier pour notre projet. 
Contreparties
Vous pouvez faire des dons de n'importe quel montant, sans associer votre don à une «contrepartie» (en cliquant sur le carré rose où il est inscrit «Soutenez ce projet», juste à droite du bas de la première photo). Cependant, pour remercier les personnes qui font des dons un peu plus substantiels, nous offrons des contreparties:
à partir d'un don de 100 $, vous recevrez un panier-cadeau contenant du pikliz, de la chiquetaille et de la marinade tout trempé;
à partir d'un don de 500 $, nous vous donnerons un panier-cadeau contenant les trois produits mentionnés et une bouteille de crémasse;
à partir d'un don de 1000 $, vous obtiendrez le panier avec les trois produits, la crémasse et un repas pour deux personnes (entrées, plat principal, dessert et deux consommations).
Si jamais l'objectif n'était pas atteint...
Nous avons choisi une campagne «flexible», ce qui fait que nous recevrons les dons, que l'objectif soit atteint ou non (contrairement à ce qui arrive dans les campagnes «fixes»). De plus, nous allons continuer les démarches pour trouver des investisseurs et des partenaires pour réaliser notre grand rêve.
Nous croyons réellement en notre projet et nous espérons que vous y croirez aussi!

story:
Why bees?

Since I (Ervin) was a little boy, I always liked bees and honey. Years ago, I began my own honey business. During the process I became fascinated with how bees work and live. They taught me many useful things.

When I came to Matteson a year ago, I saw they did not have bees and thought "how nice it would be to begin beekeeping here as well". As I shared this project with my classmates and staff, Nenad and Sonja where very eager to join and help, and as the project developed they became more and more fascinated about the project and exited to work in it. When we presented it to the school comittee, they where very positive about the idea. They encouraged us to get started and assured us of their support.

Why would it be so good to have bees at Maatteson? Here are five reasons:

1. Honey production
The most obsious reason is honey. The honey produced is not only beneficial for us, but will also be sold to other people and in that way produce income.

2. Pollination

60% of all the fruits and vegetables we consume are produces because bees travel form flower to flower, pollinating them as they go. If bees go extinct, we might soon join them.

3. Practical experience

Some of my fellow students will be assisting us with the project. In this way they will also learn how to handle the bees. Beekeeping is a skill that will be able to use wherever they/we may be called to serve in the future. For full-time missionaries in self-supporting ministries, this skill will prove invaluable in reducing food costs and generating revenue.

4. Object Lessons

God has implanted important spiritual lessons in His creation. Bees are not an exception. Bees are magnificent.Think of the following examples listed below.

  • Industrious - Bees are always working
  • Clean - Bees are tidy and orderly
  • Loyal - Bees follow the rules of the hive, and work in harmony
  • Unselfish - Bees give their lives for a common cause
  • Democratic - There is a leader (queen), but the supreme power rests in the workers
  • Cooperative - 12 bees work their whole lifes to produce a single teaspoon of honey
  • Development - As the bee grows, it takes bigger responsabilities.
  • procreative - When the bee population exceedes capacity,  group of workers leaves the hive to form a new one somwhere else.

​5. Contact with local community

Selling honey will bring us into closer contact with the local community so we can reach more people.

 For these five reasons, we are very eager to have bees.

 

Startup costs

We shall begin with four hives. The following is a list of our needs and costs 

  • Four bee boxes - 800 Euros
  • Harvesting material- 220 Euros
  • Special clothing - 60 Euros
  • Miscellaneous material - 470 Euros
  • Bees - 1500 Euros

We need a total of 3050 Euros to get started.

 

How Can you Help?

By giving a donation, you can help reach our goal of 3050 Euros to make this project a reality! Also please share this with your friends, family and collegaues.

 

Bee-friending you,

Ervin Rhys, Sonja Tanttari and Nenad Petric.

story:
Background

Mike D's BBQ just celebrated 5 full years of being in business! What started as owner Mike D making sauces and rubs for large cookouts and being encouraged by friends and family has grown from startup into being ready for the next phase. Over the last 5 years, Mike D's BBQ has launched 4 products, grown from self producing the dry rubs to having them produced at a larger scale along with our BBQ sauces. We have shipped products to all 50 states and 4 countries, and have products in 9 independently owned stores across North Carolina. We have partnered with BBQ cook teams who have won several top 10 finishes using our products, and have won awards for each of our products including a World Champion, a Grand Champion, and best in state two years in a row. Additionally, we've had 3 other top 3 in the world finishes.  As we enter year 6, it is time for us to take the next phase of growth. Mike D has long been fond of General Stores (probably stems from his love of old western films), and wanting to combine that with a BBQ Supply Store.

For people who love to grill and BBQ, the most common place to go and get what you need requires a trip to a big box store where the employees just see grills and smokers as another tool in the store. They are not passionate about BBQ and the art of grilling and smoking food. We believe it would be so much better to get all your outdoor cooking needs from a store owned and run by someone who lives for BBQ. We believe it would be a much more fulfilling experience for everyone! In addition to the BBQ items, we want to focus on other products by minority and woman owned businesses across North Carolina!  That is the next phase for our company and we couldn't be more excited about it!

We love Durham, NC, and have loved it since moving here in December of 2007. The Bull City continues to grow in reputation for a foodie city, and we want to make our mark there as a go to destination for all things BBQ!

What We Need & What You Get

The total cost of getting Mike D's BBQ Supply and General store ready is an estimated $40,000.  Our goal through this campaign is to raise $25,000 to add to the already committed funds. Until we are able to finalize the location, it will be too hard to lock down the cost for the build-out. As a result, we are focusing on locations that do not need to be fixed up so we can focus on the fitting it to our needs instead of a complete build-out. 

Here is a breakdown of how we are budgeting the $40,000 for the project:

  • Construction - $18,000 - We met with contractors who understand our vision for the space and as long as the location is in good condition believe the cost will be $15,000, to ensure room for unknown variables, we are budgeting at a higher number.:
  • Inventory/Equipment - $15,000 - To have a complete BBQ supply and General Store we need inventory. We will feature our award winning line of BBQ Sauces and Seasonings, but will also focus on featuring other products from minority and woman owned businesses in North Carolina to fill out our inventory. There will be grills, smokers, grill tools, charcaol, wood, pellets, and assortment of other grilling/smoking essentials. Additionally, there will be drinks, snacks, and other General Store items.
  • Reserve Fund - $7,000 - Since we know we cannot predict everything, we are budgeting this reserve fund to cover any unexpected costs with construction and inventory. If this fund is not needed, these budgeted monies will be used as a capital reserve fund for operations purposes.

The funds raised through this campaign will be disbursed across these line items. If we don't reach our entire goal of $25,000 through this effort, the funds raised will still be used for these line items. We will adjust construction and inventory costs to ensure that we still achieve our goals with the store and will continue to work to raise additional funds. 

Perks:

We want to be able to give you something as a thanks for supporting us. Here is a breakdown of what we are offering:

$10 - Thank You - A handwritten thank you letter from the owner Mike D, and public thank you on social media if you are okay with your name being public and a code for 15% off your online order or in store once it opens.

$25 - Wall of Fame - In addition to the perks from the Thank You level, you will also get your name on the Wall of Fame in our store. We want everyone who visits to be able to see who helped make it a reality!

$75 - Brand Ambassador - All of previous perks plus a t-shirt featuring our brand and slogan!

$125 - Grill Master - All of previous perks plus an apron and a pig shaped bottle opener! handcrafted in Benson, NC!

$300 - Smoke Master - All of previous perks plus 6 bottles of BBQ Sauce and 6 bottles of dry rub and you choose the breakdown of products!

$600 - Feast Master - All of previous perks plus a BBQ feast for 4 adults prepared by Mike D himself! Depending on how far outside of North Carolina you live modifications of how this is achieved can be discussed!

$2,000 - Own the Aisle - All of the previous perks plus you get your name over a section of the store - for example BBQ Supplies Sponsored by [insert name here]!

The Impact

As a small growing business, access to capital has been challenging and expensive. Your support makes this a viable project. Without it, it may take us several more years to build the business profile needed to acquire the capital needed for a project like this! Mike D's BBQ is nothing without our customers, they have gotten us this far. We are nothing without the support of our community who helped us launch 5 years ago and expand our products 3 years ago. Without that support we would not be here, and without it, we cannot get to the next phase of our business! We can truly say that without your support this dream would not be a reality at this stage.

Risks & Challenges

  • Finding a location - since we have not secured the location and are actively looking there is a risk that we can't find a suitable location in Durham. If this is the case we will expand our search to the greater Triangle Area
  • Condition of location - If the location is in bad shape and the cost to repair and then customize could be too great for our proposed budget and put the project at risk. To address this we will focus on good condition locations to minimize this risk
  • Unsustainable Sales - While the business has had steady growth each year, having a physical location can be challenging. It comes with increased expenses and if the store concept is not enough to draw people to the location then the store risks failing once opened

We are working hard to minimize all of these risks and challenges and will provide constant updates to where we are in the process. We know it is important for our community who is investing in us to know where we are each step of the way.

Other Ways You Can Help

At Mike D's BBQ, we know that we all have very different financial situations. While making a monetary contribution may work for some (and we hope it does), there are those who can't but still want to support. If you can't make a contribution, the best way to support us is to use the Indiegogo sharing tools to spread the word about our campaign to all of your networks. Helping to spread the word is a vital part of making this campaign a success and we will be very grateful for all those who support us in that way!

story:
Hey there !!

My name is Leslie Mann, inventor/marketer & manufacturer of this new,  innovative misting cap.  To date my partner and I have invested over $2 million dollars for patents in 23 countries, tooling charges,  trade mark(s) registrations, trade shows, and a host of other expenses that I won't bore you with. 

Our goal is to build the brand, one retailer at a time.  In order to do this we need your help. 

We are looking to raise $50,000 USD which will go directly towards;  (a) production samples  (b) marketing & advertising.   

There is nothing exciting going on in the over $100 Billion dollar bottled water market so we believe there is a real shot for us to create a new and exciting brand with this technology.  Just imagine roasting on the beach or standing in line at Disney World without a bottled water that cools you off :)) 

If you are not in a position to make a contribution,  that doesn't mean you can't help us. 

Indiegogo had "sharing tools" that you can use to get the word out via social media. 

For those of you who do contribute,  I look forward to following up with you as the campaign progress's. 

Thank you in advance...  

Hydrate.StayCool !  

L.Mann 

Inventor

story:
日本語の説明は下です（Japanese below）。日本語版のビデオメッセージのリンクはこちらからです。

 

 

                                                         

 

My name is Yuko, I was born in Japan and I found my passion for fermented food when I was little. I used to work at a hospital as an RN and “Western medicine” is not the only answer to cure people’s health; I realized only what people choose to eat everyday can help them. The fermented food was my answer for people’s health and I found out that vegan kimchi is a very powerful solution among all the fermented foods.

When I moved to Brooklyn, New York in 2004, I started making vegan kimchi using my original recipe. It came out great! I received wonderful reviews from many people. From then on, I started selling small batches in glass jars. I also held a workshop on how to make vegan kimchi for people that were interested in making it at home.

I am a mother of two beautiful boys. I love my family and friends very much. I am a Yoga practitioner, Reiki healer and I meditate daily. I love the beach, and of course, I am a fermented-food lover.

My desire is to live a sustainable life. I am always thinking of ways to protect the environment. I want to create something that is not only good for the community, but for generations to come.

 

Happy Vegan Kimchi is made with fresh, local organic fruits and vegetables. It tastes fresh, crunchy, spicy and sour. The taste is addicting.

It makes a perfect side dish. Eat it with rice, use it as a topping on a green salad with avocado, put it inside of a grilled cheese sandwich… Vegan kimchi tastes delicious with anything that’s on your plate.

It doesn’t taste fishy like most kimchis because we don’t use fish sauce, nor do we use white sugar (regular kimchi uses both of these ingredients). If you don’t enjoy the fishy smell or taste of kimchi, then our Happy Vegan Kimchi is the right choice for you.

 

Because of the fermentation process, it is spicy and sour.  This process produces live and active “probiotic cultures”, which is the key to all of the health benefits that Kimchi has to offer. The health benefits include promoting digestion, boosting the immune system, regulating cholesterol and so much more. The longer the kimchi ferments, the more potent the health benefits become, and it becomes tastier too. In Asian countries, longer fermented kimchi is called “natural medicine”.

 

1. Probiotics Help Balance The Friendly Bacteria in Your Digestive System

2. Probiotics Can Help regulate cholesterol

3. Probiotic Supplements Improve Some Mental Health Conditions

4. Probiotic Strains Can Help Keep Your Heart Healthy

5. Probiotics May Reduce the Severity of Certain Allergies and Eczema

6. Probiotics Can Help Reduce Symptoms of Certain Digestive Disorders

7. Probiotics May Help Boost Your Immune System

8. Probiotics May Help You Lose Weight and Belly Fat

Vegan Kimchi has 100 billion active probiotics compare to just 100 in yogurt.

In supermarkets, kimchi usually contains lots of artificial additives, msg and a fermentation inhibitor which means that is doesn’t include pure active probiotics.

Happy Vegan Kimchi has active probiotics and is made from all-natural ingredients.

 

Fresh organic veggies and fruits from local farms. All natural. Non-GMO. Sugar-free. Gluten-free.

Vegetables + Fruits + Special home made a spicy sauce. 

 

 

 

Napa cabbage, scallions, carrot with an original spicy sauce which is called kimchi Nyan-myon. This sauce has yummy secrets. It makes vegan kimchi even tastier.  Apple, garlic, ginger, sesame seeds, and red chili flakes, maple syrup, etc…

 

   

 

Start-up cost include the following :

・launching a company for the original vegan kimchi brand in U.S.

・fresh local organic ingredients for 500 jars

・equipment for producing vegan kimchi

・designing a logo and label

・equipment for a farmers’ market stand

・renting a commercial kitchen

Even if we can’t reach the goal of $10,000, the funds will go toward our first priority cost of preparing to launch a company for the original vegan kimchi brand.

 

 

 

 

‘Vegan Kimchi From Scratch’

This workshop will teach you how to make homemade vegan kimchi. I will be sharing my special kimchi Nyan-myon recipe. I will also include an offering on how to make a non-spicy vegan kimchi for people who don’t like spicy food.

‘Let’s Eat Natural Medicine’, an aged vegan kimchi tasting event. It will provide an opportunity to get to know more about the fermentation process. I will explain the importance of the different levels of fermentation and how it affects your body and health.

’Fermented Kitchen Tour ’

Showing my secret kitchen for fermented food.

‘Good Food For Everybody’

A lunch gathering with a vegan kimchi plate.

‘Vegan Kimchi Fun Community Event’

Community service. A dinner offered to the community every first Friday of the month.

 

A stand at the farmers’ market is an opportunity to connect with the community and potential customers.

It is important for us to make Happy Vegan Kimchi available to the world. We’ll start by introducing our brand to local community stores in Hawaii.

Happy Vegan Kimchi Sauce Mix.

Make Happy Vegan Kimchi anywhere, anytime. This special kimchi sauce mix is 100% natural. It is made fresh, from scratch.

Happy Vegan Kimchi has variety of fruits, too.

Hawaiian Vegan Kimchi - Mango Kimchi, Papaya Kimchi and Dragon Fruit Kimchi.

 

Education will always be my core value. It is time to pair that with food products that provide a healthy path to what we eat.

Hawaii has a Japanese food culture. One of their favorite comfort foods is a rice ball called Musubi. We will provide non-spicy kimchi for kids. Teach them about fermented food and how to make Musubi.

Education helps to build trust and exposure to our brand.

 

I have a strong passion and commitment to make people happy through my Happy Vegan Kimchi brand.

I want to support people to have healthy lives through Happy Vegan Kimchi.I strongly believe that Happy Vegan Kimchi will make the community healthier and happier.

In Japan, there are local storehouses for fermented foods that live for hundreds of years. Inside of the storehouse, there is a very special smell (a good fermented smell). The fermented food has been stored there. You’ll find miso paste, soy sauce, pickles, sour plum, sweet milky sake, etc. They have a home to rest and ferment for long periods of time.

People in the community get together and make fermented food. This makes the community stronger and it keeps the active microorganism living.

I have a dream. I want to build a fermentation storehouse in Hawaii.I want to transmit this fermentation culture from Japan to Hawaii.

Eating is a part of our daily lives and life is about everyday food.  Healthy food should be easily accessible and part of our daily lives, too. By eating kimchi regularly, this superfood stays with you forever. In fact, active microorganisms will live longer than our physical bodies do. Good lactobacilli will be passed on in the community to the next generation and for generations to come.

 

日本語（Japanese）：

Happy Vegan Kimchiを世界中の人々に届けたい！ハッピービーガンキムチというブラントを立ち上げるために資金集めをしています。ご支援よろしくお願いします。

こんにちは、古川祐子です。私は2004年からニューヨークに移り住み、Happy Vegan Kimchiというビーガンキムチをオリジナルレシピで作っています。ハッピービーガンキムチは、オーガニックの野菜と果物だけでつくられているシンプルで味わい深いキムチです。

キムチを作れば作るほど、醸せば醸すほど、植物の持つ力、乳酸菌発酵のパワフルさとその素晴らしい効果に魅了されていきました。

発酵することで爆発的に増える乳酸菌。キムチを食べ続けることで、体内の免疫をあげたり、コレステロールを正常にしたり、肥満を防いだり、アンチエイジング効果、がん細胞を抑制したり、糖尿病を予防したりと、健康にたくさんの効果があることが研究者のリサーチで明らかになっています。

食べて美味しいだけではなく、健康にたくさんの効果がある、この発酵野菜のスーパーフードを世界中の人々に届けたい。ハッピービーガンキムチを通してたくさんの人々に、さらに健康に、さらに幸せになっていただきたいという強い思いがあります。ハッピービーガンキムチを世界中の皆様にお届けしていくために努力していきます。応援よろしくお願いします。

　　　　　

 

＜発酵と自分の歴史＞

 

日本で生まれ育った私は、小さい頃から発酵した食べ物が大好きでした。味噌や漬物、梅干しを祖母や母が手作りしているのをいつも近くで見ていました。冬になると新潟の酒蔵の親戚から送られてくる酒粕、箱を開けた時に芳しい香り、それを湯に溶かして祖母が作ってくれる暖かい飲み物がとても楽しみでした。

大人になり一人で生活するようになると、発酵食品を自分で手作りするのは私にとって自然なことでした。2004年にアメリカに移住してからは、さらに日本古来の発酵食品や調味料を大切に考えるようになりました。また、子供を持つようになると、店で売っている漬物や調味料に添加物がたくさん入っていること、自然な日本古来の発酵の味を食べさせてあげたい、という思いから、さらにたくさんの発酵食品や調味料を手作りするようになりました。

私のこれまでは発酵食品なしでは語れないほどです。その中でも、オリジナルレシピを考案してニューヨークで作り始めたビーガンキムチに夢中になりました。どんな人種の方でも美味しく食べられるように、野菜と果物だけでキムチを作りたかったのです。毎日のように醸し、発酵の瓶が所狭しと並べられていて、まるで実験室のような私のキッチンでした。ビーガンキムチは美味しく完成し、たくさんの人々に食べていただけるようになりました。作ったキムチを販売するだけではなく、ワークショップを開き、キムチニャンミョン から作り方を教えていました。ハッピービーガンキムチは私と人々を繋げて、ハッピーの輪が大きくなっていきました。

地元で採れる野菜や果物でビーガンキムチを醸し、それを日常的に美味しく食す。そのシンプルな食習慣と、体により良い循環。それを世界中に広げていきたいと思っています。

ハワイではマンゴーやパパイヤが熟れて木から落ちている光景によく出会います。溢れるように存在するローカルフルーツたちを美味しいビーガンキムチに変身させるのが私の役目の一つです。ハワイのエネルギーがたっぷり入ったハワイアン・ビーガンキムチが新しく新登場する予定です。

 

＜将来的にハワイで発酵蔵を作りたい夢＞

 

日本には古来から存在する味噌や醤油を貯蔵しておく発酵蔵。地域のみんなで仕込んだ味噌や醤油などがそこで時間をかけて発酵していく、古くからある日本の発酵の文化は素晴らしいです。その蔵の存在に憧れて色々と調べているうちに、日本の食文化が残るハワイにこの発酵蔵を創りたいと思うに至りました。

このハッピービーガンキムチのプロジェクトは、将来的にハワイに発酵蔵を創りたい夢への第一歩です。

ご支援、ご協力を是非ともよろしくお願いします。 そしてその発酵蔵を一緒に育てる仲間になってください。どうもありがとうございました。

Facebookpage に名前載せます。

story_txt:
日本語の説明は下です（Japanese below）。日本語版のビデオメッセージのリンクはこちらからです。
 

 
                                                         
 
My name is Yuko, I was born in Japan and I found my passion for fermented food when I was little. I used to work at a hospital as an RN and “Western medicine” is not the only answer to cure people’s health; I realized only what people choose to eat everyday can help them. The fermented food was my answer for people’s health and I found out that vegan kimchi is a very powerful solution among all the fermented foods. 
When I moved to Brooklyn, New York in 2004, I started making vegan kimchi using my original recipe. It came out great! I received wonderful reviews from many people. From then on, I started selling small batches in glass jars. I also held a workshop on how to make vegan kimchi for people that were interested in making it at home.
I am a mother of two beautiful boys. I love my family and friends very much. I am a Yoga practitioner, Reiki healer and I meditate daily. I love the beach, and of course, I am a fermented-food lover.
My desire is to live a sustainable life. I am always thinking of ways to protect the environment. I want to create something that is not only good for the community, but for generations to come.
 




Happy Vegan Kimchi is made with fresh, local organic fruits and vegetables. It tastes fresh, crunchy, spicy and sour. The taste is addicting.
It makes a perfect side dish. Eat it with rice, use it as a topping on a green salad with avocado, put it inside of a grilled cheese sandwich… Vegan kimchi tastes delicious with anything that’s on your plate.
It doesn’t taste fishy like most kimchis because we don’t use fish sauce, nor do we use white sugar (regular kimchi uses both of these ingredients). If you don’t enjoy the fishy smell or taste of kimchi, then our Happy Vegan Kimchi is the right choice for you. 
Because of the fermentation process, it is spicy and sour.  This process produces live and active “probiotic cultures”, which is the key to all of the health benefits that Kimchi has to offer. The health benefits include promoting digestion, boosting the immune system, regulating cholesterol and so much more. The longer the kimchi ferments, the more potent the health benefits become, and it becomes tastier too. In Asian countries, longer fermented kimchi is called “natural medicine”.
 


1. Probiotics Help Balance The Friendly Bacteria in Your Digestive System
2. Probiotics Can Help regulate cholesterol
3. Probiotic Supplements Improve Some Mental Health Conditions
4. Probiotic Strains Can Help Keep Your Heart Healthy
5. Probiotics May Reduce the Severity of Certain Allergies and Eczema
6. Probiotics Can Help Reduce Symptoms of Certain Digestive Disorders
7. Probiotics May Help Boost Your Immune System
8. Probiotics May Help You Lose Weight and Belly Fat
Vegan Kimchi has 100 billion active probiotics compare to just 100 in yogurt.

In supermarkets, kimchi usually contains lots of artificial additives, msg and a fermentation inhibitor which means that is doesn’t include pure active probiotics.
Happy Vegan Kimchi has active probiotics and is made from all-natural ingredients.
 
Fresh organic veggies and fruits from local farms. All natural. Non-GMO. Sugar-free. Gluten-free.
Vegetables + Fruits + Special home made a spicy sauce.   
 
Napa cabbage, scallions, carrot with an original spicy sauce which is called kimchi Nyan-myon. This sauce has yummy secrets. It makes vegan kimchi even tastier.  Apple, garlic, ginger, sesame seeds, and red chili flakes, maple syrup, etc…
 

   
 

Start-up cost include the following :
・launching a company for the original vegan kimchi brand in U.S.
・fresh local organic ingredients for 500 jars
・equipment for producing vegan kimchi
・designing a logo and label
・equipment for a farmers’ market stand
・renting a commercial kitchen
Even if we can’t reach the goal of $10,000, the funds will go toward our first priority cost of preparing to launch a company for the original vegan kimchi brand.
 

 
 
 


‘Vegan Kimchi From Scratch’
This workshop will teach you how to make homemade vegan kimchi. I will be sharing my special kimchi Nyan-myon recipe. I will also include an offering on how to make a non-spicy vegan kimchi for people who don’t like spicy food.
‘Let’s Eat Natural Medicine’, an aged vegan kimchi tasting event. It will provide an opportunity to get to know more about the fermentation process. I will explain the importance of the different levels of fermentation and how it affects your body and health.
’Fermented Kitchen Tour ’Showing my secret kitchen for fermented food.
‘Good Food For Everybody’
A lunch gathering with a vegan kimchi plate.
‘Vegan Kimchi Fun Community Event’
Community service. A dinner offered to the community every first Friday of the month.  
A stand at the farmers’ market is an opportunity to connect with the community and potential customers.

It is important for us to make Happy Vegan Kimchi available to the world. We’ll start by introducing our brand to local community stores in Hawaii.

Happy Vegan Kimchi Sauce Mix.
Make Happy Vegan Kimchi anywhere, anytime. This special kimchi sauce mix is 100% natural. It is made fresh, from scratch.
Happy Vegan Kimchi has variety of fruits, too.
Hawaiian Vegan Kimchi - Mango Kimchi, Papaya Kimchi and Dragon Fruit Kimchi.
 

Education will always be my core value. It is time to pair that with food products that provide a healthy path to what we eat.
Hawaii has a Japanese food culture. One of their favorite comfort foods is a rice ball called Musubi. We will provide non-spicy kimchi for kids. Teach them about fermented food and how to make Musubi.
Education helps to build trust and exposure to our brand.
 


I have a strong passion and commitment to make people happy through my Happy Vegan Kimchi brand.
I want to support people to have healthy lives through Happy Vegan Kimchi.I strongly believe that Happy Vegan Kimchi will make the community healthier and happier. In Japan, there are local storehouses for fermented foods that live for hundreds of years. Inside of the storehouse, there is a very special smell (a good fermented smell). The fermented food has been stored there. You’ll find miso paste, soy sauce, pickles, sour plum, sweet milky sake, etc. They have a home to rest and ferment for long periods of time.
People in the community get together and make fermented food. This makes the community stronger and it keeps the active microorganism living.
I have a dream. I want to build a fermentation storehouse in Hawaii.I want to transmit this fermentation culture from Japan to Hawaii.
Eating is a part of our daily lives and life is about everyday food.  Healthy food should be easily accessible and part of our daily lives, too. By eating kimchi regularly, this superfood stays with you forever. In fact, active microorganisms will live longer than our physical bodies do. Good lactobacilli will be passed on in the community to the next generation and for generations to come.

story:
Story

Courtney dreamed of opening a kombucha brewery with a tap room where she could teach classes on fermentation. In early 2014 she became founder and head brewer at Cultured Kombucha Co. when her desire to teach others how cultured foods affect their overall health and wellness came to fruition. An avid home-brewer of kombucha tea for many years, Courtney desired to share the health benefits reaped from kombucha tea. 

Her background in Hospitality and Culinary Arts partnered with her nutritional studies blossomed into a beautiful fermentation business. Using the knowledge  gained from past beverage experience, Courtney created a tasteful and approach kombucha tea. Using locally sourced ingredients when possible, Courtney's overall goal is to make an approachable, affordable, and accessible kombucha tea that encourages bodily nourishment. 

What We Need

Cultured Kombucha Co. is launching a $15,000 campaign to aid in the completion of our tap room and educational center. As northern Michigan's kombucha brewery, we look forward to serving you to the best of our ability.  This growth will allow us to teach community based classes promoting health and wellness.  It will also allow us to continue to foster culture in Northern Michigan.  

The Impact

Your contribution to our tasting room and educational center will provide the following:

  • Sustainable jobs in Northern Michigan
  • Access to healthy and nutritious kombucha direct from the producer. 
  • Learning environment for  alternative nutrition for the community.
  • Additional brewing capacity to greater serve you!

Risks & Challenges

Our expansion into a tasting room and education center is a huge success! However, growth  comes with risks and challenges.  We have secured our financing, however, there are always unexpected costs in a project of this amplitude. The brewery is almost finished and we look forward to completing the tap room with your contribution!

Other Ways You Can Help

The bigger the donation, the better the incentives, but EVERY DOLLAR gets us closer to our dream and we appreciate anything you can contribute! You can check out all the perks on the right. If your contribution isn't in the form of money – we would appreciate you sharing  our campaign and philosophy with your friends and family!

story:
About Over Yonder Brewing Co.

Coming soon to Golden, CO. in early 2019! Over Yonder Brewing is a brewery under construction as a purveyor of fine American craft beers. Over Yonder Brewing Company (“OYB”) aims to produce a high quality, unique, rotating craft beer lineup that pleases all palates and delivers them in an inviting, refreshing, laid-back atmosphere.

The brewery is being developed in Southwest Golden, a location west of Denver tucked just within the Rocky Mountain foothills near I-70, a major interstate that leads to an abundance of outdoor recreation all year round, and the world famous Red Rocks Amphitheater.

OYB’s core lineup will include a variety of New England Style IPAs, Citranade (West Coast IPA with flaked oats), Witbier, Coconut Porter, and seasonal rotations which will feature fruit beers, kettle sours, a barrel aging program, and other adventurous and delicious brews.

So whether you're traveling up to Colorado's Rocky Mountains or going to see a concert at Red Rocks Amphitheater pop over yonder to enjoy some delicious local Colorado craft beer!

The Crew

Jason Bilodeaux is a Colorado native, Co-Founder, and Brewmaster of Over Yonder Brewing Co. After many years of indulging in what the craft beer scene had to offer, he decided to try his hand at homebrewing. He immediately fell in love with the science and the process as a whole of brewing beer. It became a passion and an obsession to learn all aspects of brewing and tasting beer. He has won several homebrew competition awards over the past decade and has participated as a judge. With the confidence built from winning those medals and constant positive feedback, high praise, and encouragement from friends and family, he now wants to share that passion with the rest of the community! Aside from beer, Jason loves music, going to shows, and most enjoys being outdoors skiing, hiking, or camping with his lovely wife, Jessica Bilodeaux, and two dogs, Spinner and Topeka. His career boasts an extensive background in the printing industry, most recently within the Ball Corporation Graphics Department which allows him to take part in the creative aspects of craft brew canning design.

Jessica Bilodeaux is a New York native who moved to Colorado in 2001.  Later that year, she attended the Great American Beer Festival for the first time where she met her future husband, Jason Bilodeaux, and her passion for craft beer blossomed.  Jessica is a Phish-head who can be found going to shows, jamming to great music, hiking, cooking healthy vegetarian meals, and enjoying life in her mountain home with Jason and their two dogs.  Jessica holds a Bachelors of Arts in Psychology from The University at Buffalo and her career includes premium insurance auditing and supervisory roles in social work entities. Jessica is Over Yonder Brewing Co.’s Controller and Co-Founder.

Ashleigh Bilodeaux, sister to Jason, is a Colorado native and Over Yonder’s Head of Marketing, Sales and Co-Founder. Her creative approach to marketing and sales has earned her numerous industry awards and notable press coverage. She’s also the proud Co-Founder of BrewTV, mountain lover, craft beer geek and outdoor enthusiast who enjoys hiking, surfing, and rock climbing. She received her Bachelors of Science in Finance from the University of Metropolitan Denver (MSU).

Why Over Yonder Brewing

Our one-of-a-kind establishment will focus on our craft brews available to the Golden, Genesee and surrounding areas that intercept traffic to and from world famous Red Rocks Amphitheater, I-70 & C-470 corridor traffic.  The tap room with indoor and outdoor seating options will be a place where customers enjoying the brews can be a part of the laid-back, good-vibe atmosphere and listen to prerecorded and live and streaming concerts from Colorado's flourishing music scene, as well as seeing bands like Phish, Grateful Dead, and more!

Folks from surrounding local communities and those traveling to and from Colorado’s majestic mountain activities will enjoy the scenery over yonder while sipping on an array of rotating beers.  It is named in honor of a time of peace and love when music such as the Grateful Dead and artists alike brought happiness to others. A time when people came together to “feel alright.” When you could look “over yonder” and see the beauty in everything.  The nostalgia of the 1960’s and 1970’s still lives in our hearts while transcending into the modern jam scene with artists such as Phish, The Disco Biscuits, and The String Cheese Incident, amongst so many other amazing bands. We hope to share this vibe with all those who visit us.

Where Is The Brewery?

Over Yonder Brewing is located in Golden, west of Denver, tucked just within the Rocky Mountain foothills near I-70, a major interstate that leads to an abundance of outdoor recreation all year round.  Our brewery is less than 2 miles from world famous Red Rocks Amphitheater at the intersection of I-70 & C-470.

The Brewery

The current facility is a 4,000 sq foot retail end cap space bordered by additional retail. This gives OYB the ability to combine the brew house and tap room in the existing space with the potential to expand retail and production.

Retail sales will be accomplished through our 100+ seating taproom attached to the brewery. OYB aims to move into self-distribution. OYB will consider distributing a portion of the production in local restaurants, bars, and select package stores, a bottling/canning line may be added as capital and sales allow.

The Beer

OYB will handcraft its beers on a 10 barrel system under the direct supervision of its founders, Jason Bilodeaux, Jessica Bilodeaux, and Ashleigh Bilodeaux. Current technology, traditional methods and attention to detail will be used to produce consistent beers of the highest quality. Our product and passion for beer will ensure our customers will become return customers, thus making our consumers part of the OYB family.

OYB’s core product line will include a variety of New England Style IPAs, Citranade (West Coast IPA with flaked oats), Witbier, Cream Ale, Coconut Porter, and seasonal rotations which will feature fruit beers, kettle sours, a barrel aging program, and other adventurous and delicious brews.

What People Are Saying:

We've spent the last year sharing our beer with Colorado craft beer geeks, brewers and bars alike and have encouraged honest opinions and feedback.

How We’ll Use Funds From This Campaign

The most important asset to any brewery is a passionate and dedicated Brewer.  Luckily we have one of those! But every craftsman must have tools. We will use the funds from this campaign to put towards a brewing system so Jason can craft the delicious brews you'll enjoy at Over Yonder. Thanks for joining us on this journey and we can't wait to share a beer with you!

Risks and Challenges

Opening a business in which you will manufacture and distribute beer requires the cutting of copious amounts of red tape. We have thoroughly reviewed all Federal, State and Local permits and licenses required to open and have an attorney on board to review these submittals. There is always a chance for unforeseen permitting issues to slow us down but we shall persist! Lastly, items and memberships may be subject to change based on availablity.

story:
THANK YOU FOR HELPING US GET OFF THE (COFFEE) GROUND

We feel like we aimed for the stars and landed on moon. Although we didn't hit the target we were after, we've had enough orders to reach the minimums to buy our coffee and sustainable bags. WE'RE LIVE! 

So thank you so much for getting us off the ground, the team couldn't be anymore grateful! 

 

If you would like to order some coffee and support our sustainable coffee movement - please buy a bag here: 

CommunityBeanCoffee.com.au

Welcome to Community Bean Coffee.

The hamster wheel is live right  here!! All orders get a shout out while we grind away.

 We know it's going to be a slow grind  (literally) but we won't stop until we reach our goal! 

We need to start giving a flying hoot about the impact our morning cup of caffeinated goodness has. 

At Community Bean Coffee we've bean crafted to better the environment and Australian communities. Ethically sourced, expertly roasted (by the Godfather of Australian Coffee), sustainably packaged & shipped, coffee wastage is recycled AND it won't hurt your hip pocket. Sounds too choice to be true...but it isn't. Computer says yes!  

Your purchase goes towards helping us meet the minimum wholesale purchase of the ethical coffee and compostable bags. PLUS it will allow Community Bean Coffee to take up permanent residence in the Godfather's coffee factory, allowing us to kickstart into existence AND start helping the environment and communities around Australia via our Charity Partners. 

....literally though.  Our founder, Nathan, is walking on a human hamster wheel grinding machine AS WE SPEAK (well, you're reading but you get the point)!

 

Our team comprises of a small team of Coffee Lovers (coffee snobs more like it!). We're lead by:

 

Your Coffee & Our Goals

What we need is $30,000 to reach our goal. This would allow us to buy the wholesale bags and bulk purchase the coffee. If we reach this goal it would also allow us to prove The Community Bean Coffee business model to our head roaster, Andrew, bringing him the security required to dedicate his limited factory space for our beans/bags and to change processes for his factory to be more sustainable. We would then be able to have Andrew on board forever, helping our cafe clients and roasting our coffee!  

Next step

We want to get this coffee in your hands ASAP!

  • With the delivery time of our suppliers we can get the coffee delviered the next day but the, bags and drums within 3-5 businesses days of ordering and we've negotiated an invoicing period of 30 days. 
  • Once our campaign is completed (and orders can no longer be retracked) we will purchase the coffee and packaging prior to our funds reaching our bank account! Risky but we want you to have your cofffee ASAP.
  • This means we will place our order for goods on the 14th of August
  • It should arrive before the 21st of August. 
  • The roasting and packaging process will take one day. Therefore it will be roasted on the 24th of August to be shipped on the 25th and in your hands that week! 

Wholesale 

Important note - Wholesale drums are Sydney only!

As a Sydney based coffee roastery, we can only supply the reusable drums to Sydney based businesses. 

We're working on establishing roasting partners in other cities but we need to launch and start in Sydney first before we can expand nationally. Thank you for your understanding.

Extended Team 

The extended team of Community Bean Coffee consists of marketers, business advisory accountants and hamster helpers. 

Not in the photo: 

Annabel L: Marketing and PR 

Nathan H: Filmaker and website development

Jenny G: Andrew Gross' wife, head of logistics in the coffee factory 

Photo - top, left to right:

Andrew Gross: Head Roaster and back up hamster 

Ben A: Hamster Helper

Chris A: Brand managaer for a FMCG company, Chris has been advising on online media and strategy. 

Bottom, left to right:

Ash S: Hamster Helper 

Cherie S: Head proof reader and Chief Hamster Helper 

Ian S: Accountant with over 40 years practising. Ian has been running the numbers in the background, advising on minimums/pricing and general business advice. 

Risks & Challenges

Risks for us: 

  • As coffee is imported, the origins we use may become scarce which would risk the coffees we use not being available.
  • A challenge may be the shipping times if goods get held up in Covid. 
  • Roasting the right amount of coffee week on week for our wholesale clients. 

Plan to overcome: 

  • We've built our blends based on flavors rather than their country of origin. So if the beans become scarce in one country, we will be able to replicate our flavours with alternative beans from a different country. 
  • We've partnered with Sendle who provide great clarification of where your coffee is up to in the shipping process. 
  • We want your coffee to be as fresh as possible while maintaining stable flavours for our clients. This will be a learning process for everyone involved to make sure your ordering and our roasting is on par. Good thing our head roaster Andrew has been doing this for 40 years and has pastered this fine balance. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Show our campaign to your local barista and cafe!

Have coffee in your office yet? And if you do, do you want it to taste better AND do more for the environment? Have your office decision-makers reach out!

Have a mate that loves coffee? Send them the link! 

Share the live stream! 

Spread the word people!

story:
When our founder Olumide Gbenro returned to Nigeria his birth country for the first time in 10 years to work in remote villages, he noticed something peculiar, women and children were often not home because they had spent much of the day collecting water. He knew there had to be some way to solve this. There must be a way to alleviate the burden from women and children our most vulnerable population in the world.

When I returned to the United States I knew that whatever company I started had to be attached to a social cause and one that gave back to these remote villages that the world often has forgotten about. I realized that water, an essential part of life could be developed into a viable consumer product and that if we could use part of the proceeds to benefit this important population, this would be a win-win situation for everybody.

Creating a new product from scratch is a substantial and expensive undertaking. At Globo Water we need your support to formulate the initial world class formula for this novel beverage and to take us closer to making this social cause a reality.

With these funds, GLOBO Water will be able to source the best organic ingredients for our first flavors and lab test them to ensure the highest quality nutrition and maximum absorption into the body. This nourishing blend will be developed and refined to ensure instant solubility with a delicious yet natural flavor. No synthetic and artificial ingredients here.

All funds exceeding $9,000 will go towards formulating other flavors that resonate with our initial customer base so we can get to the next phase which is securing suppliers and distributing to the U.S. market first and then internationally so we can impact faster and more efficiently. Globo Water wants to become the world's go-to energy beverage that is both 100% natural and 100% ethically sourced and created with a 100% paper based petroleum free bottle.

From the start we knew we had to address one of the issues that still plagues many countries across the developing world. Access to clean drinking water. The average distance that women and children across various countries in Africa  walk is six kilometers (3.7 miles)-Source: World Vision. That's why for every bottle of Globo Water sold, we will give a portion of our profits toward building water wells and bore holes in remote villages around the world and reduce the burden of clean water for those who need it the most.

Bore Holes are a narrow shaft bored in the ground, either vertically or horizontally. A borehole may be constructed for many different purposes, including the extraction of drinking water.

Globo Water is a refreshing substitute to energy drinks , without the nasty withdrawals of coffee or those traditional "energy drinks." with names we can barely pronounce. Our patented formulation with spring water, fruit infusion and caffeine sourced from Guarana is the perfect choice for Entrepreneurs, Athletes, and people who want that extra level of focus while working.

Entrepreneurs: Globo Water is a refreshing substitute for entrepreneurs that need that extra kick while  on the grind. And it comes without the nasty withdrawals you get from  the typical energy drinks.

Action Sports Athletes: Globo water is perfect for action sports athletes during competition. *Note you must consult with your sports federation before taking any supplements or products and we are not held responsible for any issues.

100% Ethically Sourced Natural Spring Water: We source our spring water ethically from natural springs in the United States.

Fruit Essence: We boil organic fruits, collect the vapor, then add it to our spring water.

Guarana: We add small amounts of Guarana, a caffeine producing plant, native to Brasil. It is a great source of caffeine and has been know to have a smoother release of caffeine than coffee.

Founder Olumide Gbenro who was born in Lagos, Nigeria is a multilingual entrepreneur who was raised on 3 continents by age 13. In his adult years he has quickly become a globally recognized marketing consultant and business influencer. He aims to create solutions to some of the worlds problems through social enterprises such as Globo Water. Olumide's LinkedIn.

We've partnered with Mile High Food Science, one of the industry's leaders in food & beverage science and consumer packaged goods. They hold immense experience from product development till launching. They've worked with people like Nestle, Hot Pockets, & Atkin's Diet, Goya Foods, Lala Foods. They specialize in Product Development, Ingredient Sourcing, Cost Savings, Manufacturing, Plant Trials, Co-Manufacturing, Co-Packing. They will be along the ride with us every single step along the way and their founder Barbara who has over 11 years of experience will serve as advisor.

Barbara Shepherd has over 11 years in the food & beverage science industry. Her career initially began with Nestle and has developed to major brands in both the United States and Central America. Barbara's LinkedIn.

 

 

We can't do this without your support. We want to thank every single one of you for contributing from our smallest backer to our larger investors. We are a community bound together by one goal, to leave the world a better place.

We are just beginning our journey with Globo Water with the formulation of our staple flavors thus there is a risk in delay of timelines. In order to avoid delays we have partnered with the industry's finest Mile High Food Science, who execute at the highest of levels with other world class companies to ensure we stay on track. We know that you are our first group of supporters and our community that will play a crucial role in the final product and we appreciate your patience as we continue to grow.

They will be along the ride with us every single step along the way and their founder Barbara who has over 11 years of experience will serve as advisor.Barbara Shepherd has over 11 years in the food & beverage science industry. Her career initially began with Nestle and has developed to major brands in both the United States and Central America. Barbara's LinkedIn.  We can't do this without your support. We want to thank every single one of you for contributing from our smallest backer to our larger investors. We are a community bound together by one goal, to leave the world a better place.We are just beginning our journey with Globo Water with the formulation of our staple flavors thus there is a risk in delay of timelines. In order to avoid delays we have partnered with the industry's finest Mile High Food Science, who execute at the highest of levels with other world class companies to ensure we stay on track. We know that you are our first group of supporters and our community that will play a crucial role in the final product and we appreciate your patience as we continue to grow.

story:
Our Ayurvedic up&go is specially formulated to boost your body’s natural metabolic energy.

My Story

Growing up, my mother had a natural remedy for everything! A special concoction of herbs and spices I’d often never heard of before. To retrace my roots and learn more about the recipes that had been passed down over generations in my family, I traveled to Northern India.

The Ayurvedic up&go shot is based on a similar chain of knowledge passed down and shared to me by local Ayurveda practitioners I met whilst exploring the Himalayas. I often wondered how the farmers could work in the fields all day without taking any breaks. Their secret: a natural blend of locally grown herbs and spices. With this insight, I set out to create the Ayurvedic up&go shot.

 

Benefits – What makes our Ayurvedic up&go shots unique?

The Ayurvedic up&go shots are a blend of nine different Himalayan herbs and spices. Each ingredient contributes to a different function in the body to promote healthy energy release.

 

 

These ingredients are:

  • Green Tea: Provides a base rich in polyphenols, increases fat burning and increases the metabolic rate of your body.
  • Centella Asiatica: Rich in amino acids and phytochemicals which is required by your body cells during the release of energy. Also rejuvenates the nervous system to alleviate stress.
  • Cinnamon: Encourages blood flow around the body and reduces blood pressure. Improves blood sugar management and high in antioxidants.
  • Ginger: Aids in the management of glucose levels to combat lethargy and promote energy release. Also reduces fatigue by improving blood circulation. Additionally, it can boost your immune system!
  • Liquorice: Treats exhaustion. By enhancing the cortisol activity, glycyrrhizin helps to increase energy, ease stress and reduce the symptoms of ailments sensitive to cortisol levels, such as chronic fatigue syndrome.
  • Lemongrass: Helps detoxify the body. Lemongrass has a cooling energy which helps to soothe your stomach and keeps your digestive functions in check. 
  • Hibiscus Petal: Treats high blood pressure and high in antioxidants. As the antioxidants in hibiscus help to repair free radical damage, your energy levels remain high for longer!
  • Wild Mint: Refreshes the mind and body. Mint is a natural herb which stimulates the digestive enzymes that absorb nutrients from food and consume fat and turn it into usable energy.
  • Lemon and Lime Oil: Powerful antioxidant and improves mood and energy levels. Fresh squeezed lemon is one of the most well tested energy boosters around producing clean energy by hydrating and oxygenating the body to extraordinary energy and mental clarity.
  • Yuzu (♂) or Cranberry (♀) Extract: Added for a unique and great taste!

 

Men and Women vary in the amount of energy they need due to their different physiologies. To address this, we have varied the ratios of herbs and spices in each shot, but kept the ingredients the same. This way, each shot is catered for you! Our specially-designed recipes complement your body and work with it to optimise your energy throughout the day.

 

Our Core Principles and Values:

The Wise Herb Company was founded on three core principles:

  • Ensuring you the customer enjoy high-quality ingredients.
    • Our products are 100% natural and vegan-friendly. We use only the finest herbs and spices and do not use artificial additives.
  • Working directly alongside local farmers to ensure our product is ethically-sourced.
    • Our relationship with our farmers is a partnership. We pay our farmers well and are in close and constant communication with them. In return, we receive expertise and great care in the harvesting and handling of our herbs and spices.
  • Equality in supporting local Indian girls through school.
    • Education is a cause close to our heart. We currently sponsor 30 girls from the local Indian farming communities we work closely with. We provide these girls with a rare opportunity - to break the cycles they were born into and give them a chance at an education that sadly their parents can’t provide for them.
    • With your help we aim to increase the number of girls we sponsor from currently 30 to many many more within the next few years!

 

Our products are suitable for all ages above 5 years old. The Ayurvedic up&go shot is perfect for anyone with a busy on-the-go lifestyle. In return for your support we offer you the exclusive chance to try our product before it reaches the shops!

Your kind contributions will go towards purchasing equipment and will enable us to begin production in March and April. Our goal is to launch by June 2018.

We aim to sell our premium products in health and wellness retailers that share our values and vision.

 

Timeline for the Launch:

 

We need the funds to purchase the equipment needed to share these amazing products with everyone. Some of the funds will also be used to purchase more Raw Materials from the small family farmers - ensuring more support and continuity for the education of their daughters.

Our Perks:

Help Sponsor The Girls !

As part of our core principles, we promised to help the farmer's daughters through school to give them a better future. With this perk, you can help us directly sponsor girls through education. Your money will help us put girls through school at a much faster rate! Help us improve young lives by supporting them with this $10 pledge.

Work Week Energiser - 7 Day Pack:  7 shots for $18.00.  25% off RRP. While stocks last - 100 available.

With this perk, you will receive a box of seven Ayurvedic up&go shots - choose from either seven Male or seven Female shots. This pack is designed to keep you calm and energised throughout a stressful week. Retails for $24.00. Shipping not included. 

Feel Good Together - 7 Male & 7 Female Shots Pack:  14 shots for $40.00.  20% off RRP. While stocks last - 75 available.

With this amazing perk, share the fun! You will receive a box of fourteen Ayurvedic up&go shots - seven Male and seven Female shots. Also available as 14 Male or 14 Female shots. This pack is designed to keep you both calm and energised throughout a stressful week. Retails for $50.00. Shipping is included.

 

Big Month Pack : 30 shots for $72.00.  30% off RRP. While stocks last - 25 available.

Busy month? We've got something to help you out! With this perk you will have access to 30 Ayurvedic up&go shots - choose from 30 Male or 30 Female shots. For the best results, take one shot daily. Retails for $103.00. Shipping is included.

 

Big Month Together - 30 Day Male & Female Pack :  60 shots for $135.  35% off RRP. While stocks last - 25 available.

With this huge perk, you get access to 60 shots - 30 Male and 30 Female. Also available 60 Male shots or 60 Female shots. Share the fun times together! For the best results, take one shot daily. Retails for $208. Shipping is included.

Year Long Boost Pack-365 shots for a year for $700. 44% of RRP-15 avaliable.

With this boosting perk, you will receive a years supply Ayurvedic up&go shots - We can offer a flexible mix, from Male and/or Female. This pack is designed to keep you calm and energised throughout the year. Retails for $1263.00. Shipping is included!

 

 

The Lifetime Supply : 30 shots per month for 30 years for $5,000.  95% off RRP - 10 available

Join the lifestyle! Why stop at one month? We are proud to offer a lifetime supply of our boosting shots! You will have first access to all our future Ayurvedic shot range and the ability to change to try the new ones at any time in the near future.

You will receive a email at the end of campaign to confirm whether you want 30 Male or 30 Female shots to start. Retails for $100,000. Shipping is included. This deal is not transferable throughout the lifetime of the offer.

 

Partners For Life - Male and Female Lifetime Supply :  60 shots per month for $10,000 93% off RRP - 5 avaliable

All the best moments in life are shared! We are very excited to offer out biggest perk! 60 Shot bottles per month for 30 years of your life! One for you and one for your partner. You will have first access to all our Ayurvedic shots and the ability to change shots at any time in the near future.

You will receive 30 Male & 30 Female shots in the first month. Retails for $150,000. Shipping is included.This deal is not transferable throughout the lifetime of the offer.

NOTE: You should receive an email at the end of campaign to confirm your choice.

and finally ...

The Wise Herb Company was founded by Dr Ketan Joshi in 2014, and nurtured with the help of his family and close friends. 

Ketan has a strong business and scientific experience and leads The Wise Herb Company team which specialises in premium natural health and wellness products. Our other ranges of products include herb and spice infusions, superfood powders and food supplements.

 

Follow us on:

story:
so we can open our first GOJIGO plant based fast food locations. CRAZY RIGHT? It's the people who are crazy enough to think they can CHANGE THE WORLD who actually do. If you want FAST PLANT FOOD our business model is a high volume low margin business model where we see OUR CUSTOMERS 2-4x EVERY WEEK which is awesome because planteaters are THE BEST CUSTOMERS IN THE WORLD just ask James, Alicia and Gwyneth

GOJIGO was born in 2014 in my CAPE TOWN KITCHEN after my second child was born. I was making 84 meals a week + spending WAY TOO MUCH TIME in my kitchen when I wanted to be doing OTHER COOL STUFF like going to my friend's farm for the weekend!

So I rented a shop and sold my plant meals+snacks to surfers, secretaries and tech guys who worked nearby and EVERYBODY LOVED IT!

The next year I dragged the family BACK TO CANADA to bring my dream to life and serve the exploding PLANT-EATING COMMUNITY. We opened a pop-up in an abandoned STARBUCKS in a groovy beach side town called GIBSONS but discovered the community was WAY TOO SMALL and most people preferred the processed food drive-thru's on the highway. Yikes! One customer even angrily demanded 'Is there a reason you are REFUSING TO SELL CHICKEN?' I pointed out we also refused to sell cars, stationary and running shoes. She laughed + ordered our delicious summer rolls. For many people eating only plants IS A SCARY IDEA so we make it easy+fun and offer DISCOUNTS+FREE STUFF every day. 

In growing our BRAND the TOP 10 lessons we learned were, we need:

1) towns of 30-50,000 people so 500-1000 of them will become regular GOJIGANS

2) GOJIGO in densely populated places like CALIFORNIA

3) closer to our plants

4) reduce transport emissions

5) FEED MORE PEOPLE that are hungry and ready for change. 

California also has:

6) tons of ANIMAL LOVERS who love GOJIGO

7) we DON'T put animals in our menus

8) SAN FRANCISCO has one of the most progressive ZERO-WASTE urban plans + gojigo is all about that.

We're even developing our own line of:

9) REUSABLE+ EDIBLE packaging lines in partnership with one of the EU's coolest circular economy groups RELOOP because: 

10) gojigans LOVE TO TRAVEL and need their food to GO. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cg3OA1s8-SI

•Our vision is to become a dominant global plant based food and lifestyle brand. For more information on the Plant based food movement, you can check out our perk partner below:

•Consumers are seeking cleaner healthier and more fair brands in alignment with their changing lifestyle and values

•The gojigo brand + architecture was intentionally designed to grow into a global impact brand serving engaged citizens worldwide through clean plant based food choices

•As we build trust and loyalty in  our first revenue divisions, the brand will be able to move into a diverse range of food, lifestyle products and green-focussed services

•Our core values are smart/sexy/on the go for our community committed to change the world through their consumer habits

gojigo will revolutionize the food and beverage industry with its unique plant based lifestyle range of consumer food products. Our model provides our members/customers with the competitive advantage they need to both eat healthy + retain brain function by consuming our nutrient dense food products on a daily basis

•Our plant pods will be flexible + mobile + quick to install + inviting

•Our plant pods will allow our partners’ customers to remain in their establishments longer than normal

•Our modern designed plant pods with high tech infrastructure will compliment today’s consumer demands and expectations

•We will provide our members/customers with the competitive advantage they need to both eat healthy + retain brain function by consuming our nutrient dense food products

•Our nutrient dense food will be competitively priced to serve all demographics

•We will not be burdened with traditional lease agreements and running costs of a shop outlet as we will partner with established brands that we are presently talking to

Approx 4-500sqft

High visibility and  busy traffic areas

Shopping Malls, Universities, Airports, Hospitals, Gyms, Bus & Train Stations

•Layout and design to suit individual partners

•Flexible size to fit into any available space

•Basic services infrastructure – minimal disruption to existing buildings

•Health & Safety compliant 

•Quick and hassle-free installation

•Global meat substitute is growing at an exponential rate: 6.4% annually

•Meat substitute products will be worth $5.7Bn by 2020

•25% of all Brits will be vegetarian by 2025 – increase of 350% over the past 10 years

•Meat consumption has declined by 10% per capita since 2007 in the USA

•9.1% of the Australian population is now vegetarian

•43% of Australians reduced their meat consumption compared with a couple of years ago

•Sweden is to introduce a meat tax that could slash greenhouse gases by up to 12%

•45% of Canadians  include superfood ingredients in their meals

•Global meat substitute is growing at an exponential rate: 6.4% annually

CONVENIENT • AFFORDABLE • DELICIOUS

We have created our own ‘blue ocean’ that positions gojigo as the global leader in plant based lifestyle consumer food products

•Gojigo started as a test kitchen in Somerset West, Cape Town in 2014

•Gojigo opened a second test kitchen location in Gibsons, Canada in June 2016

•During the 6 months of operation in Gibsons gojigo served over 7000 customers

•Gojigo’s products, ideas values are well received with numerous accolades from our customers on gojigo’s FB page

•Gojigo is designed as a global consumer brand that will disrupt and revolutionize the way consumers find/curate/order + pay for their food & lifestyle products

Where is the growth going to come from?

•Millenials have more spending power and knowledge and are more likely to consume plant-based proteins

•Consumers seek comfort from updated of age-old formulations, flavours and formats

•Preference for natural, simple and flexible diets

•Focus of sustainability  on eliminating food waste

•Time investments required for products and meals will become as influential as nutrition

•Healthy food and drink are not luxuries

Forecast - minimum 250 plant pods by 2021

 

 

 

 

 

​​

story:
Short Summary

I started SnuggleMuffin when I was 16 years old, selling cupcakes from my locker in high school. Over the past 8 years SnuggleMuffin has grown very organically and we are now one of the leading cake companies in Glasgow, our cakes are something a little bit special and that is reflected by our amazing, loyal customers!

We regularly run stalls at markets and food festivals, and absolutely love getting to interact with you all and seeing your faces when you try our delicious cakes!  We love it so much in fact that we want to be able to do this every day, and so we are opening our new city centre store in Glasgow.  We have secured a prime location in Buchanan Galleries, the second largest shopping destination in the UK, but we want to do it right and make sure we make the most out of our new shop opening, so we are coming to YOU to help us fund a beautiful shop fit to show off our bakes.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for £7000 to kit out our new shop and make is super Snuggly. We'll be doing a lot of the work ourselves, but need help getting things like paint, counters, shelving, tills and those special snuggly details.  Even if we don't reach the funding goal, anything we raise will go a long way in helping us to create a place for you to come and indulge in all your favourite treats. 

We love that you want to get involved and have come up with a whole host of rewards to thank you for being a part of the SnuggleMuffin journey.  From a copy of our recipe ebook to a lifetime supply of cake, we hope there is something there to tickle everyone's taste buds and hope that it reflects how very grateful we are for your support. 

Why Are We Different?

So you may be thinking 'there are hundreds of cake companies' and you're right.  So why are we different? All of our cakes are handcrafted right here in Glasgow by a team of committed and loyal SnuggleMuffins who are crazy passionate about what they do.  We use fresh, local ingredients and never put anything in our cakes that you wouldn't find in your own kitchen cupboard.  Our cakes never see the inside of a freezer, and because everything is made to order we can offer all kinds of weird and wonderful bakes that you might not find in other bakeries of our size. 

We strongly believe in banishing the idea that you should feel 'guilty' for indulging in baked goods and want to encourage people to enjoy life, and cake, to the limit.

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge has always been breaking through all the noise that there is in the industry.  We've found that once people try our cakes, they can taste the difference and keep coming back for years.  That's why we are so keen to put ourselves in this city centre location to allow more people to indulge in a SnuggleMuffin.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are so many ways you can help other than just financially.  We'd love if you would check our our social media and help to spread the word about SnuggleMuffin.

You could also share our blog and Youtube channel and help us to create a buzz before the grand opening.

We plan to be open in June 2017, so please keep in touch and come in to see us once our Snuggly doors are open! 

Thank you so much for taking the time to read about our journey and we hope to see you in store soon to share a cupcake!
story_txt:
Short Summary
I started SnuggleMuffin when I was 16 years old, selling cupcakes from my locker in high school. Over the past 8 years SnuggleMuffin has grown very organically and we are now one of the leading cake companies in Glasgow, our cakes are something a little bit special and that is reflected by our amazing, loyal customers!
We regularly run stalls at markets and food festivals, and absolutely love getting to interact with you all and seeing your faces when you try our delicious cakes!  We love it so much in fact that we want to be able to do this every day, and so we are opening our new city centre store in Glasgow.  We have secured a prime location in Buchanan Galleries, the second largest shopping destination in the UK, but we want to do it right and make sure we make the most out of our new shop opening, so we are coming to YOU to help us fund a beautiful shop fit to show off our bakes.


What We Need & What You Get
We are looking for £7000 to kit out our new shop and make is super Snuggly. We'll be doing a lot of the work ourselves, but need help getting things like paint, counters, shelving, tills and those special snuggly details.  Even if we don't reach the funding goal, anything we raise will go a long way in helping us to create a place for you to come and indulge in all your favourite treats. 
We love that you want to get involved and have come up with a whole host of rewards to thank you for being a part of the SnuggleMuffin journey.  From a copy of our recipe ebook to a lifetime supply of cake, we hope there is something there to tickle everyone's taste buds and hope that it reflects how very grateful we are for your support.

story:
Our Story

We are Michael and Juliette Jessop and we are passionate about food. Michael grew up helping in the kitchen and it never felt like a chore, which inspired him to pursue a career in the culinary arts. Michael minored in culinary arts at Brigham Young University Idaho, and majored in business, with an eye towards building his own restaurant. He had grown up with a mother who always cooked from scratch and welcomed his help in the kitchen, which really sparked his passion for cooking with whole raw ingredients. Juliette grew up with two parents dedicated to cooking with quality ingredients, so much so that her mother runs a French catering bakery out of their home. Her father learned to cook through learning about food chemistry, and passed this on to Juliette, which of course made the experimentation stage of recipe development really exciting. Both Michael and Juliette were raised with a very serious awareness of where their food, and everything else they consumed, came from and this gave them a deep sense of ecological responsibility for what they use in this world. This was something that really drove their desire to be able to tell their consumers where each ingredient came from and to be confident that they are producing a sustainable product.

Together we are building J&M’s Soda Shoppe, an artisan soda and ice cream shop with a modern-retro flair. We are dedicated to providing high quality, hand-crafted sodas and ice cream that is economically and morally sound. We work to source our ingredients within 200 miles of Teton Valley, Idaho, support organic farms, and where possible purchase goods that have been wild harvested from certified suppliers. We believe real, whole foods are good for you, good for the environment and we want the opportunity to share that with you! When you back our small business, you are not only helping us cover the costs of equipment, facilities, licensing  and other start-up costs, you are investing in a community of people who share our worldview and who want to put some goodness back out into the world.


What We Need & What You Get

When you back this campaign, you are standing behind a movement dedicated to quality food and to supporting the communities we live in, but more specifically you are helping fund our startup costs so we can get this party started! Here are some of the things we need in order to get this movement going:


Kitchen and dining room equipment $7,850

Licensing and government enforced business startup costs $150

Initial rent/deposit/upgrades on the shop $1800

First order of food ingredients $1,000

Fees for marketing specialist $3,000

Fees for graphic design and packaging $2,000

Travel to collect equipment/personal costs of working this job full-time $2,000


When you back J & M’s Soda Shoppe donate, you will earn a place on our virtual Wall of Fame, some sweet swag including, bottle openers, tee-shirts, coupons for free menu items, a VIP membership that gives you 25% off for the whole year, or for those living in lands far away, a sampler box of our hand-crafted sodas. Check out our Perks section for more details.

Risks & Challenges

Starting a restaurant is hard work. It takes more hours, money and skills than most people expect. In the United States, 60% of new restaurants fail in their first year and 80% in their first five, as cited in this article by Business Insider http://www.businessinsider.com/why-restaurants-fail-so-often-2014-2

We believe we can beat those odds by having done our part to be educated not only on food, but the specifics of food business, employee management and the needs and trends of our specific community.


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you just don’t have the funds to contribute as much as you’d like, but that’s ok! Share this campaign on social media, tell your friends, and help spread the word so that we can reach as many people as possible. If you’d like to see a hand-crafted soda maker in Teton Valley, and like what we are doing here, then share the love and encourage others to share our story and back our project. You can find us on Instagram, and Twitter @jmsodashoppe and on Facebook at J&M’s Soda Shoppe, as well as on our website, www.jmsodashoppe.squarespace.com.

Thank you so much, you are what gives us the drive to do what we do!

story:
Our Story

Penny and Bill Burt have been married for 20 years and have lived in Monticello, MN for the past 10 years.

After home brewing for 5 years we created Rustech Brewing Company in Monticello Minnesota

The goal is to establish a small brewing company that would allow us to sell our beer while Bill still maintains his "day" job as a Senior Software Developer at Donaldson Company Inc.  

It all started here.. Bill designed and built an automated Brew Rig in 2 weeks for a LabVIEW user group presentation that controls the brewing process temperature with LabVIEW. The software is very complex and also sends TXT messages when it’s time to add hops!

OUR MISSION

Rustech Brewing Company is a newly formed brewery to bring patrons a warm and inviting experience. We intend to open a 5 barrel brewery with a tasting room located on the Northern border of Wright County in the city of Monticello, MN. The brewery will have a steampunk look with gears and pulleys. 

Our goals will include:

Construction of our location.

Install our new brewing equipment.

Install our (3) Fermentation vessels and (1) Brite tank. Each tank does need a name though :)

Secure federal, state and local licensing requirements.

Brew and sell our first batches of craft beer.

Sustain initial momentum and grow.

HOW WILL CROWDFUNDING FUNDS BE USED?

  • Crowdfunding and processing Fee 
  • Crowdfunding Rewards 
  • Brewery location, licensing, Permits and first batch ingredients. 

The Impact

Let's Make History! Let's get a Local Microbrewery & Taproom right here in Monticello MN!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please share on Facebook or Twitter!

RISKS & CHALLENGES

This crowd funding campaign will not only help us get through our first year of development, it will provide us the spark that will start the engine to sustain us as we power through our initial years of business. Through extensive research, we have developed a solid business plan and are highly motivated to make this brewery come to life. 

We have already secured a location that fits our needs and budget!  We will be working hard for the next six to eight months in the federal, state and local licensing processes.  While working on that, we will renovate the approved space into a functioning brewery.  Once all of the licensing and construction is done, we will spend the next year brewing our tails off to make our Microbrewery successful. 

Please support our endeavor and help us serve up some great local Monticello MN craft beer!

Fundraise backers-  everyone that buys or donates to Rustech Brewing Company will be recognized on our website as a backer!

Here are few of our exciting Perks!

* Any Perk that contains a pint glass or growler with receive (1) free fill token!

 

Pint Glass

You will receive our Rustech Brewing branded style pint glass, recognition on our website and  (1) free beer fill token.

 

Stainless Steel Growler!

You will receive a Rustech Brewing branded "Limited edition' Stainless Steel Growler, recognition on our website.

This will be a limited time offer and will not be offered again for a year or two year! So get yours now!! 

T-shirt 

Get of our first released T-shirt! 

 

Cool Hat 

Our hats are Completed!

Women's Military style Hat

 

 

 

 

TAPROOM TAKEOVER
