story:
Here's what's in it for you:
Donors: $15 - $50 will receive an Oaken Shell logo baseball hat
Donors: $50+ - $100 will receive an Oaken Shell logo t-shirt
Donors: $100+ - $250 will receive an Oaken Shell logo glass mug
Donors: $250+ will receive an Oaken Shell logo drinking horn (like a bad ass Viking)

A Little Background:

Almost 10 years ago, I built a makeshift meadery in my parents’ basement to learn the craft. Now I'm ready for the real deal. Bridging the gap between beer and wine drinkers, mead is for everyone, but good mead is hard to find...until now. Let's bring mead to the masses!

Oaken Shell Meadery was founded by three friends with a passion for making mead, but they soon realized that their little project had big fans and the potential to be mainstream. In order for Oaken Shell to grow it became time to pass the torch. That's where I come in. Leaping at the opportunity to bring a great tasting mead to market, I took my savings and bought the whole operation. We have a new location and all our licenses...we're ready for expansion. 

How Much We Need & What You Get:

Our goal is to raise $50,000.00 in order so we can make a lot more of our mead, and fast. After that, it's on me to sell our mead to as many of you as there are out there to really get this show on the road!  If there's one thing I can promise, I will eat, sleep, and breathe my mission: to successfully share the mead tasting experience with one and all (over 21, obviously). I won't let you down! 

    And here's what's in it for the BEES!

     If we hit our goal we will donate 5% of the total donations received to The Honeybee    Conservancy, because without honey, there can be no mead. And without bees there can be no honey. And who would be if weren't grateful to, and protective of, this precious natural resource.  

    Donations aren't your thing?

    That's cool, we totally get it. If a donation isn't in the cards, you can still help! Please share this campaign via social media, email, fax, skywriting, carrier pigeon, whatever suits your fancy. It will do wonders and we will be eternally grateful for any efforts made in support. 

    From the bottom of our hearts (and mugs), THANK YOU! Your taste buds will thank you too!
story_txt:
Here's what's in it for you:Donors: $15 - $50 will receive an Oaken Shell logo baseball hatDonors: $50+ - $100 will receive an Oaken Shell logo t-shirtDonors: $100+ - $250 will receive an Oaken Shell logo glass mugDonors: $250+ will receive an Oaken Shell logo drinking horn (like a bad ass Viking)
A Little Background:
Almost 10 years ago, I built a makeshift meadery in my parents’ basement to learn the craft. Now I'm ready for the real deal. Bridging the gap between beer and wine drinkers, mead is for everyone, but good mead is hard to find...until now. Let's bring mead to the masses!
Oaken Shell Meadery was founded by three friends with a passion for making mead, but they soon realized that their little project had big fans and the potential to be mainstream. In order for Oaken Shell to grow it became time to pass the torch. That's where I come in. Leaping at the opportunity to bring a great tasting mead to market, I took my savings and bought the whole operation. We have a new location and all our licenses...we're ready for expansion. 

How Much We Need & What You Get:
Our goal is to raise $50,000.00 in order so we can make a lot more of our mead, and fast. After that, it's on me to sell our mead to as many of you as there are out there to really get this show on the road!  If there's one thing I can promise, I will eat, sleep, and breathe my mission: to successfully share the mead tasting experience with one and all (over 21, obviously). I won't let you down! 

And here's what's in it for the BEES!
 If we hit our goal we will donate 5% of the total donations received to The Honeybee    Conservancy, because without honey, there can be no mead. And without bees there can be no honey. And who would be if weren't grateful to, and protective of, this precious natural resource.  
Donations aren't your thing?
That's cool, we totally get it. If a donation isn't in the cards, you can still help! Please share this campaign via social media, email, fax, skywriting, carrier pigeon, whatever suits your fancy. It will do wonders and we will be eternally grateful for any efforts made in support. 
From the bottom of our hearts (and mugs), THANK YOU! Your taste buds will thank you too!

story:
The KOJIYA Company is a friends and family business handcrafting cultured rice (KOJI), using ancient Japanese methods producing a portfolio of products that promote digestive synergy for overall health and well-being. 

We aim to become a household name and found in every major section of the grocery store. Currently, we are offering SUPAZAKÉ, a Pre & Probiotic Smoothie, POPAZAKÉ, a Pre & Probiotic kids Popsicle, and Organic KOJI. 

The KOJIYA Company launched softly towards the end of this summer. With your help to meet our fundraising goal, we will take it to the next most important level by supporting and growing our current customer base and expanding new distribution.

Upon completion of our goal, we will purchase inventory from our trusted suppliers to produce 1,000 cases of SUPAZAKE. This will allow us the inventory to fill purchase orders and the working capital to hire a part-time employee and interns to help sell/support accounts.

We will partner with a distributor, fulfill purchase orders and service requirements with our new and current 35 customers in the NYC area. Part-time employees hired will presell products to new and existing accounts while also adding an internship program to develop a team of 4-6 product demonstration reps to support our accounts. This support will build brand recognition and brand equity that will allow us to reach financial sustainability. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us create some buzz and share with your friends and family. Utilize Indiegogo share tools and create some noise!!!

 

 

OUR PRODUCTS

SUPAZAKÉ is a non-dairy sweet fermented rice smoothie with over 1 billion live and active cultures. SUPAZAKÉ is a “Supa Twist” on amazaké, an ancient Japanese recipe that is recognized for its sweet taste and digestive health benefits.

This ancient recipe is a sweet treat that’s traditionally consumed to celebrate a new healthy year.  We have captured this traditional cultured beverage and infused it with nature’s best ingredients so, you can feel SUPA every day.


 

SUPAZAKÉ will support digestive & immune health, enhance protein utilization, while providing a source of energy, protein, fiber, and B vitamins.

Contains amino & folic acids with no sugar added.
SUPAZAKÉ is made with organic ingredients, vegan, while gluten and soy free.

 

 

     

Pre & Probiotic Popsicle

 

POPAZAKE shares all the same attributes as SUPAZAKÉ.  A full functional popsicle great for beating the heat and fatigue. A fantastic go to treat for kids and parents that look to get more out of their popsicles. Packed with nutritious vitamins, calcium, potassium and without unnatural sugars, artificial flavors and colors. 

 

 

 

ORGANIC KOJI

 

At the foothills of NYC in the Hudson Valley, The KOJIYA Company practices ancient Japanese methods providing a truly handcrafted Organic KOJI. 
 

Explore the staple to the Japanese diet by culturing & fermenting your own foods and enjoy the benefits of KOJI's enzymatic powers. 

Great for dry aging meats, marinades, dressings, pickling and so much more!
 

 

 

 

 

 

Challenges

Some common challenges would include time taken to staff & train the open sales and demonstration rep positions. Some extra time will be needed to process and ship rewards.

story:
Short Summary

The Wandering Café is a mobile food vending bike and catering service operating in Evanston and the North Shore area.  We use locally sourced ingredients to produce fresh, healthy street food. The Wandering Café’s chef driven menu rotates seasonally and includes a variety of vegetarian options. 

We're committed to expanding consumer access to locally sourced food without the need to order from a restaurant. The Wandering Café is Evanston’s first chef inspired, pedal powered, mobile kitchen. Unlike food trucks, our low carbon footprint allows us to bring our product to the streets in an environmentally responsible way. 

As a mobile food cart, The Wandering Café will operate 3 days a week, between 6-8 hours a day. The bike will have 3 rotating locations where customers can purchase our food. As a catering service, The Wandering Café will be available for private events and parties. 

 

Our Story

   

As a graduate student at Northwestern, Dan felt like quality food was nearly inaccessible while working on campus. You’d have to walk across campus or off campus to find mediocre burgers, sandwiches, or Starbucks. 

Seeing the BrewBike (NU’s mobile coffee shop) out in front of the Tech Institute made him think, it’d be great to have a bike with chef-crafted, healthy food available on campus! And that’s when he met Molly.

After working in (too)many local restaurants and as a private chef, Molly was ready to confront the reality that making the same old menus bores her! 

We’re excited that our bike will feature rotating menus, inspired by seasonality.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to bring our food to the people, The Wandering Café will need $9,000 in starting capital. The owner contribution of cash and goods is 20% with the remaining 80% coming from Indiegogo crowdfunding investors.

 

As a perk for being an early supporter of our company, you can choose from the following options:

  • Free Wandering Cafe sticker 
  • Wandering Cafe T-shirt (get a free drink w/purchase when you wear your shirt)
  • Free taco or bowl entree from the Wandering Café
  • Catered party for 15 people 
  • Catered party for 20 people 

Use of Funds

All logistics for the Wandering Cafe have been worked out. We just need your support to bring this bike to the people. Funds will be allocated in the following way:

Risks & Challenges

Mobile food vending and food trucks continue to be vehicles for entrepreneurial opportunity and economic growth. The industry is estimated to reach more than $1 billion in revenue by 2020 with an annual growth rate of 6.8% since 2014.

While high competition and unfavorable regulatory conditions in some cities have limited the growth of food trucks, mobile food bikes enjoy lower start up cost due to lower permitting and licensing fees.As you can see above, over 15% of our funding goal will go to permits, licenses, and legal fees.

Because Chef Molly has an extensive background in restaurants, catering, and private chef work, we are well positioned to meet and address the challenges that come with starting a mobile food business. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that financial contributions aren't always possible, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Share our story on Facebook, Instagram, & Twitter to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
  • The Indiegogo share tools make this super easy!

story:
How is the Herb Garden different from other indoor gardens?

The answer is technology and beauty. With 30 high-power, sunlight-simulating LEDs and 48 low-power candlelight LEDs, the Herb Garden has the most advanced lighting system of any garden on the market. The brightness and color temperature of the lights is fully adjustable and there are millions of possible settings. On top of the light bar is an ambient light brightness sensor and ambient light color sensor. By detecting the light in the room the garden can automatically match the plant lights to match the brightness and color of the surrounding lights. Your room will always look amazing with the Herb Garden as the centerpiece.

The Herb Garden uses the latest hydroponics technology. The garden has sensors measuring water level, water flow rate, water temperature, air temperature, air relative humidity, and more. The computer uses this knowledge of the environment to care for your plants in the best possible way and will let you know if the environment changes suddenly.

The Herb Garden has a built-in WiFi micro-controller that is always connected to the internet. Your garden communicates with the mobile app so it will let you know if you need to add water, add nutrients, clean the garden, or harvest your plants.

We did not want to make another cheap, plastic garden that barely works and breaks in months. We wanted to make a garden that is durable enough to be used every day for many years and beautiful enough to be displayed in any home. We have used solid hardwood, thick clear acrylic, anodized aluminum, and other high-quality materials so that your garden will last and look amazing.

 

Why is the Herb Garden so pricey?

We set out to make the best indoor garden in the world and we truly believe that we achieved that. From the outer wood case to the polymer lenses we have only used the absolute best materials and components every step along the way. The Herb Garden costs over $900 to manufacture using the latest technology and we wanted to charge the smallest premium possible to our customers. The Herb Garden is handmade here in our manufacturing facility in Massachusetts and each garden will go through thorough testing before leaving the plant. So you can be sure that you are receiving a world-class garden unlike anything on the market.

story:
Short Summary

My name is JoAnn Fowler I am an Emmy nominated make up artist .  You may know my work from The L Word, Twilight Eclipse, Xmen 3, Final Destination 3 & 5 , Reefer Madness etc.  

A few weeks ago 40+ friends volunteered their time and talent to film a fund-raising video for this campaign. Our intent is to change lives by empowering  consumers with an amazing cruelty free product, cutting edge info, complete ethical transparency and an opportunity to take part in a movement  to help eradicate cancers, hormonal disruptions and skin eruptions caused or exacerbated by the thousands of untested synthetic chemicals found today in mainstream cosmetics.

We are in the final formulation of what we believe to be the cleanest, most beautiful certified organic foundation in the world.   Sappho Organics, a small company has been growing organically over the years and is gaining in popularity all over North America. The thing is we are still very small and green technology has come a long way and we need and want to keep up! We are formulating a base that is 

 ~100% natural

~organic

~ Vegan 

 ~  paraben, phthalate, gluten, dimethicone, mineral oil, synthetic/organic dye -  free . 

~has a natural emulsifier, a pore minimizer that helps impede the growth of breast cancer cells 

~possibly ( fingers crossed!) with an organic non nano sunscreen

 hands down  -  gob smacking Gorgeous!

We are a  small company funded privately and personally and we want to keep our independence to keep true to our mission to provide you with the best of the best and cleanest of the clean.  We believe no one's health should be compromised because of using a cosmetic but we also LOVE MAKEUP and so the only solution is to have a makeup that out performs anything out there ~ and we do!

Sappho Organics supports "Causemetics" in Canada which supplies direct assistance to women with breast cancer - we have donated over 600 Sandra Vegan lip glosses to "Causemetics" for 100% of the proceeds  because no one with breast cancer should go without heat, food, shelter, day care , transportation because they are sick. We will be following through with Pinky&Magoo  products as well  for both "Causemetics" and Plan's Because I am a Girl. 

In the making of the emulsifying wax we use now there is an infinitesimal chance that a phthalate could be produced and then a further infinitesimal chance that that phthalate could end up in a foundation . We want to eradicate this chance so we are running this campaign to fund this development otherwise . We don't need huge pledeges we understand that people work hard for their money - a whole bunch of small ones would be awesome... Please support . 

 We chose indiegogo and flex funding as all is doable over time however to be able to raise a large amount at once ensures more skin tones for more women! This is our mission and calling. Safe cosmetics for all!

 

What We Need & What You Get

What we need are funds so that we can keep true to our ethos - transparency of ingredients, dedication to our planet , clean non toxic ingredients all  while maintaining reasonable profitability and giving back to community .  
Funds that are raised will go into the final stages of development and coloration  for the line  as well as  the packaging and manufacturing of as many colors as much as the funds will allow (hoping for 15) .  
Besides choices of perks  please know that there are individuals who will work tirelessly to bring you their very best in service to the campaign for safe, beautiful cosmetics. You will inherit a team with where experience, individual talent and  sheer enthusiasm are  all held in esteem.  
 A team grateful for the opportunity to make you proud .
 Possibly the opportunity to save a life.
The Impact
  • We want to change the world a little and we need your help
  • " In their paper, the CDC researchers reported that women age 20 to 40 appeared to have the highest levels of DBP in their bodies. This was a concern. Women in this group — childbearing age — were the ones who would be most likely to expose their developing babies to DBP, a chemical that causes birth defects and lifelong reproductive problems in male animals exposed in the womb."0
  • "When it comes to living a healthy and natural lifestyle, what you put on your body is just as significant as what you put in your body. Your skin is the largest organ of your body and since it is porous, it absorbs whatever you put on it. A study published in the American Journal of Public Health looked into the skin’s absorption rates of chemicals found in drinking water. It showed that the skin absorbed an average of 64% of total contaminant dosage.1 Other studies found the face to be several times more permeable than broad body surfaces and an absorption rate of 100% for underarms and genitalia.2 And another peer-reviewed study showed 100% absorption for fragrance ingredients.3"

Footnotes: 

 0. Malkan, Stacey. Not Just  a Pretty Face.  New Society Publishers .2007-10-01;16

  1. Brown et al. The role of skin absorption as a route of exposure for volatile organic compounds (VOCs) in drinking water. Am J Public Health. 1984 May; 74(5): 479–484.
  2. Kasting and Kretsos.Skin Pharmacol Physiol 2005;18:55-74
  3. Robinson et al. The Importance of Exposure Estimation in the Assessment of Skin Sensitization risk. Contact Dermatitis 2000; 42:251-259.
Dont just believe us! 
http://beautyeditor.ca/2015/05/29/green-makeup-artist-joann-fowler


Risks & Challenges

After years building  Sappho Organics exclusively by word of mouth we felt we had enough exposure to come to you for funding. We have just this last year been in InStyle twice with our liquid foundations being named in the top 10 green beauty products in 2014 .The  process of reformulating is a big one  and we need outside funding to make this happen. 
We are ready to challenge the best of the best and we are ready to move to a global position offering women around the world cosmetics that not only looks stunnig but count for something. We want to take every detail of sustainability and performance into consideration from our formulation to our packaging. 
To remain true to our mission has been the biggest risk and biggest challenge so far and what has brought us to Indiegogo.  To remain independent as we are formulating and setting our parameters is very important.   We felt it was right to reach out to the people that will use the product to help us develop and make this line. 
We promise to get greener as we grow, to stay abreast of green technology, to remain 100% transparent in our ingredients, to honor all people, to create beautiful organic vegan products for you and those you love.  
 
Other Ways You Can Help
  • If you can't contribute we totally get it. We have been there, believe me but please help us get the word out - social media sharing ect all appreciated!

Dont just believe us! http://beautyeditor.ca/2015/05/29/green-makeup-artist-joann-fowler

Risks & Challenges
After years building  Sappho Organics exclusively by word of mouth we felt we had enough exposure to come to you for funding. We have just this last year been in InStyle twice with our liquid foundations being named in the top 10 green beauty products in 2014 .The  process of reformulating is a big one  and we need outside funding to make this happen. 
We are ready to challenge the best of the best and we are ready to move to a global position offering women around the world cosmetics that not only looks stunnig but count for something. We want to take every detail of sustainability and performance into consideration from our formulation to our packaging. 
To remain true to our mission has been the biggest risk and biggest challenge so far and what has brought us to Indiegogo.  To remain independent as we are formulating and setting our parameters is very important.   We felt it was right to reach out to the people that will use the product to help us develop and make this line. 
We promise to get greener as we grow, to stay abreast of green technology, to remain 100% transparent in our ingredients, to honor all people, to create beautiful organic vegan products for you and those you love.  
 

Other Ways You Can Help


 
If you can't contribute we totally get it. We have been there, believe me but please help us get the word out - social media sharing ect all appreciated!

story:
Does this look familiar?  Then let's change that!

 

The Reusable lid that is attractive and keeps food free from germs with each and every use!

 

EZLIDZ is a joint project, started by brother Bryan Dennis, who came up with the idea for a see thru lid that allows for displaying and storing large pans of food at family, church and other events.

Have you ever been to a function where there was much good food, but trying to keep it covered and away from germs proved to be challenging? I am sure you have! Be challenged NO MORE, because EZLIDZ has taken care of it for you.

During market research someone said…”Hey, this is not rocket science…but it’s pretty darn smart.”  And, We AGREE!

 

 

WHY EZLIDZ?

There are a few reasons to get and use EZLIDZ…here are some:

  • Avoid FOIL embarrassment when serving prepared foods
  • Food remains securely covered until ready to be served
  • Remove chance of dust, bugs and germs from getting on your food
  • Present your dishes in a manner that is appetizing to your guests
  • Allows for food to be identified without lifting the cover
  • Reusable - no more trips to the store for more aluminum foil
  • Easy to store - either flat or standing

 

OUR GOAL

We started this project in the Summer of 2015 and have spent over a year with a design and production company to get it to where we believe it will satisfy you - the consumer. We have been able to submit for a patent (which is pending) and are now ready to build the molds to begin production.

Our goal of $30,000 represents the funds needed to complete building the molds - and we are offering some exclusive specials for your help. With our met goal we anticipate delivery of EZLIDZ in time for your Summer BBQs or July 2017.

 

Here is how YOU can HELP!

  • Purchase one EZLIDZ at full price
  • Purchase three (3) for the price of two (2)
  • Be a Supporter with  a donation to help us get off the ground (minimum of $5.00 is appreciated)
  • Become a patron by donating $100 or more
  • Back us with a donation of any amount by clicking on the BACKERS link
  • Like us on Facebook directly from the link below
  • TWEET to the world to let them know about EZLIDZ
  • Refer us to your friends
  • Use the link above to send comments to us to let us know how we are doing

 

MEET THE TEAM: Bryan | Carl | Barbara | Lloyd

     

  • Bryan: his creative idea was the start of this project.
  • Carl: his sound financial mind ensures proper spending of funds.
  • Barbara: her business and management skills ensure that the business employs sound business practices.
  • Lloyd: the engineer among us, makes sure that the product works.

 

Small Four Enterprises LLC

EZLIDZ  is a product of Small Four Enterprises LLC, which is a family company founded by the last four siblings of a family of 13. Bryan Dennis invented this product after (as he describes it) “being blessed with a stroke.” Bryan a network engineer found that the limited use of his left hand opened up much time for thought and reflection. It was during one of these periods that Bryan came up with the concept and invited his three older siblings to work on it with him. Together with Neil Rosenbaum and the team from 360 Product Development Company of Syracuse New York, the team developed EZLIDZ Full and Half size pan. Together they focus on making EZLIDZ a reality and available to all.

story:
How it all began

Wow, it's been five years. When I first started Red Pandora my goal was committed to using high quality, organic ingredients (rice syrup, Madagascar vanilla , unrefined coconut oil), and to strictly avoid corn syrup.

During that time I staged at Otom and Blackbird (Michelin star restaurants) to augment my flavor-pairing skills and threw as many supper club events as I could handle and started speaking with suppliers and building relationships with farmers. My Grandfather owned a restaurant when I was a young so I knew the importance of using high quality without taking shortcuts. Also, slow cooking was a very traditional staple in my Grandmothers and Mothers house.  With the knowledge I gathered over the years, I started making small-batches of my corn and placing it on store shelves. 

 


My cooking secret, really wasn't really a secret. But was a caramel making process that is similar to what confectionery chefs have used since the eighteenth century.

By utilizing a " back to the basics" style of cooking,  I was able to create a caramel recipe  that didn't cook off the vanilla notes. Using freshly-popped  organic farm grown kernels, healthier oils and smokey bacon without nitrates also helped.

I wanted to create snack combinations that were playful and unique in flavor. I found that other caramel snacks were either too sweet, not rich in flavor and or didn't carry the complex flavors that they were meant to carry do to the process and ingredients used.


Humble Beginnings - First Packaging when Red Pandora snacks hit stores 


Due to the delicate nature of my ingredients (no preservatives or GMO's) I realized that I needed better packaging to protect my product from the elements, keep it fresher and make it last longer. I started working with manufacturers, suppliers and my designer. End the end, we came up with a foil type packaging within a cool box and traditional tins.

 New Packaging

Currently I have 5 flavors total:

  • Caramel Bacon Cachaca Crunch  - A caramel popcorn made with a blend of real Madagascar vanilla, Imported Brazilian Rum, Uncured smoked bacon and Organic Popcorn. A good combination of salty and sweet.

  • Spicy Ginger Snap Crunch  - Caramel popcorn made with Fresh Ginger, real Madagascar vanilla, Organic Popcorn and real spices

  • Chipotle Cheddar   - The rich velvety smooth flavor of natural cheddar, combined with the deep smoky heat of real chipotle peppers and just the right amount of olive oil.

  • Honey Truffled popcorn w/Apple wood Smoked Salt  - Rich caramel corn made with a sweet fragrant honey infused with real Black Summer Truffles for a balance of earthiness and sweetness.

  • Vanilla Cachaca Crunch  - A caramel popcorn made with a blend of real Madagascar vanilla, Cachaca Brazilian Rum, Pecans and Organic Popcorn
  • No GMO's
  • Made With Organic Ingredients
  • No Preservatives
  • No Artificial Ingredients
  • No High Fructose Corn Syrup



Cool Perks!

Be the first to try some of my delicious caramel corn snacks! 

$10
A very special thanks for helping this mission

$25 + shipping
A very special thanks for helping this mission listed on the Redpandorafoods website

$30 + shipping
You get to choose from four flavors of deliciousness! One box of either Vanilla Cachaca Crunch, Chipotle Cheddar or Spicy Ginger Snap Crunch. A lot of Yumminess in On Box!

$35 + shipping
Box of Caramel Bacon Cachaca Crunch made with real uncured bacon (with no nitrates), Madagascar Vanilla, and Cachaca Rum

$40 + shipping
My Majestic Honey Truffled popcorn w/Apple wood Smoked Salt Rich caramel corn made with a sweet fragrant honey infused with real Black Summer Truffles for a balance of earthiness and sweetness.

150 + Shipping
You get all five of the Red Pandora Flavors: Caramel Bacon Cachaca Crunch, Vanilla Cachaca Crunch, Chipotle Cheddar, Spicy Ginger Snap Crunch and Honey Truffled popcorn w/Apple wood Smoked Salt. A saving of 15 bucks!

$200
Free entry to the Red Pandora Launch event in Soho, New York City
This event will be a showcase of the delectable pairings of Red Pandora snacks and some craft beer and wine favorites.

Please contact me for overseas shipping so that I can calculate the approximate cost.


Packaging Cost

Unfortunately packaging can get very expensive, due to the diminishing manufacturing companies located in the US. My goal was to make sure that most of my packaging was created locally which made more sense than making a large Carbon footprint, due to shipping. 

Your pledge money will go towards the following:

  • Box Die Cut
  • 4 color Box Printing
  • Foil Bags (within Box)
  • 4 Color Tin Print
  • Tin linings


The Impact

This is a project that I cherish dearly due to my love of food and working in the restaurant industry.

I chose to work with smaller distributors who focus on specialty items and/or organic products. It’s quite funny because through the years I’ve built strong relationships with the farmers and distributors who understand my needs and help make for a better product.

Years ago my awareness of connecting fresh quality food with health gradually happened. I’m still learning, but the education that I’ve received so far has been great.

It's been five long  years of planning and Red Pandora is ready for a Relaunch.

So lets start together and actually put some awesome products back on specialty store shelves and via the web!


Other Ways You Can Help

If possible please help Spread the Word and make a bit of noise about this campaign. I have 30 days! Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks so much for visiting!

story:
The 'Say Hello Sweets' Story

Say Hello Sweets came to life, when Naomi began experimenting with making ice cream during a heatwave in the Summer of 2015. It was an idea that came about, as a way to fundraise for her sweet and much loved dog, Babycakes, who needed expensive surgery. 

Ice cream tasting parties were held by donation, to help cover some of the vet bill costs. The positive feedback from friends & family was truly inspiring & they began asking if they could order & purchase some of the delicious ice cream flavors that they were eating.

Then, Naomi fell in love...with creating and developing unique ice cream flavors, that is! And so it began. The vet bills began to get paid off, one pint of ice cream at a time & Naomi realized, that her love of making ice cream, was getting serious!

With the dream of making a living producing unexpected, sometimes wacky-flavoured, yet always delicious ice cream, Naomi set about crafting a business plan and Say Hello Sweets was born.

Naomi sources out the highest quality, organic ingredients, from local food markets and farms, to create ice cream flavor delights like none other. The ultimate goal is to create unique recipes, that will produce creamy, delicious, luscious textured ice cream, without chemical stabilizers or artificial ingredients.

With a little luck and Naomi's trademark enthusiasm & determination, the Say Hello Sweets ice cream truck will be hitting the streets of Vancouver this upcoming summer. Watch for Say Hello Sweets at local festivals & events. Also available, will be custom ice cream themes for weddings and private functions!

P.S. Babycakes is doing great!

Where's the money going?

Naomi needs help to get Junior ready for the streets!

Naomi has big plans for this little truck. She's going to start with an exterior remodel. This includes installing a service window ($600), a generator ($1,849), and of course a fresh paint job ($900). The truck also needs an engine rebuild before it can be safely & reliably driven ($2500). For the inside she needs all the bells and whistles: sinks ($1447), a hot water tower ($400), water storage ($300), an ice cream machine ($5,000 +) refrigeration/freezers ($3000), serving equipment ($400), shelving and flooring ($1200), an espresso machine ($1000), a pos system ($400) & more... 

Along with the truck remodel she'll need to get insurance, licensing, registration, & permits in order ($$$). A commercial kitchen space to rent must be sought out for production & storage. Additionally, there are plans to update the packaging to be 100% compostable & improve the look of how the product(s) is showcased.

Why flexible funding? 

Naomi is very eager & determined to get this project up & driving! She works full time in restaurant management & every spare moment & dollar is dedicated to getting Say Hello Sweets going. She chose flexible funding because this way, even if the goal is not 100% funded, she will be able to get started regardless. 

The Menu

Unlike your average ice cream truck, the Say Hello Sweets truck will specialize in fried ice cream as well as drinks that celebrate a union between coffee & ice cream. Classic hard ice creams will also be available by the pint through a membership program that delivers to the client's home or office. Here's a tentative sample menu: 

        

Chocolate Nirvana rich dark chocolate & a hint of espresso

Vanilla Rhapsody Madagascar & Tahitian blend freckled w/ pure ground vanilla beans

Jam Session juicy ripe strawberries & tart rhubarb 

Takes Two to Mango sweet mango puree with a mint syrup swirl

Milk Money sweetened condensed coconut cream w/ homemade toasted marshmallows

Heaven Sent Me Honey Black Sesame toasted black sesame seeds, coconut cream & local honey 

Monkey's Uncle caramelized banana & toasted walnut pieces

Main Squeeze heady saffron, floral honey, & bittersweet orange zest

The Fog vanilla infused earl grey tea & local honey

Mint to Be fresh mint with dark chocolate flakes 

Lemon Squeezy floral lemon & buttery coconut 

Café No Lait vanilla infused coconut cream & medium roast espresso

  • Other Ways You Can Help

Help network this campaign. Here's how:

  • Make some noise about this campaign. Tell your friends & share, share, share!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much!

story:
Picture this: 

A minimalist chef-- Kesh-- rolling into your town with a fully equipped Sprinter Van ready to make lunch or dinner for up to 16 people. At the table, organically sourced and consciously prepared meals enjoyed by you and your loved ones. Atmosphere: laughter and storytelling. Join in! 

The Impact

With your contribution Kesh's Table will reach more people in a memorable way. Three major parts of Kesh's Table will be fulfilled when you back this project:

  • Cooking: something I learned at age 8 in Liberia West Africa, and continued to learn in India, Turkey, Italy, Georgia, Spain and other countries. Each meal comes with heart warming experiences of the people who taught Kesh these recipes.
  • Traveling: With 32 Countries under my belt and 32,000 stories in my pocket, I'll inspire you to appreciate the world we live in starting with taste and smell.
  • Writing: With my cookbook underway, perhaps cooking with you will inspire a recipe or two to add to the manuscript, with your name added as co creator of the recipe. I also plant to document the whole Van life adventure that will be used for a later book, documentary or podcast.

When I traveled through Europe and Australia in 2018 and 2019 out to heal from grief of parental losses, I wanted to see some of the places my mother loved, experience their culture and hospitality and share meals with them as I saw my family do when those people visited us at our home in Liberia. It was a powerful experience. 

Even more powerful was the fact that I put myself out there with faith in humanity, knowing that there are  good people willing to open their doors to a stranger and host him. I've made lifelong friends in the process. 

After our slow 2020 year, as well as our needing to connect in a conscious way, I know my traveling and cooking with people will bring rejuvenating vision and a shift in self care and conscious eating. 

Risks & Challenges

I've put my blinders on and know that many people want to be a part of this adventure. There are people in the US who want to experience other cultures and i have a welcoming and disarming personality that can be a door opener for many.

I plan to work with local farmers to encourage people to get to know their food source, their neighbors and nourish their bodies, minds and spirits. 

My plan is well laid with a website to encourage communication with me so that we can plan properly how to manifest unforgettable dining moments. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to help but not to the extent of the amount as a backer with perks for this project, connect with me via email or text and we can work something beautiful out.

In the end life is one big "Thank You!"

If you would like to help but not to the extent of the amount as a backer with perks for this project, connect with me via email or text and we can work something beautiful out.
In the end life is one big "Thank You!"

story:
Short Summary

We were recently left without a home. Our shared kitchen - Pilot Works - abruptly went out of business, and in doing so left us and many other companies without a commercial kitchen to work in. We had to cancel all of our holiday markets, and are unable to fulfill our orders to our vendors.  Because of the unforeseen closure of our kitchen, we did not have enough time to catch the window of pepper produce, and more importantly, apply for a new location license and prepare for our winter stock.

My name is Andre Springer and I am the creator and founder of Shaquanda Will Feed You LLC.  I was born in Bedford Stuyvesant, Brooklyn, of Barbadian decent and grew up in a household focused around the love for all things food. My Grandmother and I pickled peppers and made sauces together in Far Rockaway, Queens. She was a second mother to me and even though she has left this plane of existence, she still continues to be an inspiration.  As I grew older, I fell in love with creating art.  As an artist, I began investigating symbolism within the African Diaspora, creating work about found and lost objects. I studied Fine Arts at Parsons School of Design at the New School, and at the age of 20 I took on one of my first hospitality jobs - bartending - at a place called "The Slide," on the Bowery in downtown Manhattan. There I met the infamous, beautiful, and incisively clever drag queen legend Linda Simpson. Shaquanda made her first appearance at Linda Simpson's weekly Gay Jeopardy event, and soon thereafter began hosting and performing for the people. As an artist, lover of food, and drag queen, I needed to make something that was most authentically me – hot sauce seemed like the natural next step.

What We Need & What You Get

Our first step is to locate a commercial space true to our ethos. We will then be able to restart our Shaquanda production development and fun-size production runs. Storage and a place where Mizz Quanda can get her mail. 

 

Scaling is one of the most difficult transitions in a company's growth. Prior to our shared kitchen closing down, we were limited to making small batches of up to 500 bottles at a time and were having trouble fulfilling demand at that capacity. With financial help we can retain the same great quality as before and grow.

Shaquanda also wants to go to school, take some courses on how to be a better business person and learn the lingo of those suits so that she can be a boss, just like how Joan Crawford schooled the Pepsi guys in the board scene from the movie Mommy Dearest.

This financial assistance will help us develop new products, and give us time to really perfect our business. 

 

You get all these beautiful and delicious prizes, be the envy of your friends when they know that you are in the know. Cook with this sauce and have all your homegirls wonder how did your roasted chicken, soup, or casserole turned out better than Karen's. Shaquanda is your secret weapon in the kitchen! 

The Impact

Our mission is to be visible on shelves, for all age ranges. We want to make change for those who don't see themselves in the supermarket. Let us spread a message of love, camp, and acceptance.

 

As we grow, all of us need to take an oath to protect our earth. Part of Shaquanda's business model is to constantly grow with the caring thoughtfulness of the ingredients sourced and materials used.  Waste is an issue and we need to be responsible with how we make and produce commodities. 

Risks & Challenges

This isn't our first time at the rodeo! We are registered, have our licenses, and are a capable business with the knowledge and experience of making a delicious DOA approved product! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Feel free to share on social media if you are out of coins! also follow us @shaquandawillfeedyou

story:
Short Summary

Now more than ever, we need to remember the joy and excitement people feel when they are feasting on their favorite Japanese dishes. We need to stand up for smoother, easier service throughout the sector as well. This past year has been challenging for all restaurants, pushing many in the food industry into bankruptcy.

We are not out of the woods yet, either.

For the foreseeable future, businesses will remain in closing and reopening. Some restaurants will be able to serve food outside, offer takeout or will remain closed permanently.

 

 

Unfortunately, these challenges will not end anytime soon., Japanese restaurants are particularly at risk of financial difficulty. Every month, we can expect more Japanese restaurants to go under

So we decided to take action and solve the problems that Japanese chefs and Japanese restaurants are facing in the U.S. We have engineered a platform and a business model that encourages people to think differently about Japanese cuisine and the businesses that support it.

 

 

 

What is Umami Square

 

 

* Simplify the process – and focus on the food.

Through Umami Square, you can forget about mastering logistics and supply-chain management, devoting all your attention to creating delicious and unique food products. Giving you time to focus on what you do best, creating amazing Japanese cuisine, while we handle the outsourcing operations.

* Tap into markets nationwide.

Available in all fifty US states, Umami Square does not fall into the same boundaries and limits that have caused other food-delivery apps to stagnate. When you register for Umami Square, you can immediately start doing business across the country, even in Hawaii and Alaska. This is a comprehensive, forward-thinking perspective of your business, one that stretches from one coast to the other and beyond.

 

* Hone in on Japanese cuisine.

Rather than stretching ourselves thin, we have decided to cater to businesses that serve Japanese cuisine exclusively. This means we can offer a wide range of our expertise to all of our users, as well as building on what we know of businesses that serve Japanese cuisine.

* Lean on world-class business consulting and strategy.

In addition to using Umami Square logistics, you can leverage all of our marketing, sales, and revenue insights to expand your business. Umami Square is here to empower your growth, opening the door to new business opportunities and putting untold growth within striking distance for you. When you use all of the consulting and strategy services that we have to offer, expanding your presence and reach, you can turn 2020 from a bad year into a spectacular one.

 

Here is how it works

To get started, a Japanese chef, restaurant, or food business will sign up. This is a straightforward process, and it costs nothing.  

For customers as well, the process is simple: you select a vendor or restaurant, add a card/payment method, set a delivery schedule, and get ready to chow down. It's easy, fast, and fun. The average price is around $80(over 4 people) included shipping fee.

Created after the JAPANFes cancellation, Umami Square is carving out a niche and lending a hand to Japanese vendors and the Japanese food community – at a time when we all need a renewed sense of hope and optimism. A thrilling event, the highlight of many people's and many businesses' year, JAPANFes has carried on Japanese pride for years, and although we know it will survive this downturn, we feel compelled to do what we can to make up for it now.

 

 

We are ready to move forward with the Umami Square concept, but to do that, we could use your support

 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

Right now, we are turning to you for help raising the funds that we need to complete the development of Umami Square and launch our complete platform. Our goal through this campaign is $10,000, which will cover restaurants sales on Umami Square.  If we raise anything above our goal,  we can support our restaurants even more.

To say thanks to everyone who makes a contribution to this campaign, we are offering some exclusive rewards, including early access to Umami Square and limited-edition Umami Square-branded merchandise.

Contribute now and be a participant on getting Umami square up and running!

 

Risks & Challenges

To date, we have put extensive time into planning Umami Square. We are confident that we can launch our platform in a timely manner, and if any challenges are so daunting that they cause a delay in our timeline, we will figure out a way forward and send out an update to all of our contributors, remaining transparent every step of the way.
From here on out, you are a part of this. We welcome you to the Umami Square community!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Beyond contributing some amount of money to this campaign, you can show your support for Umami Square by sharing a link to the campaign on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, and any other social media platforms you use. The more people are aware of Umami Square before the first day that the platform goes live, the smoother the launch will go. We want to show strong numbers the first week so that people understand what this platform can be!

On behalf of all of us here at Umami Square – domo arigato.

story:
Wash the waterproof device to restore the adhesiveness of the microsuction pad on the back

 

 
 
 

 Input food type and expiration date to be written onto a Serva device

 

 

 

 

Scan a Serva device to receive data already written onto it

 

 
 
 
 
 
Microsuction | Stick onto almost any food item or surface
 
 
 
Waterproof | Fully waterproofed - No need to worry about damaging the NFC chip inside 
 
 
 
Reusable | This helps generate far less waste over the product's lifetime
 
 
 
NFC | Read and write NFC chips inside the device which has no batteries - which means the device is functional anywhere ranging from room to freezing temperatures 
 
 
 
Short-term food storage | Great for short term food storage and for foods that expire quickly
 
 
 
Long-term food storage | Great for saving your longer-lasting food items 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Click the image to be directed to the referral form!
 
 

 

 

 

 
 
 
 

 

 

 

 

 

Watch this video to learn even more about FOSA:

 

 
 
Preserves Freshness

 

Powerful

 

Compact and light

 

Easy

 

Quick

 

 

No cable

 

 

Simple

 

 

 

 

For music credit:

https://soundcloud.com/day7official/skyrocket

Attribution-NoDerivs 3.0 Unported (CC BY-ND 3.0)

https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nd/3.0/

Music provided by Free Vibes: https://goo.gl/NkGhTg

 

For video credit:

Stock footage provided by Videvo, downloaded from https://www.videvo.net 

Ripening Banana Time Lapse: https://www.videvo.net - modified footage - Author: Beachfront

 

Risks and challenges

The biggest reason for securing funding is to have the capital needed to invest in creating the physical tags as outlined in the campaign above. Our goal is also to provide consumers with other types of tags in the future that will allow the Serva system to be used in an even broader range of applications. As of right now, we are releasing Serva app, version 1.0. Although we know the app works well, there is always room for improvement. Even though we have a finished product, being successfully funded will go a long way in terms of updating and creating new and better apps in the future. The app is currently developed for Android 4.4 and above, for smartphones only. With your support we plan to develop Serva to work with Apple iOS as well so that it can be available to many more people. With your support and funding, you will help us to achieve these goals!

 

Long-lasting design

The Serva device has no batteries which means it can be left anywhere from room to freezing temperatures and last indefinitely!

 

Reusability and recyclability

The Serva device/NFC tag is reusable so that you don’t have to dispose of it ever. The data on the NFC chip inside can be overwritten so you never have to worry about having to replace a Serva device.

story:
The Short Of It

Two years ago, we were five friends who thought we were in Israel for a vacation. Really, each of us responded to an invitation for an adventure much bigger than we could have imagined. Because of our passion for wine, we went in search of the best vineyards in Israel.

We were blown away with the quality and uniqueness of the wine we tasted and realized we wanted to share it with our friends back home. The challenge was, wine from Israel isn’t easy to find in the United States. So, we made it our mission to change that.

In May 2019, we launched Israeli Good Wine, a club that that brings amazing wines from the land of Israel to your door in time for your next gathering around the table.

We’ve spent our blood, sweat, tears, and personal capital to get the company off the ground, but now we could use your help. With this campaign, we’re aiming to accomplish some specific goals:

  • Expand our ability to ship into every state in the U.S. where we can legally ship direct to consumer.
  • Import new and exclusive wines from Israel and share them for the first time ever in the United States.
  • Solidify our business model as a new company.

 

What We Need & What You Get

So far, we’ve operated using only our own capital investments and have run as a no-debt company. We’re a lean, mean, wine-dealing machine! In order to solidify and expand our business, we’re looking to secure $32,000 in funding.

Our business model is simple: we bring wine from Israel to people like you.

“I didn’t even know Israel had wine?!” you might be saying.

Two and a half years ago, we didn’t know it either! But after we discovered how amazing the wines from Israel were, we knew we had to do something about it. That’s when we became passionate about bringing wine from Israel to the United States.

'

 

Securing this round of funding will help us to accomplish:

 

  • Expand our ability to ship into every state in the U.S. where we can legally ship direct to consumer.

 

Each State requires separate registration, license fees, and reporting. All of this costs money! In order to ship to your state, we need to know that there are enough of you interested in receiving our wine for us to pull the trigger on applying for the license. It's that simple.

 

  • Import new and exclusive wines from Israel and share them for the first time ever in the United States.

 

It's not cost effective to label-approve, ship, store, or handle small quantities of wine. We need to place larger orders in order to keep the costs to you, our customer, at a reasonable level so that it's not a one-time experience, but rather you can drink Israeli Good wine as often as you would like to! We believe in operating our company as debt-free as possible, thus rather than taking out a bank loan, we would rather invite you to be a part of bringing Israeli Good Wine across the ocean so it can come directly to your door. When we can buy in larger quantities, it saves money. We are then able to pass that savings onto you, our customer.

 

  • Solidify our business model as a new company.

 

We've invested our own time and money for nearly two years to get this company up and running and we're not taking any money out of the company for the foreseeable future. As we grow and expand, there are basic operating expenses that a portion of this campaign will go to as we continue to solidify our business model and run as a no-debt start-up venture.

 

Our perks to help us reach this goal includes some amazing wines at lower-than-retail rates, FREE shipping, and amazing merch to rep your love for Israeli Good Wine.

The Impact

We believe that wine has the power to change the world. Each winery we partner with is founded or run by pioneering Israelis who are giving all that they have to bring the land of Israel back to life.

Farmers are the foundation and roots of the country and embracing the modern-day wine movement in Israel helps these men and women settle the land and cultivate the future. When you join partner and buy with us, you’re not just receiving great wine, you’re taking part in the pioneer effort and supporting the land of Israel.

 

Risks & Challenges

1. As with any business, you can face unforeseen challenges. The biggest challenges that Israel faces are geopolitical in nature. Many of the wineries we work with are in what is labeled "The West Bank", this region is important to us because it is literally the Biblical heartland of Israel. It's where it all began! Because this is considered "contested territory", the ability for us to work with these wineries can be inhibited for a variety of reasons.

2. We need to reach a certain threshold with our funding in order to meet minimum order quantities and to keep this business economically sustainable. Thus, if we are not able to make that threshold, then we won't be able to place the orders. This is why it is imperative to get the word out there to as many people as you can! Help us give others the experience of wine from Israel!

3. When we decided to step out and take a bold stance in aligning ourselves with Israel, we realized it would become controversial to some. Our desire is not to be controversial, but rather to be on the right side of history according to Truth.

We believe in what we are doing at Israeli Good Wine. It's not just a business to us; it's a calling.

We face the challenge of nay-sayers, critics, and many who don't believe that Israel has the right to exist. Our response to these critics is to invite everyone to come to the table, sit with us, and hear about what is ACTUALLY happening in Israel.

We can truthfully say that whether you are a Jew, Muslim, Christian, Atheist, or otherwise, there is nowhere else in the Middle East that provides more freedom of speech, freedom of religion, and entrepreneurial opportunity than the State of Israel. Wine is just one of the vehicles we can employ to have this conversation.

 

Who We Are

We're a group of friends who love to travel the world, meet new people, and share experiences. We come from various backgrounds (including aviation, neuroscience, sales, and coffee!), but we share a love for the nation of Israel.

We've given our all to this venture and plan on being invested in this company for decades. We're grateful for the chance to get to share wine and stories from a land we love with new and old friends across the country.

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course contributing financially is a huge benefit to helping us reach our goals, but some people just can't contribute—and that's OK! Even if you can't opt in for one of our levels, here's a few ways that you can help us reach our goals:

Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!

  • Share this on Facebook and other social media channels. The more noise, the better chance we have of reaching our goals! The share tools here are easy to use!
  • Don't forget email and texts! These are great ways to share this with a family members or friends who would be interested in trying wine from the land of Israel or who want to participate in something fun and new!
  • Prayers and good vibes appreciated. It's no easy feat to start a business and even more difficult to start one working in the Middle East. We're so grateful for all of the prayers and well wishes we've received from family, friends, and colleagues in the early stages of this company and we'd be so honored if you care to offer prayers and support. We believe that agreement has power and we're grateful if you'd add your agreement to what we're building. Todah! (Thanks! in Hebrew).

 

 

*Israeli Good Wine is a brand of 32 Parallel. All rights reserved. All vouchers are redeemable on our website: israeligoodwine.com. Due to state delivery restrictions, we are currently only delivering to AK, AZ, CA, CO, D.C., FL, MO, MN, TN, TX. Anyone purchasing a perk level containing an alcohol voucher in a closed state will receive their wine as soon as the license in that state has been approved for direct shipment. All wine vouchers must be placed by a person 21 years of age or older.

Our business model is simple: we bring wine from Israel to people like you.

“I didn’t even know Israel had wine?!” you might be saying.
Two and a half years ago, we didn’t know it either! But after we discovered how amazing the wines from Israel were, we knew we had to do something about it. That’s when we became passionate about bringing wine from Israel to the United States.
'
 
Securing this round of funding will help us to accomplish:
 
Expand our ability to ship into every state in the U.S. where we can legally ship direct to consumer.
 
Each State requires separate registration, license fees, and reporting. All of this costs money! In order to ship to your state, we need to know that there are enough of you interested in receiving our wine for us to pull the trigger on applying for the license. It's that simple.
 
Import new and exclusive wines from Israel and share them for the first time ever in the United States.
 
It's not cost effective to label-approve, ship, store, or handle small quantities of wine. We need to place larger orders in order to keep the costs to you, our customer, at a reasonable level so that it's not a one-time experience, but rather you can drink Israeli Good wine as often as you would like to! We believe in operating our company as debt-free as possible, thus rather than taking out a bank loan, we would rather invite you to be a part of bringing Israeli Good Wine across the ocean so it can come directly to your door. When we can buy in larger quantities, it saves money. We are then able to pass that savings onto you, our customer.
 
Solidify our business model as a new company.
 
We've invested our own time and money for nearly two years to get this company up and running and we're not taking any money out of the company for the foreseeable future. As we grow and expand, there are basic operating expenses that a portion of this campaign will go to as we continue to solidify our business model and run as a no-debt start-up venture.
 
Our perks to help us reach this goal includes some amazing wines at lower-than-retail rates, FREE shipping, and amazing merch to rep your love for Israeli Good Wine.


The Impact
We believe that wine has the power to change the world. Each winery we partner with is founded or run by pioneering Israelis who are giving all that they have to bring the land of Israel back to life.

Farmers are the foundation and roots of the country and embracing the modern-day wine movement in Israel helps these men and women settle the land and cultivate the future. When you join partner and buy with us, you’re not just receiving great wine, you’re taking part in the pioneer effort and supporting the land of Israel.

 

Risks & Challenges
1. As with any business, you can face unforeseen challenges. The biggest challenges that Israel faces are geopolitical in nature. Many of the wineries we work with are in what is labeled "The West Bank", this region is important to us because it is literally the Biblical heartland of Israel. It's where it all began! Because this is considered "contested territory", the ability for us to work with these wineries can be inhibited for a variety of reasons.
2. We need to reach a certain threshold with our funding in order to meet minimum order quantities and to keep this business economically sustainable. Thus, if we are not able to make that threshold, then we won't be able to place the orders. This is why it is imperative to get the word out there to as many people as you can! Help us give others the experience of wine from Israel!
3. When we decided to step out and take a bold stance in aligning ourselves with Israel, we realized it would become controversial to some. Our desire is not to be controversial, but rather to be on the right side of history according to Truth.
We believe in what we are doing at Israeli Good Wine. It's not just a business to us; it's a calling.
We face the challenge of nay-sayers, critics, and many who don't believe that Israel has the right to exist. Our response to these critics is to invite everyone to come to the table, sit with us, and hear about what is ACTUALLY happening in Israel.
We can truthfully say that whether you are a Jew, Muslim, Christian, Atheist, or otherwise, there is nowhere else in the Middle East that provides more freedom of speech, freedom of religion, and entrepreneurial opportunity than the State of Israel. Wine is just one of the vehicles we can employ to have this conversation.
 
Who We Are
We're a group of friends who love to travel the world, meet new people, and share experiences. We come from various backgrounds (including aviation, neuroscience, sales, and coffee!), but we share a love for the nation of Israel.
We've given our all to this venture and plan on being invested in this company for decades. We're grateful for the chance to get to share wine and stories from a land we love with new and old friends across the country.


Other Ways You Can Help
Of course contributing financially is a huge benefit to helping us reach our goals, but some people just can't contribute—and that's OK! Even if you can't opt in for one of our levels, here's a few ways that you can help us reach our goals:
Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!


Share this on Facebook and other social media channels. The more noise, the better chance we have of reaching our goals! The share tools here are easy to use!

Don't forget email and texts! These are great ways to share this with a family members or friends who would be interested in trying wine from the land of Israel or who want to participate in something fun and new!

Prayers and good vibes appreciated. It's no easy feat to start a business and even more difficult to start one working in the Middle East. We're so grateful for all of the prayers and well wishes we've received from family, friends, and colleagues in the early stages of this company and we'd be so honored if you care to offer prayers and support. We believe that agreement has power and we're grateful if you'd add your agreement to what we're building. Todah! (Thanks! in Hebrew).

 
 
*Israeli Good Wine is a brand of 32 Parallel. All rights reserved. All vouchers are redeemable on our website: israeligoodwine.com. Due to state delivery restrictions, we are currently only delivering to AK, AZ, CA, CO, D.C., FL, MO, MN, TN, TX. Anyone purchasing a perk level containing an alcohol voucher in a closed state will receive their wine as soon as the license in that state has been approved for direct shipment. All wine vouchers must be placed by a person 21 years of age or older.

story:
Tea

By Nika Renee

tea is presence, joy and peace

 a tiny bag of sympathy

tea soothes the aching of my soul

tea warms the cold of growing old

the kettle whistle calls my name

it says its time for tea again

tea lets me pause to take a breath

tea heals the pain inside my chest

oh sea of love inside my mug

bright green nettles herbal drug

may your essence live in me

from my sorrows set me free

 

 Soulcentricitea first began in March of 2018 as a collective and self care gift shop on 41st and Troost in Kansas City Missouri, selling loose leaf herbal teas and handmade local goods by women of color. The collective was the foundation of building a concept that promotes self care, inspiring hope, healing and restoration to the community we serve our goods to. However, the name Soulcentricitea was born long before the gift shop. It was my vision to share my love of tea with my community in a way that balances self care with communal care. I have always loved tea and found comfort in how such a simple thing could bring so much peace. One of my favorite quotes by Muriel Barbery “ When tea becomes ritual it takes its place at the heart of our ability to see greatness in small things” sums up my philosophy on the significance of my simple daily cup of tea. Some days all we need to keep us hopeful is some simple greatness to cling to with both hands. In this next phase of Soulcentricitea we are expanding to a tea room concept holding space for customers to experience the centering and healing of a warm cup of tea with both hands, hearts and souls as well as other products with the essential benefits of herbal tea. We invite you to come along for this journey to the center. We are committed to providing hope, healing and restoration to every person who walks through the door or enjoys our offerings wherever they may be.

story:
our roots.

     Little Beet Organics started with a simple conversation about our struggles of finding baby food without having to choose between nutrition, portability, and eco-sustainability. We sought food that would keep pace with our busy lives, going easily from daycare, to park, to backpacking, to plane trips. We wanted a better conversation inclusive of all types of families. A company that did not promote a product through shame or fear, that did not leave a huge carbon footprint and helped give back to families and the earth we love.

We love babies, and the families that love them. We treasure the earth and understand our need to protect it, like we protect our children. We want to build a community of acceptance, acknowledgement, education, health and success, through support, resources and solutions. We are here to help you along each step of the way. We are here to help you nurture your children- not only their minds and bodies but also their smiles and tears, to support them through their pain and fears. We are here to start a commUnity. 

 

      

We are Madeline and Vanessa, two professional, adventuring, wilderness and awareness-seeking moms who have spent our parenting lives devoted to raising aware and healthy babies.  We want our little eco-warriors to come along and see the new terrain we are taking on as breakers of stereotypes and glass ceilings, and we need a homemade food to keep pace while we crush our schedules.

 

 

mission.

At Little Beet Organics, it is our mission to create a sustainable, impactful nutrition company. Our  emphasis is on delicious, nutrient-dense organic foods for babies and toddlers. We practice measured introduction to promote mindfulness of digestive development and food aversion. We strive to create a sustainable company with close attention to packaging, processing and transportation impacts. We support and advocate for organic farmers, children’s causes and the environment through action and donation.

We value love and community, conversation and advocacy, adventure and the natural world. These are the things we want most to share with the amazing little beings we have been gifted to raise. We know you want to show them the world, so they can make their mark and sing their songs. We are here to help you get going and embody that adventure with your spirit, your life and your family!

 

 

how we are different. 

Protecting our babies’ health and promoting their development is our number one concern as parents. We want to give our children the BEST, but traditional baby foods sacrifice nutrition in the preparation and preservation of their food. At Little Beet Organics, we can provide the best introduction to foods with complete nutrition, preserved without heat or food degradation, with full attention to the sourcing of our farms and growers.

 

 

Baby food that uses high heat pasteurization leaches important vitamins and minerals from the food and leaves only 60-70% of the nutritional profile. Purees intended for long shelf lives use heavy preservatives and added sugars, concentrates and fillers. 

Our baby purees and snacks simply remove the water from the food and allow the nutrients to remain intact, sealed in time until you reconstitute with any liquid desired!

 

We have partnered with nutrition and pediatric professionals and conducted extensive research to create simple, nutrient-dense, allergy-free blends. This allows you to easily introduce curated foods to your new eater. With gradual texture increase as your baby grows, Little Beet Organics offers all the nourishment they need to develop a healthy digestive system and taste for good food! Because 75% of nutritional intake goes to supporting brain development in the first two years, we have blended several powerhouse ingredients to offer potent allies in the growth and development process. Oh yeah, and the taste is amazing. Even the pickiest toddler will sneak the snack pack from your bag :)

 

the food.

 

Little Beet Organics offers:

First foods (4+ mo): Perfect for new eaters with single ingredient introduction

Second foods (6+ mo): 2 ingredient blends with homemade textures

Grains (6+ mo): Steel cut oats + dates or bananas

Toddler snacks (12+ mo): Bite size fruits and veggie blends for everyday adventures!

 

 Our food is delicious, versatile and easy to use. Stick a pouch in your pocket for any adventure or pop a few in your diaper bag for a daycare drop-off. With our bulk option, use the provided scoop to add desired amount of food to bowl, add water, breast milk, or formula, stir and enjoy!

If you find an unused pouch after your baby has moved on to more complex foods, sprinkle on top of yogurt or oatmeal or even sneak into mac and cheese or a quesadilla. They make excellent add-ins for camping meals as well!

 

Our Toddler Snacks are the perfect replacement for other quick and easy snacks that are processed and full of sugar or salt. The only sugar in these tasty bites, is the natural sweetness of the fruits and veggies.

 

 

 

our impact.

Little Beet Organics is dedicated to creating organic food for your little one that is not only utilizing the best farms and produce, but the best shipping and packaging practices as well. Little Beet Organics is 100% carbon neutral, packaging in recycled and fully recyclable packaging- food to truck- and is constantly seeking out ways to minimize waste production and energy use. The product has a long shelf life and requires no additional preservation resulting in a large reduction in waste compared to fresh or pasteurized food companies. Nutritious, portable, sustainable, cause-driven. No compromises!

 

 

our mission to give back.

      We are passionate about nutrition for our babies and the world we help to cultivate around them. Our support and partnership with programs and organizations central to our cause and close to our hearts has been part of the creation and foundation our company from day one. Please join us in learning more and supporting these important organizations to create a more inclusive, safer, healthier community and planet.

 

your support.

Check out our perks! Our supportive community that helps us reach our goal will have a variety of choices depending on the age and needs of their little eco-warrior. We have set it up so you can try a little of everything or just focus on a few. Our textiles are artisan sourced fabrics, sewn in small batches. All of the plates, bowls, and sporks are made from Bioplastic-sugarcane, wood fiber, and GMO free corn.

 

 

We need your help creating our community! 

Your Contribution will allow us to provide:

The most nutrient-dense food for your little eco-warrior

Sustainable Packaging 

Support for life-changing causes 

Growth in our community of resources and support 

We are in an incredibly challenging moment in our human history. We appreciate all your support and encouragement in building our community! Even if you are not in a place to give financially, a shout out or sharing our Indiegogo campaign using the Indiegogo share tools is helpful in spreading the word and allowing people to see what separates our company from the rest.  Make some noise! Spread the word! We appreciate support in all forms.

story:
Short Summary

I am a cook living in Grand Rapids, MI. I've also been vegan for over 10 years. Tempeh is always something that I've wanted to produce myself, and when I recently learned how, and made some for my local vegan underground kitchen, The Laurentian Supper Club, the response to the tempeh in particular was overwhelming. Not many restaurants in the Grand Rapids area offer tempeh on their menus, although the vegan and vegetarian population in the area is large, and growing every year. When restaurants and markets do offer tempeh, it's always one of the national brands that sources their beans from non-local sources, and have to ship their product across the country to get to our plates. I want to cut down on carbon emissions, produce a fresher product, and use the company to help support local farmers producing diverse varieties of beans and grains in the Midwest.

What We Need & What You Get

The process for getting a food production company up and running is daunting, and there are a lot of fees associated with getting your production facility checked out by the local health inspectors. The following are the costs that we need to cover to get the company up and running:

  • $185 for lab testing to get the product verified for a shelf life longer than 7 days
  • $200 for two months of incubator kitchen use. That's enough to get up and running, allowing us to fund kitchen use from that point on.
  • $200 for the first six months of liability insurance for the company.
  • $50 to form an LLC that will allow the company to operate
  • $500 to build an incubator for the tempeh and have it checked out by the local health inspector

There are different levels of funding, and below are some of the price points and rewards associated with them. 

  • $10 - A very big thank you for supporting the project when we launch
  • $25 - A pound of soybean tempeh, a digital book of tempeh recipes written by yours truly, and an even bigger thank you
  • $50 - Two pounds of Heirloom Bean tempeh, a digital book of tempeh recipes, and an equally sized thank you
  • $100 - Three pounds of the tempeh of your choosing, as well as the digital recipe book, a big thank you, and a cooking class if you are local
  • $500 - Five pounds of the tempeh of your choosing, as well as a plant-based dinner party for you and up to 10 friends using locally sourced tempeh, veggies, and grains.

The Impact

Part of the benefit of eating a more plant based diet is that it cuts down on the enormous carbon footprint that is associated with the consumption of animal protein and by-products. However, one of the critiques of plant-based diets is that we often have to purchase goods that are heavily fossil fuel and chemical dependent, since proteins like tempeh have to be shipped across the country and are often produced with monoculture crops like soybeans. Our company aims to not only provide an ethically sound protein to the customer, but do it in such a way that we don't have to ship food across the country, and support local farmers and businesses in the process.

Risks and Challenges

I am currently working with the Incubator Kitchen at the Downtown Market in Grand Rapids, MI. The team there is very excited about this project, and we're working together to overcome the hurdles associated with producing this unusual, but delicious, product. I feel confident that we can pass all of the inspection points, and get a product on the market within three months, but there are a few things to be aware of between here and there:

  • Our incubator must pass inspection. I am talking to the local health inspector, and have presented a schematic of the incubator to reduce risk of the machine not passing, but since it is a strange kitchen appliance, there is always the risk that this will not work out.
  • I have to raise the funds to pay for all of the inspections and certifications. They're costly, and if one doesn't pan out, it can prolong the process.
  • We have to get lab testing done to allow the product to have a shelf-life longer than 7 days. This will require a clean, healthy sample of the product, and I can't produce that until the incubator is built. This will prolong the process unless I get the incubator produced soon.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't help fund the project, if you can share this campaign with your vegan, vegetarian, and omnivorous friends who like more plant based options in their diet. Share it with chefs you know who are interested in getting plant based proteins on their menu. Share it with your rich aunts and uncles who want to get invested in a great company from the start. Share it with anyone who likes tempeh (who doesn't? it's absolutely delicious).

Thanks in advance. You're great. Let's eat.
