story:
Bonjour tout le monde!

Nous sommes Pierogi Palais et nous apportons des plats polonais réconfortants au Sud de la France! Plus précisément, nous apportons des pierogi! Je suis sûr que vous vous demandez; qu’est-ce que sont Les pierogi ? se sont des sortes de mini chaussons farcis. Ils existent depuis des siècles et font partie de l’histoire culinaire polonaise depuis aussi longtemps. À l’origine un plat de paysan, ils ont depuis évolué vers l’artisanat, avec des gens très fiers de leurs recettes, méthodes et présentations. Ils peuvent être servis cuits à la vapeur ou au four, poêlés ou frits; ils peuvent être fourrés et être garnis de tout ce que vous désirez. Au Pierogi Palais, nous avons travaillé sans relâche pour perfectionner non seulement les recettes surannées des générations passées, mais nous avons également travaillé comme des fous pour apporter de nouvelles saveurs amusantes à la table.

Au départ, ce projet était un rêve lointain, quelque chose qui revenait occasionnellement autour d’un verre ou dans des conversations. Au fur et à mesure, c’est devenu un passe-temps: expérimenter avec des saveurs pour nous-mêmes et nos proches. Ensuite cela c’est transformé en un plan développement réalisable. Les pierogi ne sont pas disponibles ici, mais les gens sont toujours à la recherche de nouvelles expériences, alors pourquoi ne pas leurs proposer quelque chose qu’ils ne connaissent pas encore? C’est là que nous sommes devenus sérieux. Maintenant, nous nous tournons vers vous: nos fans, nos amis, nos familles. 

Hello everyone!

We are Pierogi Palais and we are bringing Polish comfort food to the south of France! Specifically, pierogi! I’m sure you’re asking yourself, ”what are pierogi?”

Well, I’ll tell you! Pierogi are a Polish dumpling. They’ve been around for centuries and have been a staple of the Polish diet for just as long. Originally thought of as peasant food, they have since evolved into the artisanal with people taking great pride in their recipes, methods, and presentations. They can be served steamed, baked, pan-fried or deep-fried; they can be filled with almost anything and can also be topped with anything you desire really. Here at Pierogi Palais, we have been working tirelessly to not only perfect the time-honored recipes of generations past but have also been working our butts off to bring new and fun flavors to the table. 

Originally this project was a pipe dream, something that would occasionally come up over a drink or in casual conversation. Over time it became a hobby, experimenting with flavors for ourselves and those around us. Then it kind of snowballed into a feasible business plan. It’s not something that people do here, but people are always looking for new experiences and foods, so why not offer them something that they can’t get yet? That’s when we got serious. Now we turn to all of you, our fans, friends, families. 

De quoi avons nous besoin?

Nous avons besoin de fonds. Comme tout le monde le sait, il y a beaucoup de choses qui entrent dans l’ouverture d’un restaurant. Entre la construction, l’ameublement, les fournitures initiales, les permis etc. les frais sont tout simplement énormes. Nous cherchons donc à collecter 25 000€ pour nous lancer. En attendant de s’occuper des démarches administratives dans l’espoir de financements supplémentaires de l’Etat et de la Banque.

En retour, nous offrons quelques récompenses, allant de notre sincere gratitude, aux chèques cadeaux et plus! Nous pouvons même ajouter quelques autres avantages en cours de route.

What do we need?

We need capital. As anyone in the industry knows, There’s a lot that goes into a restaurant opening. Between the construction, the furnishing, the initial supplies, the license fees, the overhead is just crazy. So we’re looking to raise 25,000€ to get us started while we go through all the bureaucracy involved in obtaining additional funding from the state and the bank. 

In return, we offer a few rewards, ranging from our sincere gratitude to gift certificates to acknowledgement in the form of names and faces on things! We may even throw in a few other perks along the way. 

Ce que votre don signifie pour moi.

J’ai toujours rêvé de posséder un restaurant. J’adore créer et j’aime voir les gens déguster mes creations. J’ai cuisiné professionnellement aux États-Unis, au Royaume-Uni, en Pologne et en France. Je sens maintenant que c’est le bon moment pour décoller par moi-meme et partager ce que je peux faire avec plus de gens! Avec votre don, nous pouvons réaliser un rêve ensemble!

What your donation means to me. 

It’s always been a dream of mine to own a restaurant. I love to create, and I love to see people enjoy my creations. I’ve cooked for people in the US, France, the UK, and Poland. Now just feels like the right time to take off on my own and share what I can do with more people. With your donation, we can make a dream come true together!

D’autre façons que vous pouvez aider!

Pour les supporteurs éloignés ou aux moyens limités, nous adorerons les partages de notre campagne. Faire passer le mot au plus grand nombre de personnes possible est extrêmement important pour nous encourager dans nos efforts. Pour ceux qui sont dans les environs et désireux d'aider: une fois que nous aurons trouvé un local, nous aurons besoin de beaucoup d'aide pour le préparer: entre la démolition, la construction, le nettoyage et l’aménagement, il y aura beaucoup de travail à faire. Nous essaierons de faire le maximum nous-mêmes, mais l'aide à cet égard sera toujours la bienvenue.

Other ways you can help!

As much as we love donations, there are other ways that people can help. For those supporters who are far away or limited in means, we love it when people share the campaign. Getting the word out to as many people as possible is hugely important in these endeavors. For those who are in the immediate area and willing to help, once we find a home we will need a lot of help getting it ready: between demolition, building, designing, and cleaning, there will be a lot of work that needs to get done. We will attempt to do as much as humanly possible ourselves, but help in that regard will never be turned away!


Merci à tous pour votre soutien! Cela signifie le monde pour nous et nous nous réjouissons de vous servir très, très bientôt!

So thank you, everyone, for your support! It means the world to us and we look forward to serving you very, very soon!

story:
Tios Hard Tea: we put the tea in cocktails. 

Don't miss our VIDEO at the top of the page. 

Early Bird offer: order your cans now and get them this April! See pledges for UK.

Tea time? Cocktail time? Why not both? 

We've created a sparkling hard tea (alcoholic tea) that combines our favourite cocktails with our love for tea for a not-so guilty pleasure. Created to be low calorie and zero sugar in three different flavours, Tios is the natural alternative to sugary, calorific, pre-mixed drinks and uninspiring hard seltzers. In our humble opinion. 

Tios is a sparkling hard tea made with brewed organic white tea, premium spirits (tequila and white rum) and all natural flavours. It's refreshing and offers a unique depth of flavour, with a subtle hint of herbal tea that we think you'll love. It's our go-to drink for any occasion, and with your help, we hope it can become yours too!

We're so excited to present our Tios hard teas: the White Tea Margarita, the White Tea Mojito and the White Tea Light & Stormy. 

Tios White Tea Margarita

This is our sparkling hard tea twist on the classic Margarita cocktail made with premium tequila, a refreshing taste of lime with a hint of orange to mirror the flavours of triple sec (orange liquor, an essential ingredient in a Margarita).

Tios White Tea Mojito 

This is our sparkling hard tea twist on the classic Mojito made with premium white rum. Minty and limey. Just the right amount.

Tios White Tea Light & Stormy

This is our sparkling hard tea twist on our favourite ginger cocktail, with premium white rum, fiery ginger and a touch of lemon.

We'd love your support!

We'd love your help to make Tios the go-to drink this summer and beyond. To upscale Tios production we need to raise £50,000 (see details below). 

Our Story

Two sisters, Cecilia and Segolenne (French/English), fiancé Mark (Danish) and a love for tea and cocktails.

Segolenne met Mark while working in Copenhagen, Denmark, where they both still live. In January 2020, they took 4 months off work to go on a once-in-a-lifetime trip around the world together where they discovered alcoholic teas. Their trip was cut short due to Covid-19, so it was the perfect opportunity to start their own drinks venture combining two of their favourite things, tea and cocktails. Or cocktails and tea in that order. Cecilia naturally joined the team.

A bit more about the Tios team's background:

Segolenne (29), aka 'the sassy scientist' (29) has a Masters in Pharmaceutical Sciences from Copenhagen University. She has 8 years of experience as an account manager, team leader, project manager and business operations manager. 

Mark (27), aka 'the procurement prince', has a Masters in Supply Chain management from Cranfield University. He has worked in off-trade product placement, logistics planning, supply chain management and as global procurement manager. 

Cecilia (28), aka 'the little marketing mermaid', has a Masters in Branding and Communication Management from Copenhagen Business School. She has experience in customer marketing and brand management for a leading global premium spirits company. 

Who is Tios for?

Too early to get the shaker out? Fed up with the usual glass of G&T? Not inspired by a hard seltzer? Tios is for the mindful pleasure-seeker, people like us who want to find a good balance in what we consume without compromising on taste. Low sugar, low calories and low alcohol content (4.4% vol) but high in flavour. 

Why 'Tios'? 

Tios (like 'Tea-ose') is inspired by our family, our travels, Danish minimalism and a British/French touch. The name inspiration comes from the Spanish 'Tíos' meaning 'uncles' and is in honour of our family tradition of Margarita night, started off by our aunt and uncle.

Help us reach our goal: 

Select our available contributions in the pledges column on the right. All perks containing Tios cans are redeemed in the form of vouchers for the delivery of the goods as described in the perk section. Here is how you can get involved:

  • Order your Early Bird Tios cans (12, 24 or 48 packs - all three flavours) from our first trial production run and get them by end of April 2021 (UK only) 
  • Contribute £15 or £50 to our campaign (or add £5 to your order).
  • Pre-order your Tios cans (6, 12, 24 or 48 packs - choose your flavours) from our first commercial batch (UK and Denmark - see country-specific perks) and get them by July 2021 
  • Get 15% off your purchases through our website until end of 2022 (£30)
  • Become a Tasting Board Member for future product developments (£40)
  • Share our campaign with your network, friends and family. Use the share button at the top right of this page.

We're sorry if we're not able to deliver to your country yet, but we'll try our best to get to you soon. 

A brand you can trust

We want to be fully transparent about all the ingredients we use. And we've got nothing to hide. 

Our ingredients 

White Tea

Our organic white tea is brewed as the base of our drinks. White tea is our favourite because it’s rich in antioxidants and has a subtle herbal taste. It’s fresh, lightly sweet and has no bitterness.

Premium Spirits

Our rum and tequila are high quality spirits. The tequila (38% abv) is distilled from the agave plant in the region of Jalisco, Mexico. The white rum (40% abv) is a light rum, produced at high strength from fermented sugarcane molasses in Mauritius. Both are sourced from a UK-based supplier. 

Sweetener

A natural blend of erythritol and stevia lightly sweeten and enhance the natural flavours of our drinks, with no calories. Stevia is derived from the leaves of the plant species Stevia Rebaudiana, and erythritol is made by fermenting wheat or corn-starch.

Flavours

Our flavours are 100% natural. We use real ginger (IQF ginger), real fruit concentrates and all natural extracts including organic fresh garden mint extract and orange extract. IQF ginger is real ginger frozen to maintain its rich flavour profile and nutrients.

Allergens

Our products do not contain any allergens and the Tios Drinks production site is also free from allergens.

Our sustainability mission 

Our mission at Tios is sustainability with the least amount of waste without compromising on taste.

Fair Trade tea

Our white tea is ethically sourced from an approved fair trade supplier since 1994. It's organically grown in China and supplied through a UK-based compiler.

Biodegradable tea bags

The tea bags used to store the tea are unbleached and biodegradable.

Recyclable cans

All our cans are made of 100% recyclable aluminium. We chose cans as they are much lighter than bottles, meaning a greatly reduced impact on transport with less need for fuel. Aluminium is also one of the easiest materials to recycle. In Denmark, producers like us pay an annual fee for their packaging to be recycled to their return system known as “pant” run by Dansk Retursystem, a non-profit organisation. When a customer purchases a can or bottle, the letter A, B or C indicates the cost of recycling. Cans can then be returned to vending machines in most supermarkets for a refund. 

In 2019 in Denmark, 92% of cans and bottles were recycled. This is where Tios Drinks relies on you to help improve the recycling of our cans in the UK to hopefully one day reach the same target as Denmark. By recycling our cans, we can avoid mining for bauxite, the raw material used for aluminium cans.

Minimal packaging

It's what's inside that counts. Your unboxing experience might be a little simple but we've focused on keeping the outer packaging to a minimum. Our boxes are FSG certified (Forest Stewardship Council). The FSG aims to ensure that packaging material is made with, or contains, forest-based materials from FSC-certified forests or reclaimed sources.

Compostable labels

We consciously chose compostable can labels made of PLA to reduce waste and lower our carbon impact. These shrink labels are made from annually renewable plant-based sources and replace petroleum-based options for a more natural sustainable packaging. When disposed of, these films composte into safe, natural and organic substances. PLA film significantly reduces material used in packaging. It offers the highest shrink at the lowest temperature which translates to less energy used.

Where are we producing Tios?

Tios is produced in England near London. 

Where are we based? 

Tios Drinks HQ is based in Copenhagen, Denmark and operations and production are based in England, UK. 

Where can you find Tios?

Order a selection of Tios cans now with one of our Early Bird packages before our official launch (UK only - see pledges). 

When we officially launch, Tios will be available to purchase online in the UK and Denmark through our website www.tiosdrinks.com (see pledges available in UK and DK). 

Tios will also be available in selected stores, cafes, restaurants and bars in England. 

We'd love to be available in more countries and with your help we'll work hard to make that possible. Due to the complex alcohol-trade related taxing and customs systems specific to each country, and the fact that we are a very small team, we have chosen to focus our efforts on the UK and Denmark where we are based. But France and a few more European countries are hopefully not far behind.

Our progress so far:

Our three Tios recipes have been:

  • Perfected with the help of professional food scientists
  • Approved to be commercially produced
  • Tried and tested by a representative group of our target market

Raw materials have been selected from trusted suppliers. 

Can labels have been approved by national trading standards. 

Cans and packaging have been purchased. 

    We are finally ready to start producing our first batch to test the production run beginning of April, in a certified brewing and bottling facility near London. From there, our products will be packaged and shipped to a contracted distribution centre to send them to you!  

    Be the first to order cans from our first batch with our Early Bird deal (see pledges).

    Why we need your help? 

    The trial batch funds are already secured (Early Bird cans).

    All funds from this campaign will help as described below. If we do not meet our crowdfunding target we will still be able to produce our first commercial batch with additional funding so no matter what happens you should receive your cans. 

     

    What to expect next? 

    Once the crowdfunding campaign is complete, we will be able to send your first ever cans directly to you! Meanwhile, we will prepare for the first full scale commercial batch and official go-live date early summer. From that point, Tios will be available for order through our website in the UK and Denmark. 

    Hopefully you're now convinced that Tios will become your new not-so-guilty pleasure.  

    Follow our journey @tiosdrinks.

    Check out the FAQs section for further information on expected delivery times.                                                            

    Risks and challenges

    We are committed to producing the highest quality drinks. For that, we've selected the best suppliers and partners to deliver the best product and customer experience. There are challenges associated with production but transparency is our focus. As a backer, you will be among the first to be notified of any updates throughout our campaign via email. 

    We are confident that we can deliver on schedule and our planned time frame is realistic and achievable. With Covid-19 uncertainty and new Brexit regulations, we will keep you informed of any possible impact on our supply chain and delivery schedule.

    Thank you!

    Thank you so much for contributing to Tios. We've worked hard to get Tios where it is today and it means a lot to us to take it to the next step with your help. We're really excited to have you onboard and share our progress with you. 

    A big thank you also to all of our sample tasters and everyone who has helped us so far. 

    Cheers! Skål! Santé! from Cecilia, Segolenne and Mark. 

    Follow us @tiosdrinks or visit out webpage www.tiosdrinks.com.

    Share with your network, friends and family!

    If you have any questions, comments, please don’t hesitate to contact Cecilia, Segolenne and Mark: info@tiosdrinks.com

Our flavours are 100% natural. We use real ginger (IQF ginger), real fruit concentrates and all natural extracts including organic fresh garden mint extract and orange extract. IQF ginger is real ginger frozen to maintain its rich flavour profile and nutrients.
Allergens
Our products do not contain any allergens and the Tios Drinks production site is also free from allergens.
Our sustainability mission 

Our mission at Tios is sustainability with the least amount of waste without compromising on taste.
Fair Trade tea
Our white tea is ethically sourced from an approved fair trade supplier since 1994. It's organically grown in China and supplied through a UK-based compiler.
Biodegradable tea bags
The tea bags used to store the tea are unbleached and biodegradable.
Recyclable cans
All our cans are made of 100% recyclable aluminium. We chose cans as they are much lighter than bottles, meaning a greatly reduced impact on transport with less need for fuel. Aluminium is also one of the easiest materials to recycle. In Denmark, producers like us pay an annual fee for their packaging to be recycled to their return system known as “pant” run by Dansk Retursystem, a non-profit organisation. When a customer purchases a can or bottle, the letter A, B or C indicates the cost of recycling. Cans can then be returned to vending machines in most supermarkets for a refund. 
In 2019 in Denmark, 92% of cans and bottles were recycled. This is where Tios Drinks relies on you to help improve the recycling of our cans in the UK to hopefully one day reach the same target as Denmark. By recycling our cans, we can avoid mining for bauxite, the raw material used for aluminium cans.
Minimal packaging
It's what's inside that counts. Your unboxing experience might be a little simple but we've focused on keeping the outer packaging to a minimum. Our boxes are FSG certified (Forest Stewardship Council). The FSG aims to ensure that packaging material is made with, or contains, forest-based materials from FSC-certified forests or reclaimed sources.
Compostable labels
We consciously chose compostable can labels made of PLA to reduce waste and lower our carbon impact. These shrink labels are made from annually renewable plant-based sources and replace petroleum-based options for a more natural sustainable packaging. When disposed of, these films composte into safe, natural and organic substances. PLA film significantly reduces material used in packaging. It offers the highest shrink at the lowest temperature which translates to less energy used.
Where are we producing Tios?
Tios is produced in England near London. 
Where are we based? 
Tios Drinks HQ is based in Copenhagen, Denmark and operations and production are based in England, UK. 
Where can you find Tios?
Order a selection of Tios cans now with one of our Early Bird packages before our official launch (UK only - see pledges). 
When we officially launch, Tios will be available to purchase online in the UK and Denmark through our website www.tiosdrinks.com (see pledges available in UK and DK). 
Tios will also be available in selected stores, cafes, restaurants and bars in England. 
We'd love to be available in more countries and with your help we'll work hard to make that possible. Due to the complex alcohol-trade related taxing and customs systems specific to each country, and the fact that we are a very small team, we have chosen to focus our efforts on the UK and Denmark where we are based. But France and a few more European countries are hopefully not far behind.
Our progress so far:
Our three Tios recipes have been:

Perfected with the help of professional food scientists
Approved to be commercially produced
Tried and tested by a representative group of our target market

Raw materials have been selected from trusted suppliers. 
Can labels have been approved by national trading standards. 
Cans and packaging have been purchased. 

We are finally ready to start producing our first batch to test the production run beginning of April, in a certified brewing and bottling facility near London. From there, our products will be packaged and shipped to a contracted distribution centre to send them to you!  
Be the first to order cans from our first batch with our Early Bird deal (see pledges).
Why we need your help? 
The trial batch funds are already secured (Early Bird cans).
All funds from this campaign will help as described below. If we do not meet our crowdfunding target we will still be able to produce our first commercial batch with additional funding so no matter what happens you should receive your cans. 
 
What to expect next? 
Once the crowdfunding campaign is complete, we will be able to send your first ever cans directly to you! Meanwhile, we will prepare for the first full scale commercial batch and official go-live date early summer. From that point, Tios will be available for order through our website in the UK and Denmark. 
Hopefully you're now convinced that Tios will become your new not-so-guilty pleasure.  
Follow our journey @tiosdrinks.
Check out the FAQs section for further information on expected delivery times.                                                            
Risks and challenges
We are committed to producing the highest quality drinks. For that, we've selected the best suppliers and partners to deliver the best product and customer experience. There are challenges associated with production but transparency is our focus. As a backer, you will be among the first to be notified of any updates throughout our campaign via email. 
We are confident that we can deliver on schedule and our planned time frame is realistic and achievable. With Covid-19 uncertainty and new Brexit regulations, we will keep you informed of any possible impact on our supply chain and delivery schedule.
Thank you!
Thank you so much for contributing to Tios. We've worked hard to get Tios where it is today and it means a lot to us to take it to the next step with your help. We're really excited to have you onboard and share our progress with you. 
A big thank you also to all of our sample tasters and everyone who has helped us so far. 
Cheers! Skål! Santé! from Cecilia, Segolenne and Mark. 
Follow us @tiosdrinks or visit out webpage www.tiosdrinks.com.
Share with your network, friends and family!
If you have any questions, comments, please don’t hesitate to contact Cecilia, Segolenne and Mark: info@tiosdrinks.com

story:
Short Summary

Hello Everyone,

My name is Dave Faris. I am the founder/owner of Dave's Awesome Sauces LLC.  I founded this company after years of my friends telling me I need to start selling my sauces and salsas.  They always ask me for a jar whenever I make a batch and bug me until I do make some, sometimes bugging me because I don't make it often enough.  

I am currently an active duty Military Officer with nearly 15 years of active duty in the Army.  I am an UH-60 Blackhawk Helicopter Instructor Pilot.  I am creating this company now so that when I retire, I can devote my time to expanding nationally, opening a food truck franchise, and eventually my own restaurant.  

The first sauce I have ready from production is my Dave's Gold BBQ Sauce.  It is a South Carolina styled, mustard base, that is sweet and tangy and goes great on nearly anything.  I promise that you are going to love it.

You contributions will help me achieve my dreams.  I am committed to contributing 10% of my profits to feeding hungry children in America.  I want to give back to communities and help others achieve their dreams too.

Dave

What We Need & What You Get

To get my dream started I need $100,000.   Those funds will be utilized as follows:

•    $1,000 - For initial licenses, fees, trademarks, copyrights, website, business cards, and general office needs. 
•    $4,500 - Product Development.  This includes formula conversion for mass production, pH reports to establish shelf life.  It also includes GSI Certified UPC code so the product can be put on any shelf in America.  A QR code for customers to have quick access to our website, Nutritional Values and FDA approvals, and customized label development.  It provides tasting samples to ensure the product is consistent in color, texture, and taste.  Most importantly, it gives us our product cost analysis so we know what the final product will cost us.  This is broken down by cost of raw materials, labels, containers, caps, and production cost. 
•    $5,500 - Estimated cost for first run 145 gallons of finished, packaged product. 
•    $60,000 - Estimated cost Delivery vehicle and signage for advertising.  We have to move our product to make money.  Initially we will be moving the product from the manufacturer to the grocers and events, festivals, or other marketing opportunities.  These will be great methods to get our brand out. 
•    $4000 - Initial marketing budget.  This will ensure that we can get our brand well known for quick growth.  This will include advertisements, booths, hats, shirts and more to get us visible and grow quickly. 
•    $25,000 - will be held in reserve and be used to make any payments necessary until sales become self-sustaining.  The payments will be for things like liability insurance, vehicle maintenance and fuel. Registrations, and fees for booth space.  Other accounting and tax preparation.  And any other unforeseen expense.

 

Your support deserves fantastic perks.  See your perks below:

$20 or greater
 - Free bottle of Dave's Gold BBQ sauce

$40 or greater
 - Free bottle of Dave's Gold BBQ sauce
 - Free Dave's Awesome Sauces T-Shirt

$60 or greater
 - Free bottle of Dave's Gold BBQ sauce
- Free Dave's Awesome Sauces T-Shirt
- Free Dave's Awesome Sauces Apron

Referral Perks
Using the built in referral process through Indiegogo, refer someone who contributes a minimum of $20.  The more referrals you obtain the greater your rewards.

50 Qualified Referrals
Smokeless Indoor Grill ($115 Value)

100 Qualified Referrals
Smokeless Indoor Grill ($115 Value)
Everdue Transport Grill and Cover ($300 Value)

200 Qualified Referrals
Smokeless Indoor Grill ($115 Value)
​Everdue Transport Grill and Cover ($300 Value)
PitBoss Pellet Grill ($600 Value)

400 Qualified Referrals
Smokeless Indoor Grill ($115 Value)
​Everdue Transport Grill and Cover ($300 Value)
PitBoss Pellet Grill ($600 Value)
$1,000 Amazon Gift Card

The Impact

Your contributions will help provide consumers high quality BBQ products at affordable prices.  It will allow for others to taste regionally made sauces from anywhere in the country.  Again, 10% of profits go to feeding hungry kids in America.  So helping launch this product will help your local communities and give children a better chance to succeed.

Risks & Challenges

Essentially, lack of capital it the only thing stopping us.  But once capital has been gathered, time will be the only weakness, at least in the beginning.  It will take time to become well established.  However, one of the strengths of the company is its owner.  Dave has a proven track record of commitment, drive, and persistence.  He is highly intelligent and can overcome any obstacle.  He is proud of his product and will not let it fail.  Also, the product itself is its strength.  Once people taste it, it will speak for itself.

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you may not be able to contribute financially, doesn't mean you can't help at all:

  • Like and follow us on Facebook
  • Connect and follow me on LinkedIn
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and enjoy your Referral Perks

Thank you so much to everyone who is able to contribute in some way.  Thank you to my family and friends, let's face it they are my family too, for pushing me and driving me to do this.  Please feel free to reach out to me personally if you have any questions

Like and follow us on Facebook

Thank you so much to everyone who is able to contribute in some way.  Thank you to my family and friends, let's face it they are my family too, for pushing me and driving me to do this.  Please feel free to reach out to me personally if you have any questions

story:
We Make Pleather Vegan Jerky

Phoenician Micro-Kitchen is a two person operation that makes a unique and extremely tough, dry, plant-based, vegan jerky. Four years ago, we made our first batch for our personal use and shared it with friends and co-workers. Soon, we had offers from people who wanted to purchase our seitan jerky.  

We have been operating out of a small, shared, commercial kitchen for the past three years - and have reached our maximum capacity for the space. Interest in our product (both retail and mail order) has grown to where we are having trouble keeping up with the demand. In response, we have secured our own commercial space so that we can expand our hours of operation and purchase specialized equipment to improve our production capabilities. 

Our plant-based jerky fills a niche for vegans, vegetarians, and anybody else seeking the tough, dry consistency of "cowboy" style jerky (but without the cow, of course). By contributing to this campaign, you will help us improve the plumbing and electric service to our space so that we can run high capacity, precision equipment to increase our output and quality.

This will be huge. In the past, we have turned down distribution deals due to the fact that we did not have the means to deliver large orders of product. Demand for our unique vegan jerky is growing and we need to keep up with it. This is our passion - we have been working day jobs and making vegan jerky on weekends and nights for the past three years.

Here's the Pitch

We have secured a line of credit to get this project going, but upon close examination, we will still need extra funds to insure that the project is complete. In particular, the space needs major electrical and plumbing upgrades. On top of that, we need to purchase specialized equipment. 

Our goal is to raise $20,000. Even if we don't meet this goal, the extra funds will be very helpful in completing this work.

We also have some modest premiums for our donors!

We are offering buttons, beverage koozies, tote bags and a special T-shirt to those that contribute to our cause. You will notice that we have left our plant-based jerky out of the list of premiums. We have done this because our product, Pleather Vegan Jerky, is already available via mail order (and in a growing number of shops). Just type "Pleather Vegan Jerky" into your browser, and you will find us. Selling our quality vegan jerky is not a problem - making enough to meet demand is! 

Our business had been growing steadily from day one - this will ensure that we can accelerate that growth while providing protein rich, plant-based snacks to the public. Our long-term goal is to increase production, increase our buying power, and gradually reduce our price per unit to make our vegan jerky competitive with anything else on the market. We want to make our product affordable to anyone.

Wide-scale cattle production uses a vast amount of our planet's resources and moving toward plant based alternatives make ecological sense. 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are a lot of great causes and projects out there. If you can't contribute to this - we totally understand. But if you'd still like to help out - feel free to spread the word. If you just want to give our product a try, look up Pleather Vegan Jerky and make a small order.

story:
We're launching a waffle fusion food truck, a foundation, a scholarship and a movement. Waffle Craves is a food truck about more than real food made with real ingredients. We're about simply getting food to everyone. 

Here's the Problem

There's enough food in the world for everyone, but somehow it doesn't make it to everybody. How do you get food from point "A" to hungry people without it getting stuck in bureaucratic indifference?  Can we do better than giving to large benevolent companies with corporate salaries where you don't know how much trickles down to the actual person in need? You have to start somewhere, with a scalable approach, taking advantage of today's technology, right?

 

That's Where "We" Come In.

We're Parents. Partners. Cooks. Coders. Givers. Thinkers. 

We've won some awards for our cooking, but we aren't chefs by any stretch of the imagination; which is what  makes this so powerful. Anyone can do it. So by "we", we weren't just talking about ourselves; we were talking about all of us.

 

Here's What We're Going To Do

We're igniting a grassroots sourced food distribution chain.

It sounds daunting, but there's a tiny PA restaurant that's already doing it. Their technology? A post-it note. A customer buys a $1 slice of pizza, then decides to pay it forward with food by buying another $1 slice for anyone who may need it. A note is written on a post-it and it's stuck on the wall. As the wall fills up, anyone in need can grab a post-it, present it, and eat. That simple.

We're taking this concept to the next level by creating an organization - not a large hefty-salaried corporation, - but simply a living and changing web source of information on how to implement Pay it Forward With Food for food trucks, restaurants and their customers. The site is complete with a downloadable seal that food trucks and restaurants can put on their websites and storefronts showing that they are Pay it Forward With Food friendly, encouraging  the revolution to spread. And it will.

Find it here: Pay it Forward with Food (PIFF - pifwf.org). 

 

The Scholarship/Internship

"Intelligence plus character - that is the goal of true education."
-Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.

The Pay it Forward With Food scholarship/internship is a hands-on multi-week journey for one culinary student to learn how to start a business in the food industry from the ground up. The student will operate right alongside us in every facet of day to day operations. Then we'll go outside of the kitchen-classroom and help people cope with the effects of mental illness, PTSD and just plain hard times in the streets. Only in this manner can a student learn the symbiotic relationship between business and community. You ask the community to support you, but you must give back to that same community.

 

About That Truck

Waffle Craves will be Pay It Forward With Food Friendly. Period. Any unused "credits" will be donated once a month downtown, meeting the hungry where they are. On to the food.

 

The Food

 

Flavor Fusion.

Delicious chicken and waffles are just the start. Waffle Craves takes cuisines from around the world- popular ones and some you may not have heard of, and delivers them through waffles. Garlic & basil pizza waffles with creamy pesto drizzle. Slow cooked Mexican carnitas sandwiches. Cuban black bean & mojo. Bold flavors. Authentic savory & sweet craves. Fusion. (Think pumpkin pie waffle with cranberry sauce drizzle and spiced whip :)

Only real food. No empty calories.

A deliberate goal is to be in step with the REAL food revolution started by chef Roy Choi, owner of Kogi- one of the most popular food trucks in the nation, and 3-Michelin Star chef Daniel Patterson. Our mission...If you can't understand the 7-syllable "ingredient" on the ingredients list... Stop. Make it from scratch. With real ingredients. Plain and simple. (We're not too fond of sodas as well, so we'll be making some delicious aguas frescas. Just plain good!)

 

The Menu

We'll start here. But new creations are inevitable.

Savory Craves

Chicken & Waffles,

Garlic & Basil Pizza Waffle with creamy pesto drizzle,

Cuban Black Bean & Mojo Waffle,

Smoked ribs with Cornbread Waffles & fresh honey butter. (Oh my!)

Sweet Craves

Pumpkin Pie Waffle with Cranberry Drizzle and spiced whip,

Cuban Guava & Cream Cheese Waffle (A Favorite),

Cinnamon & Sugar Topped

Lemon Dream (Is it cake, or is it a waffle??)

Sides

Sweet & Smokey Corn,

Southern Greens

Drinks (We're not too fond of sodas.)

delicious aguas frescas & more

The Details

Here's the details:

Our goal is $50k for:

  • Food trailer,
  • Mobile kitchen equipment,
  • Multi-city and county licensing,
  • offsetting costs to build, host and update Pay It Forward With Food (pifwf.org),
  • initial PFF scholarship,
  • marketing Pay It Forward With Food.

 

    The Team

    Waffle Craves and the Pay it Forward with Food (pifwf.org) movement are the brainchildren of Maria and Eric Carey. Though not chefs, together they bring years of cooking, coding, marketing and management acumen to the business.

    They're cooking up some award-winning food.

    In September 2017, Maria and Eric entered the Dell'Osso Farm's Baconfest amateur cooking competition, a 3-round, mystery-basket, Chopped-style cooking contest hosted by Food Network's Jeff Mauro (The Sandwich King).  As they won each round, it became less about being "just for fun" and more about "maybe they have a chance." In the end, Team Maria and Eric won the competition, taking first place and $3,000. Humbled, it was validation that perhaps others will want to enjoy the alma (soul) that they share in every dish.

    It's more than just good food.

    Eric and Maria are fusion. Every bit of Maria's Mexican-American roots and Eric's Southern roots goes into every creation. A Los Angeles native, Maria's roots are in rustic, authentic Mexican cuisine. And although he's a California native, Eric's parents' southern roots inspired him to build a bold, from-scratch approach to sauces & smoked-meats. Umami.

       

      So Many Ways to Be A Part Of the Movement

      There are so many ways to contribute to the revolution.

      • Share and spread the word.
      • Implement PIFWF on your own truck or restaurant.
      • Mention pifwf.org to your friend who owns a food truck or restaurant.
      • Pay it Forward with Food every now and then. (You may have to carry your own post-its:)
      • Grab any one of our perks - we can't wait to meet you!

      And that's all there is to it.

      And Now For The Perks

      You might think a crowdfunding campaign means we're asking for donations...

      Not with these amazing perks!  

       

      That's Maria's favorite quote, and we’re going to honor every single supporter by giving them each their own day of acknowledgement in 2018. 

      Your name and picture will be on the front page of our website in honor and appreciation of the support & love you gave us in building this movement. There's so much to choose from....such as stickers, shirts, tickets to the soft opening, a live music catered event at your house, your caricature on the side of our truck, naming the scholarship in you or you loved one's honor…even up to a semi-private cooking class with us.

      Check out (and hopefully choose) a perk below…

      ###Love.

Here's What We're Going To Do
We're igniting a grassroots sourced food distribution chain.
It sounds daunting, but there's a tiny PA restaurant that's already doing it. Their technology? A post-it note. A customer buys a $1 slice of pizza, then decides to pay it forward with food by buying another $1 slice for anyone who may need it. A note is written on a post-it and it's stuck on the wall. As the wall fills up, anyone in need can grab a post-it, present it, and eat. That simple.
We're taking this concept to the next level by creating an organization - not a large hefty-salaried corporation, - but simply a living and changing web source of information on how to implement Pay it Forward With Food for food trucks, restaurants and their customers. The site is complete with a downloadable seal that food trucks and restaurants can put on their websites and storefronts showing that they are Pay it Forward With Food friendly, encouraging  the revolution to spread. And it will.
Find it here: Pay it Forward with Food (PIFF - pifwf.org). 

 
The Scholarship/Internship
"Intelligence plus character - that is the goal of true education."-Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.
The Pay it Forward With Food scholarship/internship is a hands-on multi-week journey for one culinary student to learn how to start a business in the food industry from the ground up. The student will operate right alongside us in every facet of day to day operations. Then we'll go outside of the kitchen-classroom and help people cope with the effects of mental illness, PTSD and just plain hard times in the streets. Only in this manner can a student learn the symbiotic relationship between business and community. You ask the community to support you, but you must give back to that same community.
 
About That Truck
Waffle Craves will be Pay It Forward With Food Friendly. Period. Any unused "credits" will be donated once a month downtown, meeting the hungry where they are. On to the food.
 
The Food

 
Flavor Fusion.
Delicious chicken and waffles are just the start. Waffle Craves takes cuisines from around the world- popular ones and some you may not have heard of, and delivers them through waffles. Garlic & basil pizza waffles with creamy pesto drizzle. Slow cooked Mexican carnitas sandwiches. Cuban black bean & mojo. Bold flavors. Authentic savory & sweet craves. Fusion. (Think pumpkin pie waffle with cranberry sauce drizzle and spiced whip :)
Only real food. No empty calories.

A deliberate goal is to be in step with the REAL food revolution started by chef Roy Choi, owner of Kogi- one of the most popular food trucks in the nation, and 3-Michelin Star chef Daniel Patterson. Our mission...If you can't understand the 7-syllable "ingredient" on the ingredients list... Stop. Make it from scratch. With real ingredients. Plain and simple. (We're not too fond of sodas as well, so we'll be making some delicious aguas frescas. Just plain good!)
 
The Menu

We'll start here. But new creations are inevitable.
Savory Craves
Chicken & Waffles,
Garlic & Basil Pizza Waffle with creamy pesto drizzle,
Cuban Black Bean & Mojo Waffle,
Smoked ribs with Cornbread Waffles & fresh honey butter. (Oh my!)
Sweet Craves
Pumpkin Pie Waffle with Cranberry Drizzle and spiced whip,
Cuban Guava & Cream Cheese Waffle (A Favorite),
Cinnamon & Sugar Topped
Lemon Dream (Is it cake, or is it a waffle??)
Sides
Sweet & Smokey Corn,
Southern Greens
Drinks (We're not too fond of sodas.)
delicious aguas frescas & more
The Details
Here's the details:
Our goal is $50k for:

Food trailer,
Mobile kitchen equipment,
Multi-city and county licensing,
offsetting costs to build, host and update Pay It Forward With Food (pifwf.org),
initial PFF scholarship,
marketing Pay It Forward With Food.


 

The Team
Waffle Craves and the Pay it Forward with Food (pifwf.org) movement are the brainchildren of Maria and Eric Carey. Though not chefs, together they bring years of cooking, coding, marketing and management acumen to the business.
They're cooking up some award-winning food.

In September 2017, Maria and Eric entered the Dell'Osso Farm's Baconfest amateur cooking competition, a 3-round, mystery-basket, Chopped-style cooking contest hosted by Food Network's Jeff Mauro (The Sandwich King).  As they won each round, it became less about being "just for fun" and more about "maybe they have a chance." In the end, Team Maria and Eric won the competition, taking first place and $3,000. Humbled, it was validation that perhaps others will want to enjoy the alma (soul) that they share in every dish.
It's more than just good food.

Eric and Maria are fusion. Every bit of Maria's Mexican-American roots and Eric's Southern roots goes into every creation. A Los Angeles native, Maria's roots are in rustic, authentic Mexican cuisine. And although he's a California native, Eric's parents' southern roots inspired him to build a bold, from-scratch approach to sauces & smoked-meats. Umami.


 
So Many Ways to Be A Part Of the Movement

There are so many ways to contribute to the revolution.

Share and spread the word.
Implement PIFWF on your own truck or restaurant.
Mention pifwf.org to your friend who owns a food truck or restaurant.
Pay it Forward with Food every now and then. (You may have to carry your own post-its:)
Grab any one of our perks - we can't wait to meet you!

And that's all there is to it.And Now For The PerksYou might think a crowdfunding campaign means we're asking for donations...Not with these amazing perks!   That's Maria's favorite quote, and we’re going to honor every single supporter by giving them each their own day of acknowledgement in 2018. Your name and picture will be on the front page of our website in honor and appreciation of the support & love you gave us in building this movement. There's so much to choose from....such as stickers, shirts, tickets to the soft opening, a live music catered event at your house, your caricature on the side of our truck, naming the scholarship in you or you loved one's honor…even up to a semi-private cooking class with us.Check out (and hopefully choose) a perk below…###Love.

story:
Cafe, Bike Shop, Showroom

We are transforming the 4000 sq. ft. space in downtown Fairfax (formerly Fairfax Cyclery) into Splitrock Tap & Wheel! The SF Bay Areas newest destination bike shop.The new store will comprise of 3 main operations:

  • Showroom and demo center for Whyte Bikes, our exclusive brand from the UK, as well as a carefully selected assortment of parts and accessories from brands we know and trust.
  • Best in class service and repairs for all bikes
  • Cafe featuring pizzas, sandwiches, Beer, Wine and Coffee drinks.

We need your help to finish the kitchen so we can start the taps flowing!

Marin County is a challenging place to start a new business.  While we started with a good plan and a solid budget, we could never have anticipated quite the number of flaming hoops the different agencies here would make us jump through

  • Our building is solid, and reasonably modern, but adding the cafe to the space triggered a list of required upgrades, including upgrades to the sewer system, fire sprinkler system, and HVAC system
  • These additional requirements have delayed our opening by several months
  • All funds raised through this campaign will go directly into finishing the kitchen and the dining space, assuring we get open and serving you ASAP.

Your contribution is worth every penny, and more.

If you look at all of the tiers available in our fundraising campaign, you will see that in each case you will get perks in return that are at least as valuable as your investment, and in many cases much more than your contribution.  Basically our intent is to pre-sell food, drinks, service and store items so we can get across the line, and get the store open.

Your contribution will be instrumental in getting your new favorite place for food and drinks open, and will give you a reason to come down and meet friends.

Of course, not everyone can contribute

...and we understand, but you can still help.  Tell your friends about our project, tell them how cool it will be, share it on social media.

Thanks for checking in on our project!  See you in the shop soon ;)

story:
The Pinehurst Tea Company

We have over 80 years of experience in growing tea in the United States and specialize in South Carolina indigenous tea development.  Mack Fleming, Director of Tea Research for Thomas J. Lipton, assembled and evaluated thousands of tea plant varieties brought from around the world to the Thomas J. Lipton Research & Laboratory Station on Wadmalaw Island, South Carolina.  Assistant horticulturist, Randall Fleming, worked for Thomas J. Lipton Research Laboratory gaining valuable knowledge on cultivating and processing teas throughout the United States while focusing on tea plant varieties already established in South Carolina. Many years were spent studying Summerville’s Pinehurst Tea Plant Variety for its dominate characteristics and taste.

The Fleming Family has been involved in the tea business since 1976 and have been dreaming of producing a new farm consisting of a single clone tea.  Thomas J Lipton, with Mack Fleming as Director, researched 1000's of tea clones from around the world.  After years of collecting data, only one tea plant could finish with the title of "Clone 1."

We are propagating that clone, the Pinehurst Tea Plant, descended from the Pinehurst Tea Plantation and the winner of the 1904 World’s Fair.  This is the best tasting tea researched during the Lipton Research Station years and was classified as Clone 1 for taste, growth rate, and survival rate during transplantation.

 

Pinehurst Tea Company’s Chief Horticulturist is Mack Fleming.  Mack has thirty-five years of professional experience in horticulture, including forty-six years of experience in the tea business, within the United States and abroad.  He holds both Bachelor of Science and Master of Science degrees from Clemson University, and has completed post-graduate work in management, education, botany, and irrigation technology.

Mack Fleming founded and was head of the Horticultural Technology Department at Trident Technical College in Charleston, SC, for eleven years.  He then became Director of Tea Research for Lipton Tea Company.  Mack served in this capacity for ten years and directed all of Lipton’s tea horticulture research domestically and internationally.  Under his direction, an experimental tea plantation was established in Mexico, and large-scale tea research and plantings were conducted on two islands in Hawaii.  His position with Lipton also required working visits to tea plantations in Kenya, Argentina, and Brazil.  He spent six years working with herbs and spices for Lipton and Unilever, Inc. in Mexico, Venezuela, and the United States.

In 1999, the International Science and Technology Group requested that Mack serve as the only U.S. collaborator on a project headquartered in Tbilisi, in the Republic of Georgia (former Soviet Union) to develop a mechanical tea harvester, which uses computer technology to select the proper leaves for harvesting.  In 1997, Arthur D. Little & Company employed Mack to study tea plantations and factories in the Republic of Georgia, as well as to identify the best possible operations for purchase by a commercial client.

           

Project Director, Randall Fleming, was employed by Lipton Tea Company as well as several other tea companies throughout his tea experience years.  While working with Lipton Tea Company, Randall worked with tea projects in Hawaii and Mexico.  In addition, he gained invaluable working knowledge associated with the South Carolina tea clones while working daily at the Pinehurst Tea Plantation site in Summerville, SC for Thomas J Lipton Inc.

Randall was head horticulturist / manager of tea manufacturing and propagation while working for Charleston Tea Plantation Inc.  Randall was also project coordinator in the clonal tea transfer from Charleston, South Carolina to Cairo, Egypt with the Ministry of Agriculture. 

Randall's propagation expertise include: vegetative propagation, physical and biological soil properties with soil management, as well as soil PH adjustments and soil preparations.  Randall has experience in transplant irrigation system design, fertigation and chemigation, as well as diseases and pest management in tea plant production.

 

         

 

 

Mack Fleming working on one of Lipton's first Harvesters.

 

Professional propagation in action.

 

Smithsonian

New York Times

Los Angeles Times

Chicago Tribune

story:
Me

You'll find out a lot more about how I would up doing this further down the page, but essentially I am a middle-aged -- I can no longer use 'young' as a reference to myself -- entrepreneur who is engaged in starting my own wine label and who also just built a system through which protects both producers and consumers of wine.  While my focus is wine, along the way, I wound up with both the opportunity to get into the world of extra virgin olive oil, as well as the impetus for it from one Italian associate [who is now my unofficial "fratello"] who is involved in it from the producer's side.

The Offer

What I am offering is a buy in on some primo extra virgin olive oil (EVOO).  Real Italian extra virgin olive oil.  Real monocultivar (single variety) Italian extra virgin olive oil.  What this means is that each EVOO is made from one type of olive, which was grown in Italy, harvested and cold-pressed on the same day, with zero defects and an acidity level of less than 0.8%.  There are some other specifications as well.

This is not to be confused with things such as virgin olive oil, light olive oil, olive oil or refined olive oil; these designations in the US are not allowed in Europe at all.  This also not to be confused with products that say that they are Italian extra virgin olive oil, but might not truly be 100% extra virgin olive oil to being with, and at best are a blend of olive oils from Tunisia, Spain, Portugal, Greece and Morocco that have been shipped to Italy and then bottled there with an Italian label.

What We Need & What You Get

Essentially, I am looking at a combination purchase from two different producers.  .5L bottles from one producer in Calabria and .25L bottles from another producer in Puglia.  The former has just one EVOO and the latter has six different ones.  The minimum will be one palate from one and one pallet from the other.  If enough interest is given, we can easily go up to a total of ten pallets in total.

The minimum needed to handle everything is $9000 (purchase of two pallets of EVOO, transport by ocean and then by truck, temporary warehouse storage, and then handling all individual packaging and shipping) and there will be three different levels: 

  • The first will give you one .5L(Calabria) and two different .25L bottles(Puglia)
  • The second will give you two .5L(Calabria) and four different .25L bottles(Puglia)
  • The third will give you three .5L(Calabria) and six different .25L bottles(Puglia)

There is also a first level upgrade that will give you an extra .25L bottle from Puglia.  If you look at the breakdown of the different levels, and price them against quality monocultivar EVOO from other reputable Italian producers, you'll realize that you are getting a great deal.  It can easily cost you anywhere from $20 to $50 for a bottle of EVOO, and the .5L from another retailer would easily run you around $16.

When the olive oil is received, it will be shipped out via USPS in proper packaging.

If there is enough interest, we can do more than two pallets!

The Journey:  How I wound up doing this

Like so many other golden opportunities in life, it was a combination of being at the right place, at the right time, dressed the right way, and with something to bring to the conversation.

In 2014, I was attending VinItaly in Verona and after coming from the trade show, I was sitting outside the Palazzo Barbieri talking on the phone to an associate back in the states.  As there are events after the close of the trade show the first two days which are open to participants, I thought that there might be another event this [third] day. 

Needless to say, there was and there wasn’t.

As it turns out, there was an event that day, but it was a closed event.  It was actually an awards banquet for EVOO producers.  Now, I was dressed in a custom grey tuxedo jacket, dress shirt with French cuffs [and cufflinks], black denim jeans and cap toe shoes, which can be formal in Italy.  I made my way into the entrance, where there were other people dressed up, and went to the elevators because my legs were too damned tired to walk up those lovely stairs inside.  Got out on the wrong floor, then got out on the right one, checked my bag and proceeded to have drinks and appetizers. 

I wound up talking to a few people, including the representative for VinItaly in India.  Then, as I was wondering what was going on, the doors to the main room opened up and I realized that it was going to be a reception.  I chose to sit at a table not in the front or in the middle, but one off from the back and one off from the left edge of the room. 

Soon, a number of people came in and one – Massimiliano -- asked if I was there by myself, and asked if they could join me.  As I answered and they started to sit, one of them – Furio -- asked if I could move over so that they could also sit together, but Massimiliano said I was fine where I was at.  Over the course of the evening, I realized that I was at a private event and even Furio commented that I probably had no idea what it was and shouldn’t be there, but Massi told him to let it go.  Funnier still was that the person whom I was renting an apartment through AirBnB was working with the catering staff and sidled up and asked me if I was having a good time; he was surprised to see me there and I was also surprised to see him there.

Little did I know that I was sitting with the people of Agraria Riva del Garda, who makes some of the best EVOO in Italy.  As men, we all bonded over great stories of love and wine, and when I also said that I loved Grappa, that piqued Furio’s interest.  When he asked me what Grappas I drink, and I responded, he then told me to come to their stand tomorrow and that he would have both Grappa and wine for me.

This was the first leg of this journey.

The second leg came from my return to Italy in 2015 (VinItaly again) and them hosting me up for a day and a night in their part of Italy.  Massi picked me up from the airport, booked me into a hotel in Rovereto and then took me over to their base of operations in Riva del Garda.  There, I and most of the gentleman that I met before had a lunch where we drank their wine and had food prepared by their chef.  I fell in love with the broccolini.  After lunch, Furio showed me the whole wine producing operation, had me taste more of their wines and asked what I thought of them.  I then sat in on an EVO tasting with a couple women from Germany that Massimo (the boss) ran. 

While at their headquarters, I purchased a couple bottles of EVOO and also marveled at the vinegars there.  I had never seen vinegar that was aged as well as so expensive and Massi explained that you only have to use like a drop of that in a recipe.  I also had my first espresso with the guys and they took pics of me trying it.

Later on that night, Massi took me to dinner at a lovely restaurant and the next morning dropped me off at my AirBnb in Verona.  I also attended that year’s awards banquet and they introduced me to one of the best EVOO producers in Sicily.

The third leg took place throughout 2016 and started with Massimiliano and his boss Massimo coming to NYC for the Flos Olei event held at the Yale Club.  I asked for them to spend a day and night in Philly and they did so.  During this time, I took them to a number of good restaurants in Philly, as well as the Reading Terminal and the Italian market so that they could better understand the EVOO market here.  We had lunch at one place, drinks at another and for dinner they came to my house.  The night had us having drinks at Tredici and then enjoying jazz at South.

As their event was on Monday in Manhattan, and I had a two day Italian wine event in Manhattan as well, they had an invite for me to attend.  After leaving my event that Monday, I went to theirs and at one point rustled up a bunch of attendees to clog their table and taste all of their offerings.  My method of doing this definitely made an impact on the two of them.

Back in Italy for VinItaly I would once again reconnect with everyone from their company and witness a little more how serious the business of EVOO is.  However, before this, I would also taste some EVOO from Portugal while attending SISAB in Lisbon the month before.  This time around, instead of attending the awards banquet, I would have dinner with Massi and his lovely family.  I could tell how serious he was about his EVOO by the way that he applied it to each dish.

Later on this year, I would finally read the book “Extra Virginity,” which my ‘brother’ Massimiliano had been trying to get me to read since the beginning of the year.  Well, this really opened my eyes, and I started looking at the potential for me to start selling EVOO, something Massi wanted me to do all along. 

And this is where I am at now.

took me over to their base of operations in Riva del Garda.  There, I and most of the gentleman that I met before had a lunch where we drank their wine and had food prepared by their chef.  I fell in love with the broccolini.  After lunch, Furio showed me the whole wine producing operation, had me taste more of their wines and asked what I thought of them.  I then sat in on an EVO tasting with a couple women from Germany that Massimo (the boss) ran. While at their headquarters, I purchased a couple bottles of EVOO and also marveled at the vinegars there.  I had never seen vinegar that was aged as well as so expensive and Massi explained that you only have to use like a drop of that in a recipe.  I also had my first espresso with the guys and they took pics of me trying it.Later on that night, Massi took me to dinner at a lovely restaurant and the next morning dropped me off at my AirBnb in Verona.  I also attended that year’s awards banquet and they introduced me to one of the best EVOO producers in Sicily.The third leg took place throughout 2016 and started with Massimiliano and his boss Massimo coming to NYC for the Flos Olei event held at the Yale Club.  I asked for them to spend a day and night in Philly and they did so.  During this time, I took them to a number of good restaurants in Philly, as well as the Reading Terminal and the Italian market so that they could better understand the EVOO market here.  We had lunch at one place, drinks at another and for dinner they came to my house.  The night had us having drinks at Tredici and then enjoying jazz at South.As their event was on Monday in Manhattan, and I had a two day Italian wine event in Manhattan as well, they had an invite for me to attend.  After leaving my event that Monday, I went to theirs and at one point rustled up a bunch of attendees to clog their table and taste all of their offerings.  My method of doing this definitely made an impact on the two of them.Back in Italy for VinItaly I would once again reconnect with everyone from their company and witness a little more how serious the business of EVOO is.  However, before this, I would also taste some EVOO from Portugal while attending SISAB in Lisbon the month before.  This time around, instead of attending the awards banquet, I would have dinner with Massi and his lovely family.  I could tell how serious he was about his EVOO by the way that he applied it to each dish.Later on this year, I would finally read the book “Extra Virginity,” which my ‘brother’ Massimiliano had been trying to get me to read since the beginning of the year.  Well, this really opened my eyes, and I started looking at the potential for me to start selling EVOO, something Massi wanted me to do all along. And this is where I am at now.

story:
Help Bring Back The Taste of The Original Pizza Snack Food.

Back in 1964 in Winnipeg Manitoba Canada, an entrepreneur named Paul Faraci began experimenting and testing a food product that would eventually become a standard in which everyone would try and copy.

The product he invented and perfected is called the "Pizza Pop"

In case you do not know what a "Pizza Pop" is, it originally was a flakey crust with pizza toppings and folded like a turnover, then deep fried. You would buy them already deep fried then frozen. They are available in your grocery's frozen food section and all you have to do is "pop" them in the oven or microwave, and enjoy... 
"I can taste them now"

In order to expand his business Mr. Faraci took in two partners. Business was good and Mr. Faraci wanted to expand his product line, a move his partners were not yet ready for, so he unwillingly sold out. They then sold the business to a large corporation. The product that is now being produced has been altered and does not have the same taste that was unique to the original "Pizza Pop"

Mr. Faraci  and his family has been contacted by former customers asking him to "bring back the taste" of the original "Pizza Pop".

Mr. Faraci and his family are now asking for your help in doing so. Please check out his story. 

Stage one of this funding would be used to purchase the required food production equipment needed to produce "The Original Pizza Snack Food".

"Bring Back The taste" of The Original Pizza Snack Food.

Thank you
Paul Faraci
Phil Faraci

 

*please note that "Pizza Pops" is the registered trademark name of Pillsbury Foods and is not associated with this campaign.

story:
In addition to the funds we raised on Indiegogo, our campaign attracted a few incredibly generous off-line donations, as well a major order from Whole Foods NYC...

...So, we REACHED OUR GOAL & we're starting to brew!

Find us in all NYC Whole Foods in July and throughout the city starting in August 2017!! 

What makes Toast Ale a Rev-ALE-utionary beer?

  • Over 1/3 of fresh bread in the U.S. goes straight from oven to landfill 
  • Exorbitant land, labor, fuel and love are thus wasted to create hundreds of thousands of pounds of bread that nobody eats 
  • Food waste poses one of the biggest social and environmental threats to our planet

It's Time To Brew Away With This Problem...

How Can Beer Help End Food Waste?

  • ​Toast Ale saves fresh, surplus loaves directly from bakeries and combines it with malted grains, yeast and the highest quality hops 
  • The result is delicious craft beer - our U.S. flagship will be an American Pale Ale
  • 100% of profits from Toast will go to Feedback, an environmental organization that campaigns to end food waste at every level of the food system

Why Isn't Beer Offered As A Perk? 

Oh, how we tried! Thanks to that dark little chapter in our country's history called Prohibition, the alcohol industry is insanely complicated and regulated, and that includes online sales. 

But That Won't Stop The Rev-ALE-ution!

What Is the Food Basket? ​

The Food Basket is included with all perks starting at $50. 

We are thrilled to share a delicious Food Basket that showcases 7 of the most innovative companies around the country who are working tirelessly to ensure beautiful food ends up in our kitchens rather than our landfills: 

  • Pulp Pantry Granola - meet your juice's other half with this crunchy, delicious grain-free granola made from organic juice and pulp 
  • ReGrained: EAT Beer - Delicious and nutritious Supergrain Bars made from upcycled brewery grains. Talk about synergy!
  • LA Kitchen Apple Chips - LA Kitchen, the newest undertaking of the incredible Robert Egger, creates jobs, provides nourishment to communities and saves food. Campaign backers will be among the first to try LA Kitchen's new Apple Chips from rescued apples! 
    • We are honored to that our biggest, most experienced food justice heroes like Robert have called Toast Ale the long-awaited solution to bread surplus 
  • ​Cinnamon Hazelnut Inbru - Inbru infuses rice hulls that are normally discarded with natural flavors to add directly to your ground coffee - and its 100% compostable + biodegradable!
  • barnana chewy banana bites - on a mission to end food waste on organic banana farms by upcycling the bananas that used to go to waste.
  • Sir Kensington's Ketchup - Along with vine-ripened tomatoes, some unripened green tomatoes that would otherwise be discarded are used. These green tomatoes are a natural substitute to the added lactic acid you find in most ketchups! A "divine alternative" indeed. 
  • Baked in Brooklyn Pita Crisps - Baked in Brooklyn has been generously sharing the surplus loaves from their wholesale bakery operation for Toast Ale USA recipe testing! 

The first 10 backers who choose our Silver Founding Hero Perk will get an 8th rare food product from our biggest food saving hero of all: 

  • Baldor SparCs - Dried Vegetable Blend from vegetable peelings. Thomas McQuillan, the man behind SparCs (scraps spelled backwards) has single-handedly eliminated food waste from one of the Northeast's largest produce distributors.

Toast Ale is a Great Concept. Is it Great Beer? 

Ask the pros! 

  • Chef Dan Barber: “Toast Ale is a delicious revelation.”
  • Chef Jamie Oliver: "Bloomin' delicious." 

Our Philosophy...

...is that to change the world, we've got to throw a better party than those destroying it. Help us throw that party! 

What's The Timeline For Toast Ale USA? 

  • Our ambitious goal is to have production underway by July 4th, 2017 - the perfect time to Toast our flagship American Pale Ale
  • NYC bakeries are already knocking down our door to bring surplus loaves directly from their ovens to the brewery​

What Is The Impact Of Your Dollar? 

  • This campaign will guarantee our ability to produce 100 bbl of beer in NYC - with that, we've got a social business on our hands!  
  • Each perk shows exactly how much bread your contribution will save!! 
  • Every dollar you contribute, and soon enough every Toast you drink, helps realize our goal of diverting 100 tons of bread from landfill in 3 years
    • In terms of CO2 emissions alone, that's the equivalent of taking 40 cars off the road

What Is The O.G. Origin Story Of Toast Ale? 

  • International environmental activist and author Tristram Stuart had a lightbulb moment when he tried Babylone Beer, a beer made with bread, at Brussels Beer Project
  • Being a food waste warrior, Tristram knew that bread is overproduced in such massive quantities that soup kitchens and feeding programs routinely turn it away
  • Ironically, Toast is actually an ancient solution to the modern problem of surplus: around 4000 BC in Egypt and Mesopotamia, people started fermenting bread to turn valuable, yet perishable grains into a "divine drink" ​

Other Ways To Get Involved: 

  • Brew your own!! Toast Ale has proudly open-sourced our recipe to create a community of home-brewing, bread-saving heroes. Have a go and let us know how it turns out! 

Cheers To Brewing Up a Better Planet!

Brew your own!! Toast Ale has proudly open-sourced our recipe to create a community of home-brewing, bread-saving heroes. Have a go and let us know how it turns out!

story:
Short Summary

Hey, your favorite schnitzel has found a new location back in Kalamazoo, 

  • Chef Frankie is back in town, and can't wait to start serving food again.
  • Chau Haus is getting swanky new digs, if you help us out, you can get free cheesecake! 
  • The customers have been asking for us to come back, so we found a great new location. 
  • We had a tough year last year with the downtown construction. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • We are asking for $3000 to help us get operating the restaurant at full capacity. 
  • You are getting a great value, you are getting Schnitzel Bucks, along with perks that get more exciting with the higher level purchases. 
  • With the lower level you get free cheesecake. The larger purchase you get, the more stuff you get!

The Impact

The impact will be enormously helpful, we will be able to start out at our new home with everything we need. 

  • This new endeavor is our ultimate dream come true. A large beautiful dining room. and patio. Plus we have ample parking right next to the building! And its easily wheelchair accessible.  
  • Our famous Pierogi will once again be available in Kalamazoo.
  • We have missed you, just as much as you've missed us. 

Risks & Challenges

This move is a giant step up for the Chau Haus Team. Frankie will be working hard, training people on how to make the most delicious food, because we start everything from scratch, and the biggest ingredients are  hard work, and love of what we are doing. 

  • We are stepping into some pretty big shoes to fill. The last tenant Feed the World, has left the space with a great sense of community.  We will strive every day to make a positive difference in our community, and to assure you have the best experience possible. 
  • We are recruiting some new people, plus bringing back some familiar faces. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, you can still help us out. If you share this campaign with your friends and famliy. 

  • You can share the campaign on your social media, by just clicking the share button. 
  • Some of your friends might have never heard of us, so sharing can increase our reach to potential new Chau Haus fans. 

And that's all there is to it.

story:
About Jason
Roughly ten years ago I got the bright idea to make my own beer. After some confused looks, I was gifted a homebrewer starter kit and started making some beer. Bad beer. Instead of being grumpy about the bad beer, I instead thought, “Why is it bad? How can I make it better”? This has led me on an intensive journey leading up to this point. Escape Velocity Brewing Company is the culmination of a decade of learning everything I could about brewing, with some big help along the way.

I jumped to all grain brewing quickly, to have more control over my brew. I’ve read every brewing book I could get my hands on, listened to hundreds of hours of brewing podcasts and, of course, brewed my ass off. I was lucky enough to have support from friends and family when I needed equipment upgrades or honest feedback. I was also lucky to get a jump into the professional brewing world. I learned about commercial bottling and event planning in the three years I worked at Fountain Square Brewing in Indianapolis. Daredevil brewing company gave me the opportunity to expand my commercial brewing knowledge by letting me apprentice brew. I learned large scale brewing, proper cleaning and sanitation of commercial equipment, canning beer, kegging beer, cleaning kegs (lots of kegs), and the level of work it takes to make beer on the professional level. Most importantly, I learned how to make consistent, quality beer.

I started to enter competitions and fairly quickly saw results. In 2015, I placed 2nd in the Upland Brewery UpCup competition. In 2016, my stout placed 2nd in the first round of the national homebrew competition, and later in 2016, my stout took gold in the Indiana State Fair Brewer’s cup, then went on to beat 349 other brewers who entered 849 other beers to take home Best in Show in the Brewer’s cup.

I’m ready to start making beer for you and turn this love of the beer industry I have into my career.

What will the money be used for?
We are in negotiations on a building in Lafayette, IN that has been vacant for over a decade and has become an eyesore for the community. Acquiring this building would allow us to have a fantastic location for the brewery with ample parking and outdoor seating, but will also let us revive this building and have it start giving back to the community. The building needs extensive repairs and the money contributed would greatly help in us being able to afford the revival of the property. You can help us become a vital part of the Lafayette community we love so much!

Sounds good, but tell me more about the brewery
Glad you asked. The brewery will utilize a 7bbl Blichmann Engineering Pro Series brew house, creating 5 year-round beers and seasonals. We will start with a limited kitchen serving all vegetarian sandwiches, soups, pizzas, and salads with many vegan options. My personal love of space travel and astrophysics led to the astronautical branding.

The Food
Why Vegetarian? My wife and I have been vegetarian for decades, and feel that abstaining from meat is the healthiest thing we can do for ourselves and for our planet. After losing several family members to heart disease, the importance of this has become even more clear. We want to feed our community food that is delicious, but is also good for them and our environment!

Spread the word

Every little bit helps, so even if you’re not in a position to contribute financially, telling others about us is helpful and greatly appreciated.

Stay Connected
Stay connected with us, follow our progress, and learn more about us at:

Http://escapevelocitybrewing.com

http://twitter.com/Escapebrewery

https://www.facebook.com/EscapeVelocityBrewery

Or email us at info@escapevelocitybrewing.com
