story:
What's Going On?

We are looking to expand our operations at Dragon Distillery! Who are we? What do we do? 

We are Frederick City's first and largest distillery - and are disabled veteran owned and operated! We are currently in our 4th year of operations - with an extensive product portfolio that includes Bourbon, Rye, and Blended Whiskies, Vodkas and Flavored Vodkas, Gins, Rums, Brandy, Moonshines, and Maryland first and original Canned Cocktails.

We have deep roots in the Frederick area, with the family settling here in the 1730s (so we've been here longer than Frederick).

With the recent change in Maryland law, we now have the opportunity to allow consumers to experience our amazing small batch spirits in a form to which they are accustomed  - that of a cocktail! 

We've always been a bit quirky - and to compliment our Tasting Room theme - we are preparing to open a medieval themed cocktail experience! We will not only have cocktails, but lite fare AND games!! We want to create a medieval themed refuge from the stress of daily life - a place to come, have a drink, grab a lite bite, and relax or play games with friends!

 

What do we need?

In order to bring our vision to life - we need your help. We are looking to raise at least $7,750. Specifically, funding will go towards:

  • Purchase of kitchen equipment to make great lite fare.
  • Expansion expenses (including more floor drains, electrical upgrades, plumbing)
  • Purchase of bar equipment (soda lines, ice machine)
  • Dragon's Den thematic items (Shields, swords, benches)

If we can meet our goal - any additional funds will be used to not only enhance the above, but to also help:

  • Grow our game library
  • Expand Kitchen Equipment (so we can make more yummy foods)
  • Upgrade the lounge area

 

Will my contribution really help?

ABSOLUTELY! Every little bit helps. What we are doing with Dragon's Den is expensive - kitchen equipment and build-out are substantial costs, but we also want to make the atomsphere something really special - and that means awesome decorations - we want heavy wooden tables, shields and weapons on the walls, all sort of medieval accessories - and all of these things add up. 

If just our Facebook followers each gave $5, we would more than meet our goal - so every penny not only counts - but is greatly appreciated. 

The Dragon's Den is going to be a very unique place - and by helping us get there, you are part of something very special.

 

Risks, Challenges, and Rewards!

First the good news! We've already acquired a number of pieces of kitchen and bar equipment for Dragon's Den - including bar and kitchen stainless steel sinks, commercial refrigeration, heating and warming units, and a number of medieval-themed decorations. But we still have a long way to go.

Before we can open - we do need to secure a number of permits. We will have build-out permitting, local liquor permitting, health-department review and approval just to name a few. We've been through this process before, so we know what to expect - but - we must get these before we can open. So - the largest risk is simply a delay in acquiring all the necessary regulatory approvals. The positive here is that the largest issue (the change in Maryland Law) has already been approved by the Maryland legislature.

To thank everyone who is supporting us in this - we are offering a lot of different perks! Everyone who donates - regardless at what level - will get an invitation to one of our soft opening parties. These are going to be INVITATION only events - and only for those who have supported our fund raising efforts. Plus- in addition to that - we have some really awesome perks depending on what level of donation you are comfortable with.

Perks:

The Wanderer: At our basic level, the you're going to get a voucher good for a cocktail of your choice at Dragon's Den, a Button, a Sticker, and an invitation to our Soft Opening Party. 

The Sentry: Here you're going to get two vouchers good for a cocktail of your choice at Dragon's Den, a Button, a Sticker, and two invitations to our Soft Opening Party. 

The Fighter: With this perk  you're going to 5 vouchers good for a cocktail of your choice at Dragon's Den, a Button, a Sticker, and two invitations to our Soft Opening Party. 

The Rogue: You're going to get 5 vouchers good for a cocktail of your choice at Dragon's Den, a Button, a Sticker, PLUS an exclusive Dragon's Den Founders T-Shirt and two invitations to our Soft Opening Party. 

The Bard: You're choice here - you are going to get 12 vouchers that can be redeemed either for  a cocktail of your choice or an appetizer of your choice at Dragon's Den - so you get a cocktail or appetizer each month for a year! Plus, you're going to get a Button, a Sticker, the exclusive Dragon's Den Founders T-Shirt and an invitation to our Soft Opening Party. 

The Wizard: You are going to get 12 Cocktail vouchers AND 12 Appetizer Vouchers at Dragon's Den - so you get a cocktail AND appetizer each month for a year! Plus, you're going to get a  the exclusive Dragon's Den Founders T-Shirt and two invitations to our Soft Opening Party. 

The Adventurer: A full year membership to the ADVENTURER's CLUB - this is our Dragon's Den membership club. As a Club Member you get: 

  • You are going to get 12 Cocktail vouchers AND 12 Appetizer Vouchers at Dragon's Den - so you get a cocktail AND appetizer each month for a year!
  • 20% OFF Cocktail Purchases at Dragon's Den
  • 10% OFF Food Purchases at Dragon's Den
  • 10% OFF Purchases of Bottles or Merchandise at Dragon Distillery's Tasting Room

In addition you're going to get a  the exclusive Dragon's Den Founders T-Shirt and two invitations to our Soft Opening Party. 

The Dragon Slayer: Two memberships to the ADVENTURER's CLUB - this is our Dragon's Den membership club (or a single 2-year membership). As a Club Member you get: 

  • You are going to get 12 Cocktail vouchers AND 12 Appetizer Vouchers at Dragon's Den - so you get a cocktail AND appetizer each month for a year!
  • 20% OFF Cocktail Purchases at Dragon's Den
  • 10% OFF Food Purchases at Dragon's Den
  • 10% OFF Purchases of Bottles or Merchandise at Dragon Distillery's Tasting Room

You're going to get a  the exclusive Dragon's Den Founders T-Shirt and Four invitations to our Soft Opening Party.

PLUS - We will name a menu item (food or cocktail) after you or with a name choosen by you (within reason). 

The Archmage: Membership to the ADVENTURER's CLUB for a year. As a Club Member you get: 

  • You are going to get 12 Cocktail vouchers AND 12 Appetizer Vouchers at Dragon's Den - so you get a cocktail AND appetizer each month for a year!
  • 20% OFF Cocktail Purchases at Dragon's Den
  • 10% OFF Food Purchases at Dragon's Den
  • 10% OFF Purchases of Bottles or Merchandise at Dragon Distillery's Tasting Room

You're going to get a  the exclusive Dragon's Den Founders T-Shirt and Four invitations to our Soft Opening Party.

PLUS - We will name a menu item (food or cocktail) after you or with a name choose by you (within reason). 

PLUS - You can host a private event for up to 25 people at Dragon's Den. This includes use of the space for up to 3 hours and $150 Voucher for food/drinks.

PLUS - We will engrave a plaque with your name to be placed on a table or chair in Dragon's Den.

The Gamemaster: You're going to get everything from the Archmage Level PLUS you have the opportunity to become a Distiller for a Day. You will join our distillery team for a full day of hands-on operations at Dragon Distillery. It's a once in a lifetime experience! 

 

What else can I do?

Get the word out! Share our project on your social media! Tell your friends and family! Stop by the distillery!
story_txt:
What's Going On?
We are looking to expand our operations at Dragon Distillery! Who are we? What do we do? 
We are Frederick City's first and largest distillery - and are disabled veteran owned and operated! We are currently in our 4th year of operations - with an extensive product portfolio that includes Bourbon, Rye, and Blended Whiskies, Vodkas and Flavored Vodkas, Gins, Rums, Brandy, Moonshines, and Maryland first and original Canned Cocktails.
We have deep roots in the Frederick area, with the family settling here in the 1730s (so we've been here longer than Frederick).
With the recent change in Maryland law, we now have the opportunity to allow consumers to experience our amazing small batch spirits in a form to which they are accustomed  - that of a cocktail! 
We've always been a bit quirky - and to compliment our Tasting Room theme - we are preparing to open a medieval themed cocktail experience! We will not only have cocktails, but lite fare AND games!! We want to create a medieval themed refuge from the stress of daily life - a place to come, have a drink, grab a lite bite, and relax or play games with friends!
 

What do we need?
In order to bring our vision to life - we need your help. We are looking to raise at least $7,750. Specifically, funding will go towards:

Purchase of kitchen equipment to make great lite fare.
Expansion expenses (including more floor drains, electrical upgrades, plumbing)
Purchase of bar equipment (soda lines, ice machine)
Dragon's Den thematic items (Shields, swords, benches)

If we can meet our goal - any additional funds will be used to not only enhance the above, but to also help:

Grow our game library
Expand Kitchen Equipment (so we can make more yummy foods)
Upgrade the lounge area



 
Will my contribution really help?
ABSOLUTELY! Every little bit helps. What we are doing with Dragon's Den is expensive - kitchen equipment and build-out are substantial costs, but we also want to make the atomsphere something really special - and that means awesome decorations - we want heavy wooden tables, shields and weapons on the walls, all sort of medieval accessories - and all of these things add up. 
If just our Facebook followers each gave $5, we would more than meet our goal - so every penny not only counts - but is greatly appreciated. 
The Dragon's Den is going to be a very unique place - and by helping us get there, you are part of something very special.
 

Risks, Challenges, and Rewards!
First the good news! We've already acquired a number of pieces of kitchen and bar equipment for Dragon's Den - including bar and kitchen stainless steel sinks, commercial refrigeration, heating and warming units, and a number of medieval-themed decorations. But we still have a long way to go.
Before we can open - we do need to secure a number of permits. We will have build-out permitting, local liquor permitting, health-department review and approval just to name a few. We've been through this process before, so we know what to expect - but - we must get these before we can open. So - the largest risk is simply a delay in acquiring all the necessary regulatory approvals. The positive here is that the largest issue (the change in Maryland Law) has already been approved by the Maryland legislature.
To thank everyone who is supporting us in this - we are offering a lot of different perks! Everyone who donates - regardless at what level - will get an invitation to one of our soft opening parties. These are going to be INVITATION only events - and only for those who have supported our fund raising efforts. Plus- in addition to that - we have some really awesome perks depending on what level of donation you are comfortable with.
Perks:
The Wanderer: At our basic level, the you're going to get a voucher good for a cocktail of your choice at Dragon's Den, a Button, a Sticker, and an invitation to our Soft Opening Party. 
The Sentry: Here you're going to get two vouchers good for a cocktail of your choice at Dragon's Den, a Button, a Sticker, and two invitations to our Soft Opening Party. 
The Fighter: With this perk  you're going to 5 vouchers good for a cocktail of your choice at Dragon's Den, a Button, a Sticker, and two invitations to our Soft Opening Party. 
The Rogue: You're going to get 5 vouchers good for a cocktail of your choice at Dragon's Den, a Button, a Sticker, PLUS an exclusive Dragon's Den Founders T-Shirt and two invitations to our Soft Opening Party. 
The Bard: You're choice here - you are going to get 12 vouchers that can be redeemed either for  a cocktail of your choice or an appetizer of your choice at Dragon's Den - so you get a cocktail or appetizer each month for a year! Plus, you're going to get a Button, a Sticker, the exclusive Dragon's Den Founders T-Shirt and an invitation to our Soft Opening Party. 
The Wizard: You are going to get 12 Cocktail vouchers AND 12 Appetizer Vouchers at Dragon's Den - so you get a cocktail AND appetizer each month for a year! Plus, you're going to get a  the exclusive Dragon's Den Founders T-Shirt and two invitations to our Soft Opening Party. 
The Adventurer: A full year membership to the ADVENTURER's CLUB - this is our Dragon's Den membership club. As a Club Member you get: 

You are going to get 12 Cocktail vouchers AND 12 Appetizer Vouchers at Dragon's Den - so you get a cocktail AND appetizer each month for a year!
20% OFF Cocktail Purchases at Dragon's Den
10% OFF Food Purchases at Dragon's Den
10% OFF Purchases of Bottles or Merchandise at Dragon Distillery's Tasting Room

In addition you're going to get a  the exclusive Dragon's Den Founders T-Shirt and two invitations to our Soft Opening Party.

story:
Executive Chef to stars such as Beyonce, Erykah Badu, Drew Sidora, Ozzie Osbourne, Chance the Rapper, Gwen Stefani, 5th Harmony, Cold Play, Guns and Roses and more! Now caters to you!

 

Words To Believe In

 

I remember the day my grandmother told me, "you almost made it."  She said this to me after giving her the news that at the tender age of 17, I was pregnant.  With tears in my eyes I responded by saying to her, "I am going to make it and I will be somebody great".  I believed I could do it. I had no idea how I would do it but that day, the belief was a enough to keep me focused on becoming somebody great.

Giving birth to my son Jonathan fueled my beliefs even more and it was after taking a cake decorating class that I discovered a potential future for myself, and my son, by becoming a culinary artist. After graduating high school, I enrolled in The Art Institute of Chicago where I earned my Associates degree in Culinary Arts and a Bachelors in Culinary Management.  While in pursuit of my degrees, I gave birth to my oldest daughter Dionne, married the father of my son with the hopes that it would strengthen our bond as a family, and worked several full time jobs to keep us afloat.

During the early stages of my career in the culinary industry I worked every position imaginable from a busser,  to a runner, a prep cook, a line cook, a grill cook, a lead cook, and eventually becoming a kitchen supervisor. Somewhere in between all of these job titles, I gave birth to my youngest daughter Julia and shortly there afterwards, I experienced a huge change in the structure of my family.  These events took me back to my grandmother’s words. Becoming a single mother reaffirmed my beliefs in my ability to continue to be somebody great.

Eleven years after becoming a pregnant high school teenager, I was given title of Chef Manager at a company who can best be described as the Rolls Royce of the catering industry. When my grandmother received this news she said to me, “I’m proud of you.  You made it. You did it.” I am not sure she remembered telling me 11 years earlier that I had almost made it, but I certainly remembered. Having my grandmother tell me that I made it was the day I felt the most accomplished in my pursuit of greatness.  It was the day that I knew believing in myself was all I needed to achieve the lifestyle I wanted for myself and my family and therefore decided it was time to run my own business.

Today, I find myself as a single mother of three children, a divorcee, and a small business owner.  Every time I think about how my circumstances could potentially get in the way of my desire for greatness, I think about my grandmother’s words and how they challenged me to believe in myself  in the toughest of times. Because of her words, I allow my circumstances to empower me to continue to believe in myself. And now, I am asking you to join me in those beliefs.

I want to show how dreams can become a reality, how hard work does pay off, and how a girl from the south side of Chicago can be acclaimed as the best in the industry.  This is an opportunity to come from behind the scenes and take center stage. This is my opportunity to introduce Exquisite Taste and Service to the world.  You can make this possible!

 

The Launch of Exquisite TO GO

I have the opportunity to scale Exquisite Catering into a retail facility.  With the growth and development of my company and clientele, I have been offered the opportunity to acquire a retail food and service space.  As blessed as I feel for this great advance, it requires a start up cost that would only be possible to amass with your assistance. I am asking for anyone who has a belief in a small businesses with big experience, and who believes in me, to be apart of a life changing Exquisite Event.  Your contributions will not only benefit my family, but the community of people whom I will hire to run the facility and whom I will help cultivate into entrepreneurship through Exquisite Possibilities.

 

Specifically: We need to raise $88,000 to help the start up of the new Exquisite To Go location. Funds will be used to support the start up cost and up to three months of labor and rent to ensure Exquisite can operate a new retail space understanding the risk of a slow start up.

$15,025 Equipment cost

$6000 Production Kitchen Cost 

$4,060 Retail Space Rent for 3 months

$19,250 Approximate Employee Labor for 3 months

$20,000 Hired Manager, Accountant, Virtual Assistant, Legal

$1,000 POS System

$22,665 Misc Start up Expenses (COGS, Disposables, Permits, Signage etc)

 

Risks & Challenges of Moving into a Retail Space

As with any small business there are risks to be overcome.  Exquisite Catering & Events has operated solely under direction of  Executive Chef and Owner Tiffany Williams.  "One of our goals for 2018 was to hire at least full time 2 employees, with the addition of a retail space we will be able to hire up to 6!" Take a look at the numbers, we are  blessed to have an extreme campaign of word of mouth, amazing food and exquisite service, all this with little marketing and advertising. We have been very careful in selecting our location, menus and procedures to mitigate risks. We are are working with the best mentors, coaches and advisers to make the best decisions and maintain a brand that will continue resonate great food, service and profitability.  This fundraising effort is an attempt to provide security to future employees, promote sustainability in the company and to access the resources needed to make it all happen. 

 

Exquisite is Growing Tremendously!

A Look At The Numbers "2018 Goal: Reach $100,000 in Sales"

Sales Increases Since Inauguration:

Total Sales

  • 2016 $3,947.10 
  • 2017 $24,387.34       
    • Prior to incorporation  $4,658
    • Post incorporation  $19,728 
    • From 2016 to 2017 Exquisite Catering & Events experienced an increase in sales six times the initial amount
  • Current A/R  through December 2018: $24,085
  • Projected Catering Sales: $35,000
  • Projected Food Wholesale $5,000
  • Exquisite Consulting $5,000
  • Love to Cook, Cook to Live Classes $4,550
  • Pullman Food Hall Projected Sales: September $46,00

2018-Launch of Exquisite Consulting-focus on enhancing small food service businesses and educating entrepreneurs entering the food service industry

2018-Launch of South Side Soups by Exquisite-Fresh Wholesale soups for restaurants

 

Major Catering Partners:

  • BrookTree Health
  • Chicago Urban League
  • CIBC
  • The YWCA of Chicago
  • Chicago Child Care Society
  • Sunshine Enterprises
  • SECC
  • The Woodlawn Chamber of Commerce
  • St John De La Salle
  • Lundbeck Pharmaceuticals
  • Space to Grow
  • Salt & Light Coalition
  • Kehe Foods
  • The Purple Group
  • Deer Creek Christian School
  • Metropolitan Family Services
  • Canaan Community Church
  • Mabe's Deli

 

 

What We Need, What You Get

Which type of donar are you? 

Supporter $10-$100

Believer $100-$500

Ambassador $500-$1000

Brand Partner $1000-$5000

Exquisite Partner $25,000

All Donations at $1500 and beyond receives an Exquisite Level Event!

 

Supporters, you have heard of Exquisite Catering & Events by attending an event we catered, attending a Love to Cook, Cook to Live cooking class or by word of mouth. You are also individuals who want to support the business through action and who share the experience with others. Your donation is greatly appreciated and will help to contribute to the growth of the business. THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT! --Supporters who donate $100 receive a website mention and 5% off their first Exquisite TO GO order.

Believers, you are people who have understood my story and want to push Exquisite Catering & Events to the next level. You to believe that dreams can become a reality and that hard work does pay off.  You believe that your circumstances don’t hinder the outcome, they empower it!  You understand if we believe together, we can accomplish anything.  You are the people that drive me. Let’s continue to believe together! THANK YOU FOR BEING A BELIEVER!! --Believers who donate $250 or more will receive a website mention,a $25 loyalty card for Exquisite TO GO, and Exclusive Exquisite T-shirt.

Ambassadors, you are individuals who will go out in to the world and carry Exquisite Catering & Events with you in the wind. You are not only supporters and believers you are business minded individuals who will help to promote the business by creating meaningful business relationships and promoting contracts with potential clients. You are the Exquisite Catering & Events Brand Ambassadors. You are Exquisite angel investors who are in it solely to see the success of the company. --Ambassadors who donate $750 or more will receive a website mention, $75 loyalty card for Exquisite TO GO and Exclusive Exquisite T-shirt.

Brand Partner, like an Ambassadors you see the potential of where Exquisite is going. In one year, we have already made a great mark on the South Side of Chicago and we will extend that reach across the country with help from our partners like you. You create Exquisite Possibilities for others to live their dream and you understand the access to opportunities like this as a entrepreneur. You stand with Exquisite!  --All Donations at $1500 and beyond receives an Exquisite Level Event! a website mention, a $75 loyalty card for Exquisite TO GO, and Exclusive Exquisite T-shirt.

Exquisite Partner If you are interested in becoming an Exquisite Partner please contact us for more information.

Exquisite Level Event or E.L.E. Dining Experiences will be made available to anyone who donates $1500 or more. Contributions above $1500 will receive a private dinner with Executive Chef Tiffany Williams. She will come to your home and deliver an exquisite dining experience. For each increment of $1500, the dinner party size is increases by two people. $3000 grants dinner for 4, $6000 Grant’s dinner for 8, and so on. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people may not be able contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help. We need hands, and hearts. Share this campaign directly from the page using Indiegogo share tools. Word of mouth is what started the growth of Exquisite Catering & Events and with your help it will continue the growth to a big future.

For each increment of $1500, the dinner party size is increases by two people. $3000 grants dinner for 4, $6000 Grant’s dinner for 8, and so on. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people may not be able contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help. We need hands, and hearts. Share this campaign directly from the page using Indiegogo share tools. Word of mouth is what started the growth of Exquisite Catering & Events and with your help it will continue the growth to a big future.

story:
From 2016-2017, we lost 33% of our commercial honey bee populations. (source: University of Maryland, May 25, 2017).  

Help Bee Delightful rescue honey bees and bring universal attention to pesticide-free beekeeping practices.  We blend together the finest formulation of RAW honey, from treatment-free beekeepers, with Texas Wildflower honey from the bees we’ve helped rescue.  Not only are we celebrating the highest standards in beekeeping, Bee Delightful™ infuses our storied honey with CBD, a naturally occurring Cannabinoid extracted from Hemp. The phytonutrient spectrum in RAW honey enhances the antioxidant and anti-inflammatory benefits in each jar of Canna Bees™, making it THE HEALTHIEST spoonful of honey you've ever tried.  

Just over 1 year ago, we committed to rescuing our first 40 colonies of wild honey bees from hazardous, chemical environments. With your support, on April 25th of this year, we will complete our first social commitment to rescue 40 colonies of honey bees.  That's over ONE MILLION BEES!  

We're running out of time though and offering these perks in order to raise the funds necessary to honor our social commitment to rescue 40 colonies of honey bees in our first year. We're only able to continue carrying out our social mission because our customers have supported our brand by purchasing jars of Canna Bees™ and attended our events, where we celebrate the honey bees and CBD.  For this campaign, we're offering our CBD infused honey at incredible discounts.  We're also offering tickets to our once-in-a-lifetime pollinator-to-table event, held on April 25th at a gorgeous hill country sanctuary for the honey bees.  

Each ticket grants you access for 1, to this interactive event, where each carefully curated dish and beverage will highlight the gifts and benefits provided for by our honey bees and the wondrously beneficial hemp plant.  You'll be surrounded by a symphony of scents, live music and delightfully social people, all excitedly awaiting the arrival of a live honey bee colony, rescued just moments before the event.  We'll carefully place the bees at the event for observation, bringing our pollinator-to-table experience to life. Our rescue operators and beekeeping experts will be joining us as well, happy to share stories, compelling news and answer any of your questions. During the event, all of our attendees will have access to 4 complimentary masseuses. Beverages will be infused with hemp including New Belgium's new Hemperor HPA. And attendees will get to participate in several fun activities and try their luck winning a private CBD-infused dinner party for 10 of their friends.

So who gets to go on the rescue? 

Each of our 100 ticket holders has a 1 in 10 shot to be randomly selected to join our rescue operators on this real live rescue.  These ten individuals will join our rescue team hours before the event and see and experience a rescue, first hand.  After safely removing the bees with our Rescue experts, our Rescue Team will relocate the endangered hive to the sanctuary where the rest of the party will join us and celebrate our 40th successful rescue and the completion of our first social commitment to the bees. 

Please support our cause and bee a part of this awesome campaign to rescue 25 colonies in 25 days.  We recently expanded our commitment to sponsoring FREE REMOVALS in both Texas and Florida and we've enlisted 4 professional rescue operators to safely carry out these rescue missions for our customers and communities.  Like our Facebook page and get connected to our rescue teams as you share in this delightful social mission.

https://www.facebook.com/foodsavesbees/

Whether you're sharing this story and experience with others, grabbing a jar of Canna Bees for an awesome discount or joining us for this dinner celebration, we hope to toast our collective achievement with you all on April 25th.

Thanks for beeing amazing. And for helping us Save the Bees!!

 

If you have more questions about our honey or CBD, visit our FAQ page on our website at:

https://beedelightful.com/pages/faq

story:
Salem Spice and Salem Gnu Kitchen

A full-featured commercial shared kitchen with 9 stations for classes and an Allergen Free Kitchenette attached.  Leasing to professional caterers.  A retail store of spices, seasonings, teas, olive oils and extracts outside the kitchen.

  • David Bowie has been proprietor of Salem Spice since 2010.  Maritime sailing fanatic and a love of spices is what led him to Salem MA.
  • Roy Bene' is Le Cordon Bleu trained chef originally from New Orleans, recently from Dallas.  He brings education and coordination cred to the kitchen.
  • Linda A is our kitchen coordinator with more years in the food business than you will care to ask about.

Salem Spice has been a haven of flavor in Salem for 6 years.  It's time to grow.  We had our lease last year, March of 2017.  Ready to go, choosing the color for the walls, when BOOM.  Fire.  An electrical fire racing up the walls from the main distribution box.  The second floor was completely devastated.  The first and third floors were uninhabitable. Thankfully nobody was hurt.  The building was washed out, smoked up, and dripping the drops of sorrow for days.  7 days after signing the lease, we were literally homeless.  But not as bad as our neighbors - almost nothing was salvaged.

Thankfully, Salem Spice had not yet moved into the new space.

We were spared the devastation of product loss.  Over a year has passed, and now we have a lease again.  The building has brand new wiring.  New plumbing.  Improved insulation.  Clean walls.  The foundation has been resealed, the roof and awnings redone, the windows replaced,  with the crust and dust of 40 years cleaned in one big washdown.

In business, you have a 5-year plan.  Adjusted annually if not more often.   Our 5-year plan had been to make some really significant changes and upgrades to the space.  But not in the first year.  We had more expected to spread that cost out over a few years.  Now, all that construction, new equipment, and new options are planned for the first year.

Money is expensive.   Our needs are simple.

We have lived a year watching the space be cleaned and repaired, waiting for the opportunity to implement our own design..  Some false starts, some false stops, lots of frustration and yet we are really, truly on the verge of victory now.  We need to find $50,000 to move us from the current phase into production.  

 

Our goals, your rewards.

We are a retail store and a commercial kitchen providing classes.  We have some real perks to offer!

  • We need $50,000 to cover expenses while construction is ongoing.   
    • Our landlord is our business partner, not our financial partner. 
  • We have value, true value as a reward for your support  
    •  Spices and tangible perks 
    • Discounts on classes
    • Discounted kitchen lease fees.
    • Free personal classes!

What we are building

Our goal at Salem Gnu Kitchen is not just to be a commercial shared kitchen, but to be a community partner, providing jobs, skills, and opportunities for locals as well as classes and seminars for home cooks.  Cooking classes will be led by professional chefs teaching in a hands-on cooking environment. We will have state-of-the-art equipment with the capacity for 9 cooking stations during a typical class. Recording and playback equipment will allow students to view activity on a large screen as the chef is demonstrating techniques.  Caterers can use the full kitchen facilities and an additional Allergen Free Kitchen area will be available for lease to provide another layer of safety in cooking. 

Salem Gnu Kitchen is not a restaurant, nor a bar.  It’s everything else.

Please help us in our campaign.  Please share events, news, and images widely.   Use any opportunity to tell people about the venture, and please feel free to share with us your ideas on how Salem Gnu Kitchen and Salem Spice can help you!

Our mission statement is simple and direct.  “Help people cook good food”.  Our company goals are measurable and realistic, our guiding principles are applicable to all walks of life.  We are here to help build community and to share knowledge along with good food

Classes and More

Some class titles include:

  • Knife skills
  • Safe and clean food prep
  • Menu Selection
  • Cooking Beef
  • Cooking Chicken
  • Cooking Fish
  • Vegetarian cooking
  • Allergen awareness
  • International dishes
  • Multi-course dinner classes
  • ServSave Certifications

Other Ways You Can Help

There are so many people passionate about Salem Gnu Kitchen.   We want to assure you that there are ways for you to help us, and ways for us to help you.

If you are a culinary professional, please sign up on our site and register as a caterer, a teaching chef, or a food producer for retail sale.   Like our page on Facebook, share some of our events and posts, and watch for discounts offered to the professional community.

If you are a home cook, we are for you.   Register here as a supporter, like our Facebook page, share posts, recipes, images, and watch for special events only for our followers and supporters.

  • Remember to share this campaign widely.  We need all the help we can get.
  • This is a short window of opportunity.  Please help us succeed.

story:
Hello guys, greetings from Slovakia, from a small but friendly EU member state. We're glad to have you here with us, but it is also sad that nowadays we have to talk about things which are becoming more and more obvious in view of the changes in the last decades (climate changes, food quality, etc…). To understand what I think of, please look at this presentation, from Julian Cribb, about facts and our possible future, really thoughtful!

Perhaps we agree that the consumption of healthy, nutrient-rich food, fruit and vegetable from reliable sources is more and more important. Of course, nutritionist ram in vain "to eat fruit and vegetables five times a day" to cover the vitamin and mineral needs, as in many cases we do not even have a chance to do so!

Unfortunately from the 1970s, the plants’ vitamin content has drastically reduced! It does not really matter whether the leached soil, air pollution or the lack of topsoil conditioning causes the poorer nutrient content of the plants because eventually we will eat the result of it anyway!

Of course, we can eat worthless "empty" foods. We can consume unripe tropical fruits treated with chemicals, etc. The human body can tolerate tremendously high burden. But the short-term gains hit back in the long term. What will we eat if the food becomes worthless? Junk food rich in calories... What will be the result? A sick society, who give up on themselves and their survival. Certainly no one would like to live up to see this...

 

OUR SOLUTION

We recommend the algae based product line developed by Greenlife specifically for food shortages, mitigation of problems of daily consumption. The algae are not taken as a medicine, but as a natural, completely plant-based dietary supplement, a food. A product with plant origin, like fruits and vegetables - however we can obtain it in form of tablets or powder. We strongly believe in, and not only believe but already are utilizing, positive aspects of algae, which can result in positive health effects like:

• easement of inflammation

• enhancing the immune system

• slowing down cellular aging

• increasing the number of red blood cells

• thinning viral infections

• reduce fatigue

• eliminate foul breath

• getting over iron deficiency

• reducing stress and many other positive effects.

 

MANAGEMENT - TEAM

RISK MANAGEMENT

  • Sufficient raw material quality: We work only with European-produced raw materials, algae growing in thermal water in a closed photo reactor system, which guarantees their purity, that there is no pollution! These are tested raw materials.
  • Product quality: premium quality for an affordable price.
  • Manufacturing capacity: We are in close contact with at least three manufacturers with production capacity over more than 10 000 boxes/month.
  • Pricing: the price includes the manufacturing costs of products, VAT, packaging costs, platform and financial transaction fee! To secure low prices, we disregarded from all other rewards such as T-shirts, boards, etc. Even without these rewards the outstanding quality is ensured. We are to deliver and familiarize quality products. Act now to protect your health, by sparing your purse.
  • Perks delivery in time: 80% of the largest platforms with successful campaigns deliver rewards for supporters very late. Learning from that we optimize the sequence and turnaround time of required activities (updated database of supporters, manufacturing, packaging and shipping) so products and gifts will be delivered in the shortest possible time to achieve your satisfaction.
  • Shipping: unfortunatelly shipping cost represents high financial burden… We created packages where the balance between potential of boxes and related price limits are taken into account. To avoid this unpleasent situation in future we are looking for distributors, worldwide, to decrease shipping prices.

 

COOPERATION OFFER

We are looking for distribution partners worldwide. For deeper information please contact Mr. Zsolt Török.

 

WIN TESLA MODEL 3 and MONEY PRIZES

Available for individuals and companies! Read "Conditions of the competition".

 

IMPORTANT

What you experience after an exact amount of time is totally individual because every organism and situation is different.

It depends on:

- The organism’s general health.

- To what extent your organism is poisoned.

- What is the metabolism speed.

- To what extent your body awareness is developed (how aggressively you detect your organism signs and changes - there are people who do not even feel it when they hurt themselves, they only see the bruises later ...).

- What kind of health problems you are battling with (there are apparent symptoms and there can be symptoms that are not yet producing trouble, too!).

- To what extent our lifestyle is healthy.

- How much algae you consume.

- How much clean water you drink beside of that...

There are some people who feel they have more energy already in the first days or they have had something hurt and the pain is gone, there are those who have a few weeks passed before the first signs are detected, and there are people too, who realize after 2-3 months that "unnoticedly" those few problems are gone...

And there were some who suffered eight weeks because the symptoms have intensified. They wanted to stop the consumption, but fortunately they had enough presence of mind to continue and after 8 weeks, as if it was cut off, all the pain and trouble passed. The latter is the rarest.

The microalgae are "smart" stuff, always working with our organism in order of importance, as it is most needed. For example, if someone has cancerous lesions without the presence of any symptoms yet, then first they help the organisms’ immune boost, before, let’s say, they support our organism fighting migraines.

 

THANK YOU...

... for your confidence and support. Remember, you can help not only yourself and your immediate environment, but also unknown people who can access the suggested formulations even years later. Experience on yourself, that healthy can be delicious too! Enter the way of health, also by our gifts for you… If you willing to do so, please spread  information concerning to Greenlife products between your friends and loved ones. Thank you.

story:
Short Summary

I am Sue Speidel.

 I founded Desert Grind and then Orange Table, which I owned for several years. I took pride in making it a great place to dine and spend time with friends and family.

I found a great space at Scottsdale Road and Oak. It was just waiting for me to put in a new cafe.  So I'm going to call my new place will be called Inner Circle Cafe. It's a place where everybody belongs. We will do coffee, kombucha, salads, sandwiches and soups for dine in or take out.

Realizing that dining habits have changed over the years as lifestyles change I want to do a great selection of grab and go items as well. The new space has a large retail refrigerator just waiting for me to fill it with deliciousness.

What I Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • It will take $40,000+ to get everything going, tables, chairs, electrical, plumbing etc.  I have already started the process, but am looking for help. The plans are pretty simple; the main thing is to get things going so you all have a place to be!
  • I will have a donors wall for all investors, big or small, you believe in me, I want to thank you!
  • The project is already in the works. It will open, but every little bit helps.  It makes it easier to keep the doors open and get started more quickly.

The Impact

I am excited to be a part of the food and beverage community in Scottsdale again. I have missed you guys!!

Desert Grind and Orange Table were great,  Inner Circle will be even better! I can't wait to show you my new recipes and bring back old favorites.  Missed the Chai or Coffee Soda?  They will be back.

Risks & Challenges

Opening a restaurant is always a risk.  A new idea and feeding the public? 

 It's difficult but I am so excited to bring this new place to Scottsdale.

Come on by and check it out!.  We are finishing the plans and construction should start soon. If I am there, by all means stop by and say hi.

Inner Circle is a fresh start with a great new menu. I am sure you will love it.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • I know not everyone can contribute, but I would love your help to get the word out.  Talk about it , share this page, spread the word that I will be open soon!!

I can't wait to see everybody's faces again.

Break it down for folks in more detail:

It will take $40,000+ to get everything going, tables, chairs, electrical, plumbing etc.  I have already started the process, but am looking for help. The plans are pretty simple; the main thing is to get things going so you all have a place to be!
I will have a donors wall for all investors, big or small, you believe in me, I want to thank you!
The project is already in the works. It will open, but every little bit helps.  It makes it easier to keep the doors open and get started more quickly.


The Impact
I am excited to be a part of the food and beverage community in Scottsdale again. I have missed you guys!!
Desert Grind and Orange Table were great,  Inner Circle will be even better! I can't wait to show you my new recipes and bring back old favorites.  Missed the Chai or Coffee Soda?  They will be back.

Risks & Challenges
Opening a restaurant is always a risk.  A new idea and feeding the public? 
 It's difficult but I am so excited to bring this new place to Scottsdale.
Come on by and check it out!.  We are finishing the plans and construction should start soon. If I am there, by all means stop by and say hi.
Inner Circle is a fresh start with a great new menu. I am sure you will love it.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
I know not everyone can contribute, but I would love your help to get the word out.  Talk about it , share this page, spread the word that I will be open soon!!
I can't wait to see everybody's faces again.

story:
The Idea

Love&Magic is a multipurpose space with a cozy atmosphere. Offering best quality raw chocolate in Sweden alongside with nice food, drinks and desserts, we aim to create a warm atmosphere where you would like to return. Our second room will be open for weekly offered yoga class (free of charge), workshops in making raw chocolate/desserts/food.

We have plans to host here best city events from poetry evenings to film nights and of course chocolate parties!

As we want to be in harmony with the nature we are going to serve only ecological, organic and cruelty-free food. We know how it’s important to share and support so we want you to know that 10% of the cafe profit will always go to charity and you’ll always be able to check where it goes on our website.

Please check reviews on us here: https://www.facebook.com/pg/lovemagiccafe/reviews/

Inspiration

We believe that creating an environment friendly place with the best quality organic food is a good contribution to the whole eco-system and a great support to our future! The place where you able to feed your stomach, your feelings and your brain. You will be able to check all events we’re going to host in 2018 on our new website!

For more information and updates please visit our blog. 

 

Our story

Hi! We’re Anastasia & Alexandra. We’re both working with raw vegan chocolate and cuisine and have background in wellness and coaching. Once we met each other we realised that we making chocolate based on the exact same recipes and principles. It’s a small magic story  for us. We found that we have rather more in common than chocolate. We already had our own companies when we came to each other with the same idea: “Let’s create a space where we can create for others and with others together!” We’ve been so excited about this idea! People started to come and ask, to suggest ideas and help and we just believed in it more and more! We felt that something magic just happened. Now we are here. We believe that chocolate brings love. We want to build this place of peace, harmony and chocolate with you! ❤

• Follow our Indiegogo

• Visit our web lovemagic.se for all news and updates

• Like us on Facebook facebook.com/lovemagiccafe

• Join our Instagram instagram.com/lovemagiccafe

• Tweet us Twitter twitter.com/lovemagiccafe

All questions, suggestions and great ideas are velcome! Please, feel free to contact us! 

With chocolate and love,

Yours A&A

story:
Our Journey

Hey there, its Lauren, the owner and pastry chef, here! Grain began as my hobby as I raised my (now-toddler) son, Kaiden, while "finishing" school. Originally starting as PNW Cupcakes (and later Pacific Northwest Cupcakes, before our final change to Grain), I have always had a passion for cooking and baking with whole ingredients, while supporting sustainable agriculture and local small farmers and businesses. While I started with baking for friends and family, I have grown to serve my clients and fans through farmers markets, pop ups, pairings, custom orders, and weddings. The relationships I have made with not only the local farmers and businesses I source from, but also my clients, are what fuels my fire to continue serving our community with entirely sustainably and locally sourced pastries and cakes. The young Midwest born and raised mom who went to school for political science policy and energy sustainability policy and competed dressage for the NAJYRC, is now finding herself and her passion in the world of pastry. Funny how the world works, isn't it? 

A Bit About Grain

Grain brings baking back down to the fundamentals, gathering only the locally-sourced, sustainably-harvested, organically-grown, highest-quality ingredients to bring clients the experience of gorgeous desserts that are packed full of exquisite flavor profiles and luxurious textures, crafted carefully by an artisan’s hands. Without the use of preservatives, artificial flavoring, food dyes, or fondant, as Grain owner and pastry chef, I craft one of a kind, nature-inspired, flavorful desserts for clients craving a sustainable-minded bakery that value ingredient sourcing and sustainable agriculture, without sacrificing taste. Blending seasonal bounty with herbs and edible floral notes, many of Grain’s most popular flavors are far from chocolate and vanilla. As well as offering some of the best traditionally-baked pastries around, we pride ourselves in our decadent gluten-free, dairy-free, vegan and paleo options which have captured the hearts of diet-friendly clients from Everett to Issaquah and beyond. We are known for our commitment to using only local and sustainable ingredients, lending to our strong partnerships with small local farmers and our loyal clients who continue coming back for orders because of the high end pastries we serve.

Be sure to check out the feature video that we had filmed last year, as well as the gallery of photos of our work!

The Significance of Community Support in Our Journey

As we are collecting bakery equipment and tools, submitting permits and licenses, and working with numerous contractors, loan assistants, business coaches, and fellow pastry friends, we need the community's support to continue our journey. As a young, single mom, with limited resources, I have successfully grown Grain from a hobby to a catering business operating out of a commissary kitchen. However, the cost of starting a brick and mortar bakery (or restaurant) from a blank slate space isn't pennies. The opening of this brick and mortar will allow me to: spend more time with my son; bake in the early hours, which allows daily pre-orders; sell at more farmers markets; take on more custom orders, and on shorter timelines; have a pick-up location that is open daily for normal regular hours; and more. Without the opening of our brick and mortar, Grain will likely not be able to continue growth, as we have exceeded our availability at our commissary. Our ever-supportive and loving community of clients, friends and family have been supportive in every step of our journey (including making us the top grossing non-produce vendor at the Snohomish Farmers Market last year!), and we know that with your continued support and sharing of our campaign with your friends, family and colleagues, we will not only open a brick and mortar, but we will become greater Seattle's favorite sustainably-minded, wholesome (and delicious!) bakery!

What We Need & What You Get

To continue our well-known trait of transparency, we want you to know EXACTLY what our community's support will help attain. We need a total (including our small business loan and owner equity) of nearly $45,000 to make this brick and mortar happen, and we're a bit short! Here is a list of the expenses that will be covered under the capital required:

  • Deposit on the space, as well as first and second month's rent
  • Snohomish County Bakery Permit License, Field Plan Review
  • Snohomish City License
  • Two Snohomish County Farmers Market Permits (Snohomish Thursdays 3-7p, and Mill Creek Fridays 12-5p!)
  • King County Farmers Market Permit (year round market(s) out for jury!)
  • Ingredient stock
  • Marketing materials (printed on our signature 100% cotton paper with plant based biomass inks)
  • Buildout (general contractor, electrician, plumber, and zoning permits)
  • Equipment (oven(s), proofer, fridge, freezer, three basin sink, hand sink, prep sink, mop sink, dishwasher, grease trap, food processor, 20 quart mixer, 10 quart mixer, butcher block tables, storage bins, speed racks, induction stove tops, scales, immersion blender, torch, deep fryer(s), full sheet pans, half sheet pans, extra shelves, dough divider, sheeter, bread materials, and SO MUCH MORE!)

And here are some things we'd really, really like to fund as our stretch-goals after our capital goals are met:

  • Food photography course
  • Branded small business feature film and photos to showcase our work and passion
  • A variety of cake stands to add to our rentals list for our customers

And of course, what YOU get in return for supporting us! Each of the perks listed below (or to the side, depending on which device you're viewing this on!) includes the cost of the item, plus a bit of a donation, to actually get us the funding needed. (If we only did the cost of the item, we wouldn't have any capital to work with, ya know?) We have some pretty amazing perks, at lots of support points!

Risks & Challenges

We are in the process of finalizing the lease and the small business loan, so this brick and mortar will likely be happening no matter what! However, if for some reason this location falls through, we will be searching for another commissary location immediately, or moving to a closer location, which will require us to purchase most of our own equipment regardless.

We'd love to be in the space, as it will create a local gathering spot for enjoying the experience of hand-crafted pastries and cakes baked with only the best ingredients - local, sustainable, organic.

Other Ways You Can Help

Grain never would have gotten this far without your help. If you love Lauren and her story, and our baked goods, but can't afford to back us, thats okay, we totally understand! You can still help by spreading the word and getting the news out there:

  • Sharing our campaign and project with your friends and loved ones through social media and other channels
  • If you know of an individual or business who may be interested in donating to support a local small business, be sure to share our campaign and our story!
  • Keep up with our progress and save the date. Invite your friends, families, and loved ones to order their special events needs from Grain, and check out our upcoming pop ups and farmers markets!

story:
What the world needs now, is cake, sweet cake. 

C'est Cake is a Bespoke Bakery by Lizabeth Nagel. 

Lizabeth is an award winning Pastry Chef and kitchen fairy with a gift for sugary concoctions and a dream to share them with the world. 

Thats where you come in! 

Ultimately the goal is a cafe, loaded with deliciousness but also with a community space where we can host classes and events based in art, music, caking, etc... A queer led space where all persons can respectfully build a better community together.    

These initial funds will assist us in setting up shop by way of securing a location, licensing, marketing, specialized equipment. The sooner we can reach our initial goal, the sooner we can get started!!



C'est Cake has been a dream 30 years in the making, it has evolved many times over the years, beginning with the dreams of a 7 year old in the Eighties who wanted to name it "The Rainbow's End" and everything would be Hyper-color, because, well, the Eighties.  But jokes aside, we were built for this adventure. There is nothing we could hope for more than the opening of C'est Cake, it would truly mean the world to us and given the chance we would never stop giving back to the community in every way possible, because honestly the world could always be just a little sweeter. 

One of the ways we plan to give back is through paying it forward, allowing clients to purchase any item in the cafe, including a custom cake, attaching it to notes of encouragement and love to our board and if you are in need we encourage you to stop in, read the board and help yourself to a little sweetness. 

We know we are not alone in the cry for community and human connection, to do something that means something not just for ourselves but for everyone we are lucky enough to interact with please consider becoming a part of this magical experience via purchase or share or both! Whatever you choose, thank you for reading and for your consideration! 

With ALL our Love, 

Team C'est Cake

Lizabeth, Peggy and Natalie... and you! <3

story:
Summary

In today's world, it can be very challenging to live a healthy lifestyle. We all have a million things to do and are usually in a rush when it comes to consuming food or beverages. One of the biggest gaps in people's diets that is often overlooked is their source of energy (coffee or energy drinks).

Of course we all agree that those cans of sugar and synthetic ingredients we refer to as energy drink are bad for you, but what about our coffee? Have you ever stopped to think about what's in it? Quick example: A 16oz vanilla latte from the largest coffee shop in the world has about 200 calories and 28 grams of sugar. Not as much as the 220 calories and 52 grams of sugar in the most popular energy drink, but still a lot.

We created Wake Up Water to provide a healthy alternative - one without all of those unnecessary calories and sugars. Whether you're looking to crush an early morning workout, power through those post-lunch meetings, or have a long night of work ahead of you, Wake Up Water's got your back. Our goal is to help make living a healthy lifestyle a little easier.

Instagram: @wakeupwater

 

So What's In It?

Wake Up Water is a non-carbonated flavored water that provides a great tasting, clean energy boost.

Key Facts:

  • Roughly the same caffeine as a medium cup of coffee.
  • Electrolytes to fight back against caffeine's tendency to dehydrate you.
  • 100% of your daily value of Vitamins B3, B5, B6, and B12.
  • ONLY 25 calories and 5 grams of sugar in an entire bottle.
  • NO Artificial flavors, colors, or sweeteners.
  • Comes in resealable 16oz bottles - great for those on the go.
  • Three delicious flavors: Lemonade, Orange Mango, and Peach Green Tea.

 

 

Here's how we stack up against the leading energy drink:

 

Why We Need Funding

We need your help to get Wake Up Water off the ground. It has been under development for about two years now and it's finally ready to go. The formula has been finalized, bottles have been selected, and labels have been designed - bringing us to our first production run. With an expected launch in early September, it's a very exciting time for the brand, but we need some financial help to get it going. We will be using the funds to purchase our high-quality ingredients, our bottles and labels, and to spruce up our website, among other things.

 

Closing

We greatly appreciate all the love and support. There are countless people to thank including supportive family and friends for helping us get to this point. It has been a long time in the making but we are just getting started. Join the movement and let's create something special together. Let's Go.

story:
Welcome to Gompers Distillery! Our distillery and spirits are named after my grandparents who were both Dutch Holocaust survivors that found a way to look toward the future and thrive.

With that spirit of hopefulness and a passion for doing what we love, we are opening the first distillery in Redmond, Oregon. Gompers Distillery will be a place to relax and enjoy life. We will feature our own Gompers Gin and Gompers Old Tom Style Gin, made from the best Pacific Northwest ingredients and will allow us to expand our product offerings and become one of the few grain to glass distilleries.

My Oma and Opa were both Holocaust survivors from Holland and what makes them so inspirational is not just the obvious, that they managed to survive the Holocaust, but they managed to thrive and inspire despite of it. 

When I think of my Opa (grandfather), Herman Gompers, I remember him as a fun, outgoing and loving family man. He would always say to us kids, “I am a rich man, not from money but what makes me rich is my beautiful family.” How a man who lost his entire family, except his sister, in the Holocaust could live life with such love and forgiveness is truly inspirational. Herman Gompers never dwelled on the past but always looked to the future. He would often say, “it’s nice to be important and important to be nice.” Words he lived by and words we live by everyday.

To learn more about my Opa, Herman Gompers, you can watch his story in his own words here.

We started with gin.

The fun man on the front of our gin bottles is my Opa.  Herman was Dutch and LOVED gin and gin was created by the Dutch so it all went hand in hand. We tried to embody his spirit and love of life in our Estate Gin. We use local hand-picked juniper berries from our horse farm in Bend, Oregon; Tumalo lavender which lends a slight peppery finish and gorgeous Hood River golden pears that add a beautiful and unique fruit note.

Meet the Harts, the family behind Gompers Distillery: Jessica, Michael, their son Daniel and pups Fiona and Winston.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $20,000. Funds will be used to open Gompers Distillery, the very first distillery, in Redmond, Oregon. This will enable us to add all the infrastructure needed to make Gompers Distillery a reality, including electrical, plumbing, HVAC and other items. The perks include  your name on our donors wall, invitations to the distillery opening, membership in our Founder's Club and a vacation package at the beautiful Eagle Crest resort.

The Impact

Your contribution means supporting the economic development of Redmond, Oregon.

Your contribution means supporting a family legacy through craft spirits.

Your contribution means supporting a unique grain to glass distillery.

Your contribution means hope. Join us in celebrating the future of craft distilling, just like my Opa & Oma would want us too!

Herman Gompers was from Holland and our still will be too. We are purchasing an iStill 2000 and Mini. These Dutch stills are known for their versatility in producing all types of spirits and ability to create and manage the Maillard Reaction taste cascade for 20% more taste.

Risks & Challenges

We are committed to opening the first distillery in Redmond, Oregon. There are risks and challenges when opening any new facility but should any issues arise we promise to keep you up-to-date as we move forward.

We’ll be sending updates to our backers throughout the campaign.

Indiegogo rules and regulations prevent us from shipping or selling alcohol through this campaign. Merchandise may be shipped or picked up at our distillery at: 611 NE Jackpine Court, Redmond, OR 97756. If you are out of town, why not book a trip to beautiful Central Oregon.

Thank you for being a part of this adventure with us. With your support our dream of opening the first distillery in Redmond is about to become a reality!
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share the campaign! Post to Facebook, Twitter, Instagram or email. We are grateful for your support and look forward to seeing you at the distillery!
story_txt:
Welcome to Gompers Distillery! Our distillery and spirits are named after my grandparents who were both Dutch Holocaust survivors that found a way to look toward the future and thrive.
With that spirit of hopefulness and a passion for doing what we love, we are opening the first distillery in Redmond, Oregon. Gompers Distillery will be a place to relax and enjoy life. We will feature our own Gompers Gin and Gompers Old Tom Style Gin, made from the best Pacific Northwest ingredients and will allow us to expand our product offerings and become one of the few grain to glass distilleries.
My Oma and Opa were both Holocaust survivors from Holland and what makes them so inspirational is not just the obvious, that they managed to survive the Holocaust, but they managed to thrive and inspire despite of it. 
When I think of my Opa (grandfather), Herman Gompers, I remember him as a fun, outgoing and loving family man. He would always say to us kids, “I am a rich man, not from money but what makes me rich is my beautiful family.” How a man who lost his entire family, except his sister, in the Holocaust could live life with such love and forgiveness is truly inspirational. Herman Gompers never dwelled on the past but always looked to the future. He would often say, “it’s nice to be important and important to be nice.” Words he lived by and words we live by everyday.
To learn more about my Opa, Herman Gompers, you can watch his story in his own words here.
We started with gin.
The fun man on the front of our gin bottles is my Opa.  Herman was Dutch and LOVED gin and gin was created by the Dutch so it all went hand in hand. We tried to embody his spirit and love of life in our Estate Gin. We use local hand-picked juniper berries from our horse farm in Bend, Oregon; Tumalo lavender which lends a slight peppery finish and gorgeous Hood River golden pears that add a beautiful and unique fruit note.

Meet the Harts, the family behind Gompers Distillery: Jessica, Michael, their son Daniel and pups Fiona and Winston.

What We Need & What You Get
Our goal is to raise $20,000. Funds will be used to open Gompers Distillery, the very first distillery, in Redmond, Oregon. This will enable us to add all the infrastructure needed to make Gompers Distillery a reality, including electrical, plumbing, HVAC and other items. The perks include  your name on our donors wall, invitations to the distillery opening, membership in our Founder's Club and a vacation package at the beautiful Eagle Crest resort.



The Impact
Your contribution means supporting the economic development of Redmond, Oregon.
Your contribution means supporting a family legacy through craft spirits.
Your contribution means supporting a unique grain to glass distillery.
Your contribution means hope. Join us in celebrating the future of craft distilling, just like my Opa & Oma would want us too!


Herman Gompers was from Holland and our still will be too. We are purchasing an iStill 2000 and Mini. These Dutch stills are known for their versatility in producing all types of spirits and ability to create and manage the Maillard Reaction taste cascade for 20% more taste.
Risks & Challenges
We are committed to opening the first distillery in Redmond, Oregon. There are risks and challenges when opening any new facility but should any issues arise we promise to keep you up-to-date as we move forward.
We’ll be sending updates to our backers throughout the campaign.
Indiegogo rules and regulations prevent us from shipping or selling alcohol through this campaign. Merchandise may be shipped or picked up at our distillery at: 611 NE Jackpine Court, Redmond, OR 97756. If you are out of town, why not book a trip to beautiful Central Oregon.
Thank you for being a part of this adventure with us. With your support our dream of opening the first distillery in Redmond is about to become a reality! 

Other Ways You Can Help
Please share the campaign! Post to Facebook, Twitter, Instagram or email. We are grateful for your support and look forward to seeing you at the distillery!

story:
Hello, I am a family man running a family business. Whether I have provided a service or product, I stood behind my business. Throughout my career, I sought after business opportunities that were fruitful and beneficial to my customers’ life. Although my prior businesses were fulfilling, Yo Pitts! brings everything into play.

 I am a passionate foodie, a health conscience and innovative individual. As I grew older, I realized that I could no longer eat the way I used to due to preservatives and additives.

            The above realization sat in the back of my mind for a while. It was forefront when working on my patented All-Natural Multi-functional soap. While sourcing ingredients, I was intrigued by the phenomenal smells and tastes I indulged in during my visits to farms in upstate NY. I had an epiphany when I tasted several jams. It came to me like the sun parting through cloudy skies:

This journey has led me to these experiences to tap into my inner foodie. I thought, I could create flavorful and healthy spreads/condiments to make good food taste delightful. At that moment my condiment line was created.

            As my journey continued, I achieved a bit of the impossible. I established the condiment line and began making strides. My passion and drive has led me to my present position (great products, website, inventory, some distribution, in-store placements). Now, I am reaching out to everyone who likes tasty foods. To move forward with, Yo Pitts! and distribute our products to more consumers, we need funding. Everyone that has tried our products, claims our condiments to be their favorite. I am now reaching out to those people and especially people who haven’t tasted our ketchup and mustard. So, we thank you in advance for your contribution to something great! Choose a perk now that fits your level of passion for food or for great products!

Whether you are hosting a family BBQ,dinner party or golfing event, our brand has the right additions to liven up your gathering. We have various packages available for any event or reception. Come eat with us!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our Ask…

            Our ask is simple: We need funding to expand! We have made it to this point on an aglet budget. An aglet (AG-lət) is a small sheath, often made of plastic or metal, used on each end of a shoelace. Therefore, after flourishing with what we had financially, with less than a shoestring budget, it’s time to expand. Our demand has increased and customer satisfaction, we are ready to take Yo Pitts! on a national platform  Our financial prowess is stellar and we have this planned out extensively.

We are aggressively expanding our reach with orders (local and online), new stores and restaurants as well as events. We need to get our products out there.

(40%) Transportation – we are looking to purchase our first vehicle:

The Yo Pitts! Food Truck

Once we have the fund to purchase one, wave when you see us because we are either delivering to a store, restaurant, customer or our charity work at food banks.

 

We’ve received outstanding reviews from our customers, but we need to let everyone else know about us. We tried shouting from rooftops and street corners. We decided to partner up with a marketing company and we created a plan to gain more exposure nationwide.

(30%) Marketing – we are planning a nationwide campaign with deep hyper-local segments using digital, mobile, TV, radio and some OOH.

We may be looking to possibly feature some of our customers for a more personable approach.

As things progress, our production workload will increase. With that being said, we need to expand in several areas. We are also facilitating more wedding favors and events. We are building out our fundraising business for schools and other organizations.

(30%) Expansion– We are looking to increase production, our wedding/event channel and our fundraising channel.

Quotes from the family:

            Mom – “I believe in you but this better be good!”

            Sister – “You got this, older brother!”

            Wife – “You can do it, baby. Better let me check it out though”

            Daughter – “Hey Dad, what is this stuff? It’s good!”

Our perks represent a lifestyle that incorporates many different aspects of tastes and touches all. We selected a few lifestyles, but whatever your lifestyle is Yo Pitts!, can be part of it.

If we raise funds above our goal, we will roll out our ON THE GO initiative. ON THE GO will include a mobile and a snack pack.

 The mobile app will include:

  • Where to buy our products.
  • What foods our flavors go with (through science)
  • What beverages pair with our flavors
  • Recipes
  • Games

All on the GO!

Also we are in the development stages of creating a snack pack. We desire to produce a snack pack that is healthy and tasty on the GO!

We don’t imagine for one minute that this will be easy – it hasn’t been so far. However, the tasty products we produce and passion we have for the healthy goodness pushes us. The tremendous amount of business insight and support I have is a true blessing.

Now, this is where YOU - the reader comes in.

If you can purchase a perk, no matter what level, it is appreciated.

Every small drop of water helps to fill even the biggest of buckets! -TP (that’s me)

You can also spread the word, no need to scream or shout (We’ve tried that already). You can help by posting about our campaign on any social media platform or send an email.

Have a favorite grocery, health food store or market?  Fill this form out and send it to us.

Email: info@yopittsfoods.com

Fax: 212.234.2400

Mail:
Yo Pitts! Foods

2266 5th Ave, # 834

NY, NY 10037

story:
Heb je geen creditcard, maar wil je toch bijdragen? Dan kan je je bijdrage storten op het rekeningnummer BE03 7430 5405 5484 gericht aan Veerle Joosten en met de mededeling 'tisane'.  

In't kort

Voor wie me nog niet kent, ik ben Veerle, 36 jaar jong, een echte levensgenieter, boordevol enthousiasme en trotse inwoner van Antwerpen. Een eigen zaak openen was altijd al een droom, maar de stap zetten ging toch niet altijd even makkelijk. 

Al jaren praat ik erover om een eigen thee/koffiebar te openen, tot op het punt dat mijn vrienden en familie zelfs dachten dat het er niet meer van zou komen.

Wel, ze krijgen ongelijk! Mijn plan had alleen wat meer tijd nodig om te rijpen :-)!

Zoals je misschien al gelezen hebt in de campagne of gezien hebt in de video, is het mijn motto om het leven te vieren. En voor mij is tisane daarvoor echt de beste manier!

Je zal kunnen genieten van gezonde EN super lekkere recepten, allemaal met liefde bereid en geserveerd. Natuurlijk probeer ik ook rekening te houden met intoleranties en allergieën. Maar vrees niet, op de menukaart vind je voor elk wat wils!

Wat mag je nog verwachten?

- naast thee en koffie serveer ik ook zelfgemaakte frisdrank, bieren en wijn

- laatavondopening, want wat ik zelf echt mis in Antwerpen is een goeie koffie na 18h

- een eigen thee- en infusiemerk, tisane

- in de toekomst, verschillende theeceremonies

Dus met jouw hulp kunnen we samen een droom verwezenlijken, de tisane droom. En wie weet, misschien creëren we zo wel een 'begrip' in Antwerpen...

Wat heb ik nodig, en wat krijg jij?

het doel

Volgens mijn berekeningen heb ik, om mijn beloftes echt helemaal waar te maken, nog 40.000 euro nodig. 

Waarvoor ga ik dit bedrag gebruiken?

- structurele werken: 27.000 euro (om de ruimte zo optimaal mogelijk te kunnen gebruiken, maar ook om een aantal verouderde zaken te vernieuwen)

- keuken / bar: 16.500 euro (om jullie de lekkerste recepten voor te schotelen, in een verantwoorde infrastructuur)

- inrichting: 3.000 euro (om de tisane sfeer tot leven te brengen)

Is het alleen nemen of ook geven?

Geven zit van nature in mij, wie me kent zal dat zeker beamen. Daarom heb ik voor jou leuke pakketjes samengesteld als tegenprestatie voor jouw bijdrage. 

Ga dus zeker even kijken bij de 'perks' of in het Nederlands, de 'voordelen'. Hoe meer je geeft, hoe meer je terugkrijgt. Maar één ding is zeker: je zal sowieso kunnen smullen van al het lekkers dat tisane te bieden heeft. 

Allemaal goed en wel, maar wat als de campagne zijn doel niet bereikt?

Als de campagne zijn doel niet bereikt, dan zal ik mijn financieel plan moeten herbekijken. Kan ik met het opgehaalde bedrag anders te verdelen toch al tisane opstarten? Wie weet..., maar de prio's zullen op dat moment dus bepaald worden.  

Mocht de campagne niet het gewenste effect hebben, dan wordt  tisane dit jaar helaas niet opgestart en wordt jullie gift gewoon teruggestort.

De impact van jouw bijdrage?

Jouw bijdrage zal bepalen...

of ik een volledige carrièreswitch kan maken of niet

of tisane straks volledig af is, of deels

of er een leuke sfeer kan gecreëerd worden of een supersfeer

of jij straks ook gelukkig wordt als je het tisane-logo ziet voorbij komen

Uitdagingen?

Een uitdaging wordt het sowieso, maar ik ben goed voorbereid. 

De weinige ervaring in de horeca wordt ruimschoots goedgemaakt door mijn passie, drive en organisatietalent. Natuurlijk zal ik nog een beetje mijn weg moeten zoeken en routine kweken...

Dat is ook één van de redenen waarom tisane niet onmiddellijk voltijds geopend zal zijn. Ik start met opening op vrijdag, zaterdag en zondag. Op die manier kan ik al even testen of mijn concept hier en daar nog wat moet aangepast worden. 

Wat kan je nog doen? 

Je kan mijn campagne nog op een andere manier steunen, namelijk door: 

  • over mijn campagne te praten, Hang het aan de grote klok, dit keer mag dat zeker en vast!
  • mijn campagne met jullie vrienden, familie en kennissen te delen 

Want hoe meer mensen op de hoogte zijn, hoe sneller we het doel kunnen bereiken! En des te sneller jullie kunnen genieten in tisane!

Heb je geen creditcard, maar wil je toch bijdragen? Dan kan je je bijdrage storten op het rekeningnummer BE03 7430 5405 5484 gericht aan Veerle Joosten en met de mededeling 'tisane'.
