story:
Hi! I am Sandra, and welcome to HAPPY TEAS, my new herbal tea business, based in Perth, Western Australia.

Tea production for making Morning Chai

Background

My interest of actually making natural remedies myself started with me and my partner growing some herbs on our balcony when I had just moved to Perth from Stockholm. Delighted with the sheer fact that it wasn't dark for six months of the year and that thing that you put in a pot actually might survive, I absolutely filled the little space up with all kinds of herbs and plants and also started conserving them (I actually had that much abundance, I thought, it was amazing!). 

My home-grown lavender harvest.

Luckily, a year after, we were able to move in to a house with a small garden. We quite instantly filled it up with all sorts of yummy herbs and vegetables and that spring I also managed to do a cert II in horticulture at the local Tafe, which gave me some extra knowledge about gardening. 

Locally sourced rose petals from Kakulas Brothers in Northbridge.

The start of Happy Teas

Then, really just by chance, I started out making some teas for my friends who needed them for different problems or situations. After a while my partner indicated (strongly) to me that I should really give this tea-business a go. So I decided, carefully at first, to try to expand my tea-making into a business and realized that I really enjoyed the entrepreneurial side of it as well. 

So I did a lot of research on marketing and legalities and started making my standard production, which can be found below. ​ 

The concept of Happy Teas

The idea of Happy Teas is that it should be easy to choose natural remedies over pharmaceutical. Therefore I try to keep the products as simple as possible, without loosing out on effect or taste, so that you as a costumer can easily find what you need even if this might be your first experience of buying herbal remedies. 

Starting my day, with a cosy cup of tea.

Moreover, I want costumers to know why the product is good for them, which is something I often miss when buying "remedy teas". So rather than generic lines like "restful lavender" and such I will send each customer an email with an explanatory note explaining the content of the product. 

Take a break. Pause. Have a cup of tea.

I try to also source my material and ingredients as local as possible (as well as selling locally). I don't just want to be another brand but a local presence along with my products so that all costumers can feel safe with what they buy!

Shopping for supplies at Kakulas Brothers in Northbridge.

The Teas

At the moment we are offering a range of herbal homemade teas for you to try. 

Maybe you are experiencing fatigue in the morning, having difficulties falling asleep or struggling with menstrual pains or discomfort, we have a tea for it! ​All caffeine-free!

For more information on the teas, click on the links:

  • Morning Chai
  • Starting your day
  • Night Time
  • That time of the month
  • Grumpy Tummy
  • Happy Mommy Happy Baby

Purchasing Happy Teas

The teas are packaged in bags of 15 teabags a package and sold for $11 inc. GST each. The easiest way for you to buy is to email or call me on the address and number listed on my website and I will either send it to you via post or if you live close buy you might prefer to pick it up rather than paying postage. 

I will also sell my teas at several markets, with dates and information able to be found on Happy Tea's Facebook and Instagram page.

Why do I need $700?

I am trying to expand my business  to increase production and expand into other markets.

I will use the crowdfunded money to produce professional labels and packaging, as well as spending a portion on marketing materials such as a banner for use at markets.

These items will make my brand look more professional and suitable for larger markets, so that more people have the opportunity to try my lovely tea!

The rewards for the pledges will give you a chance to try some of my products. I will email you once the campaign is concluded so you can choose which tea you would like.

Testimonals

"Sleepy time tea is my absolute saviour on a cold night, it warms and soothes in an instant, making for a restful nights sleep. Come sunrise I am up and active, starting the day with a pot of morning chai - it's way better than a coffee for rebooting the brain! Knowing that the herbs, flowers and spices are coming from a known source and are carefully considered for flavour and potential health benefits is comforting in a world where mass produced tea is everywhere. I love Happy Tea's!" - Basia Littlejohn, Fremantle WA

“Thank you Happy Teas. I have been very pleased with my purchases, 'Grumpy Tummy' and 'Night Time' tea, both of which I would recommend. I love that your herbal teas are made from all natural ingredients and have no caffine. I must also make mention of the detail in the packaging. Each packet has the ingredients written on the back of the packet and instructions for use on the bottom of the packet. Then there is the very personal touch of hand drawn pictures, every one different on different teas. Love it! Thanks again Happy Teas” - Yvonne White, Burns Beach WA

"I have tried three different teas from Happy Teas and they have all been a wonderful surprise. The two morning teas are energizing and gives me a bit of an extra boost after waking up, especially the chai. I have also tried the grumpy tummy and usually have it after dinner and it helps soothe my stomach well after a big meal!" - Tristan White, Joondalup WA

Special Thanks

Thank you to the Edith Cowan Business students for assisting me in the creation of this crowdfunding initiative.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it - Thanks again for your support!

Some further information can be found on my website, feel free to take  a look.
story_txt:
Hi! I am Sandra, and welcome to HAPPY TEAS, my new herbal tea business, based in Perth, Western Australia.

Tea production for making Morning Chai
Background
My interest of actually making natural remedies myself started with me and my partner growing some herbs on our balcony when I had just moved to Perth from Stockholm. Delighted with the sheer fact that it wasn't dark for six months of the year and that thing that you put in a pot actually might survive, I absolutely filled the little space up with all kinds of herbs and plants and also started conserving them (I actually had that much abundance, I thought, it was amazing!). 

My home-grown lavender harvest.
Luckily, a year after, we were able to move in to a house with a small garden. We quite instantly filled it up with all sorts of yummy herbs and vegetables and that spring I also managed to do a cert II in horticulture at the local Tafe, which gave me some extra knowledge about gardening. 

Locally sourced rose petals from Kakulas Brothers in Northbridge.
The start of Happy Teas
Then, really just by chance, I started out making some teas for my friends who needed them for different problems or situations. After a while my partner indicated (strongly) to me that I should really give this tea-business a go. So I decided, carefully at first, to try to expand my tea-making into a business and realized that I really enjoyed the entrepreneurial side of it as well. 

So I did a lot of research on marketing and legalities and started making my standard production, which can be found below. ​ 
The concept of Happy Teas
The idea of Happy Teas is that it should be easy to choose natural remedies over pharmaceutical. Therefore I try to keep the products as simple as possible, without loosing out on effect or taste, so that you as a costumer can easily find what you need even if this might be your first experience of buying herbal remedies. 

Starting my day, with a cosy cup of tea.
Moreover, I want costumers to know why the product is good for them, which is something I often miss when buying "remedy teas". So rather than generic lines like "restful lavender" and such I will send each customer an email with an explanatory note explaining the content of the product. 

Take a break. Pause. Have a cup of tea.
I try to also source my material and ingredients as local as possible (as well as selling locally). I don't just want to be another brand but a local presence along with my products so that all costumers can feel safe with what they buy!

Shopping for supplies at Kakulas Brothers in Northbridge.
The Teas
At the moment we are offering a range of herbal homemade teas for you to try. 
Maybe you are experiencing fatigue in the morning, having difficulties falling asleep or struggling with menstrual pains or discomfort, we have a tea for it! ​All caffeine-free!
For more information on the teas, click on the links:

Morning Chai
Starting your day
Night Time
That time of the month
Grumpy Tummy
Happy Mommy Happy Baby

Purchasing Happy Teas
The teas are packaged in bags of 15 teabags a package and sold for $11 inc. GST each. The easiest way for you to buy is to email or call me on the address and number listed on my website and I will either send it to you via post or if you live close buy you might prefer to pick it up rather than paying postage. 
I will also sell my teas at several markets, with dates and information able to be found on Happy Tea's Facebook and Instagram page.
Why do I need $700?
I am trying to expand my business  to increase production and expand into other markets.
I will use the crowdfunded money to produce professional labels and packaging, as well as spending a portion on marketing materials such as a banner for use at markets.
These items will make my brand look more professional and suitable for larger markets, so that more people have the opportunity to try my lovely tea!
The rewards for the pledges will give you a chance to try some of my products. I will email you once the campaign is concluded so you can choose which tea you would like.
Testimonals
"Sleepy time tea is my absolute saviour on a cold night, it warms and soothes in an instant, making for a restful nights sleep. Come sunrise I am up and active, starting the day with a pot of morning chai - it's way better than a coffee for rebooting the brain! Knowing that the herbs, flowers and spices are coming from a known source and are carefully considered for flavour and potential health benefits is comforting in a world where mass produced tea is everywhere. I love Happy Tea's!" - Basia Littlejohn, Fremantle WA
“Thank you Happy Teas. I have been very pleased with my purchases, 'Grumpy Tummy' and 'Night Time' tea, both of which I would recommend. I love that your herbal teas are made from all natural ingredients and have no caffine. I must also make mention of the detail in the packaging. Each packet has the ingredients written on the back of the packet and instructions for use on the bottom of the packet. Then there is the very personal touch of hand drawn pictures, every one different on different teas. Love it! Thanks again Happy Teas” - Yvonne White, Burns Beach WA
"I have tried three different teas from Happy Teas and they have all been a wonderful surprise. The two morning teas are energizing and gives me a bit of an extra boost after waking up, especially the chai. I have also tried the grumpy tummy and usually have it after dinner and it helps soothe my stomach well after a big meal!" - Tristan White, Joondalup WA
Special Thanks
Thank you to the Edith Cowan Business students for assisting me in the creation of this crowdfunding initiative.

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it - Thanks again for your support!Some further information can be found on my website, feel free to take  a look.

story:
Who are we? 

We are a 3rd generation husband & wife team of Coffee planters on a quest to share our Award-winning coffee beans with coffee lovers around the world. Taking a break from working in Hollywood, Prasanna and Anthi have temporarily relocated to India to take care of their family's coffee plantation. 

Grown responsibly in a high-altitude region in Southern India, our coffee beans are hand picked, machine pulped and sun dried to achieve the highest cupping quality and taste. Our Coffee estate has been winning national recognition every year for the quality and flavor of its beans. 

Every time we travel to India, we bring back fresh coffee for our friends in California and they can't wait to get brewing. So we are now on Indiegogo to launch our very own brand of coffee beans called "WiCoPo - Wild Coffee in a Pot" and reach out to other coffee enthusiasts around the world and offer them high quality Indian beans, filled with unique and strong flavors. 

Why are we on Indiegogo? 

Well, because you guys are awesome and we want to start slow by targeting coffee enthusiasts before scaling up to retail. We have tied up with a professional packaging company that will ensure high quality packaging with little to no loss in aroma and flavor. Apart from getting great coffee, your funding and support will also give us the confidence to take our coffee to new markets. 

A lot of work goes into growing coffee, from keeping the plants healthy and the insects away, to giving them the right nutrients and water. As planters, nothings give us more satisfaction than seeing our coffee enjoyed and appreciated. This is the driving force behind us to get our beans into coffee cups around the world. 

What do you get for supporting us ?

As we have just completed our picking season, we are ready to ship to you premium quality arabica beans roasted (or unroasted) to your preference. You can grind these beans to your requirement, depending on your brewing apparatus and enjoy some of India's finest brews.

story:
Who we are and what it is all about

We are Ted and Joanne - the founders of the For True Foodies Only app - the culinary world in your pocket.  Ted is a Cordon Bleu Chef and Joanne is a marketing exec and foodie. We love food, cooking, fine dining, wine and restaurants. Our passion is to celebrate everything about great food and that is why we launched True Foodies. 

Now we are launching a new feature - international cooking courses for everyone who has ever wanted to learn how to cook like a professional.

Ted has recruited some of his Professors from Le Cordon Bleu Paris and their friends to launch our first 2 series of video cooking courses. They will be available on iPhone and laptop via the True Foodies app and website.  We are starting with:

French Pastry - Foundations Course - 30 lessons that will teach you how to make all the classic french tart crusts, and elements, how to make caramel, pâte à choux, feuilletage and recipes that build on these basics that will have you baking like a chef.

French Cusine - Foundations Course - 30 lessons that will teach you professional chef techniques such as knife techniques, turning vegetables, how to make the stocks that are part of every professional chefs repertoire, and classic french recipes using these techniques such as Fish Soup, French Onion Soup, Whiting in Bearnaise sauce and much more.

All video lessons have ingredients and step-by-step instructions as well as Chefs' Tips that you can read while you watch and even print out if you prefer.

Important!  We are making beautiful hardcover book versions of the courses with photos and step-by-step instructions for each lesson. We are also offering toolkits with the best French tools and hard-to-find ingredients to make it easy to get started.

Coming next will be courses in 7 more languages, intermediate and superior courses as well as cuisines from other countries: Italian, Japanese, Thai and  many more.  Sign up here to be  notified.

The Professors:

 

 

Chef Bruno Stril - retired Professor of Cuisine for 15 years at Le Cordon Bleu Paris, previously executive Chef at Maxim’s Paris, and Michelin star Hotel du Palais in Biarritz.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Chef Philippe Salomon retired Professor of Pastry for 18 years at top French culinary school Ferrandi, previously executive pastry chef at 2 Michelin star Le Grand Véfour. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

We are so excited about bringing cooking lessons by real professionals to a broader audience in a modern style that will let everyone who has ever dreamed about culinary school - or just wanted to be a great chef - have a chance to learn in their own home.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for $25,000 dollars to fund the production of our next video series with intermediate and advanced levels, integrate a special section in the True Foodies app and on our website just for cooking classes, and produce the physical books. 

Other than the cooking classes themselves, the toolkits, and physical books we have some really great perks such as super stylish wine cooler bags, True Foodies fridge magnets and VIP access.  Check out all the great packages!

The Impact

Did you know that almost 75% of people have at some time thought about going to culinary school? So why didn't they?  Not enough time, too expensive, or no school in the area means a lot of unfulfilled cooking dreams.

Now we bring culinary school to you - wherever you are and on your schedule.  No more surfing YouTube for hours looking for that one good video.  Our professors are from the top culinary schools in the world - so these aren't just culinary technique videos - they are real courses - sequenced progressively -  that will help you build your knowledge and skills towards those of a professional chef.

By contributing to our campaign you will help us scale this exciting opportunity and build a fantastic culinary community!  We will be able to bring the finest culinary cooking classes to people all over the world.

Risks & Challenges

We've already raised enough funds from angel investors to build and launch the True Foodies app with 100,000 downloads, a community of over 50,000 on social media and over 3000 Chefs signed up - 300 of them with Michelin stars - so we are pretty sure we can do this!

If we don't make it to our goal it could delay the delivery of the physical books. Luckily we already have most of the cooking courses filmed and in the can!

Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.  Tell all your friends - share it out on your social networks and linked in - or just send people an email.

Use the Indiegogo share tools next to the back it button! And send it to everyone you know who has ever loved to cook - even for a minute. 

Download our app here: https://bit.ly/fortruefoodiesonly -  and invite your friends to download it too.

Rate it on the app store - it just takes a moment.

Thank you!

story:
We’re launching more than a company. We’re turning around a town.

Crescent City Cafe will be owned and operated by two young professionals, native to

Virginia, who bring a combined 15 years of restaurant experience. Justin Brown was raised with his

five brothers and sisters in Floyd, then studied Psychology at Virginia Tech and graduated in 2017.

During his junior year of college Justin met a chronic entrepreneur, Steve

Critchfield. Steve is a local businessman who is deeply involved with the revitalization of Pulaski,

Launching a pilot project there which includes a new restaurant. Steve recognized Justin’s

passion, experience, and ambition and gave him the opportunity to take part in starting Crescent

City Cafe. Justin spent his senior year designing Crescent City and networking with other

professionals, in hopes of finding people willing to help him with the café launch as well as

other projects associated with the town’s revitalization. During this time, he met Brandon White, a

new local to Blacksburg, originally from Central Virginia. Brandon came to the area because of

the simple lifestyle it offered and became captivated by Pulaski when Justin brought the area to his

attention, presenting the opportunities, the history, and the community. Both individuals spent their years, since able to legally hold a job, working for

different restaurants throughout Virginia. They started bussing tables, working up through

hosting, waiting tables, cooking, and even managing other employees. These skills are

essential to any restaurant, but they believe they can cultivate a

new type of experience at Crescent City Café, one

that will draw people to Pulaski for one meal, then another, and then, even, a lifetime, which is the true mission of their enterprise.

What once began as a Pilot Project on Main Street has become a Pilot Project for the heart of Pulaski, propped up with smiles and good food

for years to come. So far, the community of

Pulaski has been instrumental to Crescent City’s progress, as they have helped secure a

building which is currently under renovations, as well as helping us spread the word through

events, media, friends, and family. Completing this crowdfunding campaign would enable us to

take the last few steps in order to get the restaurant up and running.

We are hoping to obtain twenty thousand dollars through our Indegogo campaign. This

money will bolster personal investment in the project, which will be leveraged by a bank

loan required to purchase equipment for both our kitchen and customers. Any

extra money will be left as operating capital providing a cushion for our early months and

seasonal fluctuations. These funds ensure forward progress, building off the steps already taken. We’ve already obtained a building on West Main Street that has been restored under

historic regulations thanks to community of Pulaski, and the state of Virginia. We’re dedicated to

helping the community the best way we know how and will see this project through.

 

We’re looking forward to our future in Pulaski and envision amazing things to come for

the town. This location embodies a true Appalachian escape, where a creek runs through the center of the historic downtown and blue-gray hills offer spectacular views.

Crescent City Cafe is a destination location that will drive commerce and visitors to the town!

Even if you don’t have the means to support the project directly, you might just know

someone who can! Share this campaign with friends, family, anyone you think might be willing

to support us by donating or even just by spreading the word! Every dollar truly helps, as it

strengthens our ties to the town, rooting us here for years to come

story:
About us:

Hi, Im Benny! and this is my friend and business partner, Steve. Besides working as a chef in restaurants for years, I've also owned and operated food trucks the last 5 years.  Steve grew up in the restaurant and catering business with his family. In addition to his owning his own successful food trailer, he's also a graduate of Robert Morris University business with a degree in business managment and extremely knowledgeable on that side of it.  

Last year Steve and I joined forces and started the first Steve and Benny's Chicken Shack, a mobile food trailer! Serving quick and convenient fried chicken sandwiches, it's been a smash hit! As with our previous trucks, it's very rewarding, exciting and thrilling to start a business from nothing, build it up with your own blood, sweat and tears,  and see it become successful. Now, due to demand from all of you, we are growing! Steve and Benny's is expanding to a new food truck, as well as a brick and mortar location.  As we have bootstrapped the first trailer with our own money, energy and time, we're asking for some help with our next phase. Help us bring local fried chicken goodness to the masses!

 We are incredibly grateful and appreciative of the overwhelming support from you, our  hometown Pittsburghers. We  want to continually share the gift of our talents by feeding all of you in this great city. In return for helping us along the way, we'll be hooking you all up with some super cool items and experiences. 

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • We are building a second chicken truck! We've already saved up and purchased our new food truck, but need a total of $10,650 to adequately build out with equipment, graphics, etc.  We're working directly with our local food truck builder/fabricator who has lots of experience building food trucks, to build out our second (jokingly referred to as CHICKEN#2)
  • We have already secured a building as our new kitchen and eventual restaurant, just northwest of PIttsburgh in Monaca.  We've already started investing our own time and money into this new building, and any Additional  funds raised will go directly to speeding up the process of us opening !! 
  •  Besides some cool stuff like stickers, magnets, growlers, and giving away a ton of food, we also wanted to give you the opportunity to snag up some one of a kind "EXPERIENCES"! 
  • Obviously every cent helps and we know that!  If we don't hit our goal, what we do raise will help tremendously, and of course we would continue doing what we do best, hustle and finish it off ourselves! We have a great track record and wouldn't dream of letting all of you down!

The Impact

  • We are NOT CORPORATE! We're just two local dudes who love to cook for people! That's why we value our customers and supporters so much! We can do great things but only with the help and support of you.  We want to share our love of food and friendship with as many people as possible! 
  •  With our track record I am 100% confident that Steve and Benny's will continue to grow and be a massive success! We have taken all the years of experience to build a solid, streamlined, profitable business and lay the groundwork to grow big all over Pittsburgh and beyond!
  • Our first Steve and Benny's is out on the road now! follow on FB and IG! also we will be posting updates on the buildout of the newest Food truck, as well as the new physical home!

Risks & Challenges

  • I won't lie, being in business this long hasn't been easy. This business is tough, usually not very glamorous, and definitely NOT like the food network. We've been beaten down with challenge after challenge, enough to make most people quit. We don't. Why?  We have passion. We have years of experience as a teacher. We have each other. And most importantly, we have a DREAM! 
  • Steve and I, with the help of our families, and faithful followers (you!), lean on you all for help, support and motivation. All of you, simply letting us know that you believe in us and our dream, gives us the strength and energy to overcome any and all challenges! That may not sound very specific, but trust me when i tell you, don't underestimate the power of a vision and dedicated supporters!
  • We know how hard you all work for your money, and take that extremely seriously. If you can help at all in that way, thats amazing!
    If you can't, thats ok! We still need your help!  Just by sharing some social media posts,  and telling other friends about us would be a tremendous blessing and we couldn't ask for more!

 We are incredibly grateful and appreciative of the overwhelming support from you, our  hometown Pittsburghers. We  want to continually share the gift of our talents by feeding all of you in this great city. In return for helping us along the way, we'll be hooking you all up with some super cool items and experiences. 

What We Need & What You Get
 

We are building a second chicken truck! We've already saved up and purchased our new food truck, but need a total of $10,650 to adequately build out with equipment, graphics, etc.  We're working directly with our local food truck builder/fabricator who has lots of experience building food trucks, to build out our second (jokingly referred to as CHICKEN#2)
We have already secured a building as our new kitchen and eventual restaurant, just northwest of PIttsburgh in Monaca.  We've already started investing our own time and money into this new building, and any Additional  funds raised will go directly to speeding up the process of us opening !! 
 Besides some cool stuff like stickers, magnets, growlers, and giving away a ton of food, we also wanted to give you the opportunity to snag up some one of a kind "EXPERIENCES"! 
Obviously every cent helps and we know that!  If we don't hit our goal, what we do raise will help tremendously, and of course we would continue doing what we do best, hustle and finish it off ourselves! We have a great track record and wouldn't dream of letting all of you down!


The Impact

We are NOT CORPORATE! We're just two local dudes who love to cook for people! That's why we value our customers and supporters so much! We can do great things but only with the help and support of you.  We want to share our love of food and friendship with as many people as possible! 
 With our track record I am 100% confident that Steve and Benny's will continue to grow and be a massive success! We have taken all the years of experience to build a solid, streamlined, profitable business and lay the groundwork to grow big all over Pittsburgh and beyond!
Our first Steve and Benny's is out on the road now! follow on FB and IG! also we will be posting updates on the buildout of the newest Food truck, as well as the new physical home!


Risks & Challenges

I won't lie, being in business this long hasn't been easy. This business is tough, usually not very glamorous, and definitely NOT like the food network. We've been beaten down with challenge after challenge, enough to make most people quit. We don't. Why?  We have passion. We have years of experience as a teacher. We have each other. And most importantly, we have a DREAM! 
Steve and I, with the help of our families, and faithful followers (you!), lean on you all for help, support and motivation. All of you, simply letting us know that you believe in us and our dream, gives us the strength and energy to overcome any and all challenges! That may not sound very specific, but trust me when i tell you, don't underestimate the power of a vision and dedicated supporters!
We know how hard you all work for your money, and take that extremely seriously. If you can help at all in that way, thats amazing!If you can't, thats ok! We still need your help!  Just by sharing some social media posts,  and telling other friends about us would be a tremendous blessing and we couldn't ask for more!

story:
Hi I’m Ross Taylor… and 8 months ago, I leapt off the edge of a cliff.  

I said goodbye to my corporate role as a Designer with one of the worlds’ biggest confectionery companies and have been channelling every bit of passion, skill and experience (so luckily learnt from some of the best in the industry) into designing, creating and launching an interactive app/website which delivers the first, truly personalised, chocolate bar.

I have enjoyed the challenge of how to bring confectionery out of the dark ages and into the digital age whilst maintaining traditional craftsmanship and loved having the freedom to focus on how to put smiles on faces and create unique and memorable connections.               

So now, after months of hard work and late nights, I am ready to showcase Taylor’d Confections to the big wide world and hope that enough of you good people, like what you read and want to support this 20-something from South London, to be able to say to the Big Boys – ‘this is how you do it’.

So what exactly is this App?

Taylor'd Confections enables you to create a unique, confectionery connection by designing a bar of chocolate to include Pet Names, In-Jokes, Personal Insults, 'Do you remember when' Moments, Favourite One-Liners, Luvvy Doveyness Overload....basically, you can say anything!

We are giving you the creative freedom to immortalise your personalised words in chocolate for the delight of those who matter in your life.

AND, not only can you get witty with words but you can truly design your bar by choosing flavours, adding fillings, selecting designs and tailoring the packaging.

Think what you could do with this premium-level Personalisation. No more quick dashes to the corner shop for a box of generic chocs (guilty - I'm publically apologising here Mum), with our easy-to-use App, you can fast become Favourite Son again, Thoughtful Boyfriend, Top Geezer, Best Brother in the World.  

Our experts will carefully craft your creation and send it direct to your receiver's door (within 3-5 working days) hassle free for you and a unique treat for those who matter.

 

What I Need & What You Get

I need your love, your Likes, your Shares, your support, your networks, your ££’s and any spare hugs!

If you can see the potential and love the idea, GET INVOLVED, get behind the campaign, choose one of our Perks, Like us on Facebook, get Tweeting.  Who do you know that would love to shout out about this for me?  Fairy Godmothers & Godfathers - your wand-waving is needed. 

Behind every great man is a greater woman (my fiancée has been epic) and I’m doing this for her, for us, for humankind! Our world needs more smiles and generous gestures.

So, get on board, enjoy the ride and let’s create a story.  

 

The Impact 

Although this is one man’s dream, I have a very real business plan and goal for the campaign. The £12,000 target, when raised, will be used to purchase additional equipment to upscale production and output from our kitchen into something more substantial and sustainable. As well as the completion of our interactive Website/App, we will need to put the finishing touches to our temperature controlled shipping packaging to ensure products are received looking their very best.

 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

I have worked hard to mitigate risk but this is my first Indiegogo so naturally there's an element of unknown involved. That said, I have worked hard to ensure everything is in hand and planned for, so I am confident that my Indiegogo debut will not disappoint.

PRODUCTION RISK - We are currently going through the motions of having our production premises signed off by the Foods Standards Agency, we foresee no issues. Our priority is to obtain the necessary food safety and compliance documentation to produce high quality confections!

MANUFACTURING -The kitchen scale prototypes that we have created look and taste great! I am super happy with the quality, and long may this continue! Whilst I am not a confectioner by background, 9 years working along some or the world leading chocolate experts gave me a great knowledge of both production and the science behind the behaviour of chocolate.

LOGISTICS- We have teamed up with a well known logistics company that will secure accurate and fast delivery to our backers. We are working on the development of temperature controlled shipper packs to ensure product quality in the warmer months. I have experience designing e-commerce temperature controlled packaging for one of the worlds leading luxury coffee brands.

CUSTOMER SUPPORT -You being apart of our journey is very important to us, we will keep you updated every step of the way, as well during and after the project you can contact me through the comments section for any enquiry you might have or by email at support...

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP -I appreciate that not everyone will be able to help me out with a contribution. That's ok, we still really appreciate you taking the time to learn about what I am doing.

If you want, you can still help us in the following ways:

  • Share, share, share our campaign on social media (using the buttons on the left)
  • Email your friends, family and work colleagues with the link to this page!
  • 'Like' our facebook page and posts about the campaign!  
  • Join us on Twitter using #MAKEITPERSONAL 
  • Talk to people about it! word of mouth is the most powerful form or marketing.

With your help, we'll be able to make this a reality!

 

Thanks

Ross Taylor /Creator Taylor'd Confections

 

FAQs​

1. Do you ship worldwide?

We currently only ship to countries within the EU. More countries will be covered later this year when we can guarantee shipping quality for longer distances.

2. When will I receive my Bar?

We estimate the website will be live so you can create your personalised bar 8 weeks after the campaign ends, but we will try to bring this date forward if we can.

3. How long will my 'PAID' unique payment code be valid for?

You will receive a unique code for your chosen to be entered at the payment section (PAID). This will be valid for 6 months from receipt.

4. What are the shipping costs?

Shipping costs change depending on the chosen perk. Select your perk and the shipping cost will be shown in the check out process.

5. How big is the bar of chocolate?

Each bar weights 120g. The size is : 17cm x 9cm

story:
Our Product and Our Story

Product: Lock It Plates is a revolutionary two individual plate lockable plastic food container that locks together by placing the two plates on top of each once their tabs are align. Then with just a twist of the wrist clockwise once the tabs are in there holes the two plates make a container that can withstand a fall and keep its consumable safe inside because of its revolution locking system.  Once unlocked and separated the plates can be used to share a meal between two people. They can also be stored by stack within each other neatly to save space. The container is made from a BPA safe polypropylene (plastic) that is reusable, recyclable, bio-degradable, dishwasher safe and microwaveable safe.

Inventor: After the huge Earthquake that hit Haiti in 2010, I went there to volunteer in "tent city" where the injured people were but soon after an E. Coli epidemic broke out due to the unsanitary conditions the people were being serve food in harsh conditions. That's when the idea came to me about the Idea of the Lock It Plates usefulness and value it could bring in this situation. I already had the idea in mind but now I seen that the world needed this item and it could make a foot print in distastes like this if implemented right. That's way I am pursuing the dream of making this product to help other because it more than just me at stake. 

What We Need & What You Get

Why we need the investment:  The $25,000 will go towards getting the machinery to produce the plates and Funding our First Batch. We will also donate some of the plates for a project we call "Plates of Love" where we  will give nonprofit organizations plate/container to provides healthy meals to disaster relief sights and third-world countries whom need the product more so. 

  • Perks - All contributors who donate  $25 dollars or more  will receive a free set of two plates to form one container.
     
  • If we do not reach our entire goal, then the funds we do get will be use to produce as many unites as possible and we will have to partner with a nonprofit organization to distribute Lock It Plates fill with healthy food in deserving communities. After a successful trial we'll try to get government aid to continue our "Plate of love" mission.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  •  You can email s at Lockitplates@gmail.com and tell us how can improve the product or what you will like to see on your food container.

Thank you in advance !

story:
History

Hi everyone!

I am the owner of Jade Chocolates, an award winning chocolate company based on my cultural background.  We specialize in blending teas, spices and tropical fruits from Asia and the Pacific Islands.   For the past 12 years,  we've produced tantalizing bon bons, flavored chocolate bars and  confections.  

We are expanding our line of chocolates into a cafe setting where one can have Asian and Pacific Island brunch, afternoon tea, pastries and flavored hot chocolates on one of the most vibrant streets of San Francisco.  I envision the space where people can congregate and share their love of chocolate with others, take a class in chocolate or pastry making,  have a date during one of our special movie nights, or enjoy a tea party with your friends.  Our first shop was out of the way for many, as it was situated in a family oriented neighborhood.  It was a small, hard to get to storefront, but it was a necessary first step into retail.  Our lease is up and it's time to expand. 

Having a cafe in Chinatown is more than just a dream.  As a 5th generation San Franciscan, my Chinese ancestry began in these streets in the late 1800's.   My family lived and worked in Chinatown during the 1906 Earthquake, the Chinese Exclusion Act, the Great Depression, and now with me, during the COVID-19 pandemic.   In those early beginnings, my family had no choice but to live here.  Venturing out of Chinatown was sure to stir up negative emotions and possible physical violence.  Today, I chose to come back to the same neighborhood that rooted my family in California.  San Francisco's Chinatown streets are what formed  who I am.  This is where Jade Chocolates belongs.

The purpose of this cafe is not just to sell chocolates, but as a place where we can promote culture through food. 

Here's a list of events we plan to host:

  • Learn how to play mah jong party-Whether a seasoned player or a beginner, all are welcome to join and play for in-store prizes. Tables will be matched with similar skill levels
  • Hawaiian Night/May Day Celebration- Feast on a luau, learn how to make a lei and their significance of their islands with live music. 
  • I'm a chocolatier (2 part series)
  • Cooking with tea (2 part series with sweet and savory applications)
  • Kawaii your food (kid's cooking class)-inspiring food as art by making your food look 'cute'.
  • Making Dessert Sushi
  • Movie Night--an example is Like Water For Chocolate with a chocolate inspired dinner will be served.

 

Challenges

 We have a long road ahead of us to get the funds we need to see this project through.  The current state of the world has hindered this even more with two key investors backing out.  We anticipate the entire project will cost $250K which will come through a combination of crowdfunding, loans and private investors.  As with many projects hitting unforeseen roadblocks, we are in the midst of COVID-19.  It will push back our opening date 3-4 months, missing the summer peak.  We also will start paying rent on June 1st, the day we anticipated our Grand Opening.  Opening day most likely won't occur until this coming Fall.

It's surreal to be raising funds for this project during the worldwide coronavirus outbreak but this pandemic will not stop this project.  Our biggest obstacle is raising funds to open.  We have over 12 years of experience in the chocolate making business with a loyal following in San Francisco and beyond.  We have hired an executive chef with 30  years of knowledge  handling all the new savory and baked items and I have confidently let go of most of my reigns in the chocolate kitchen to a new lead chocolatier.  We have a strong team of people and a loyal following of existing customers. 

 

 

 

Secondly, having our new homebase in the path of tourists will elevate our popularity even more bringing Jade Chocolates to the forefront of a must have souvenir from this great city. 

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Everyone knows people who love chocolate.  Even if you can't help us to our goal, please share this campaign on your Facebook page or directly with people you think would love to see this through! 

 Want to help in a bigger way or have other ideas on ways you can help?  Email mindy@jadechocolates.com to view the deck and projections or with your questions.  We are still looking for investors.  See you in Chinatown!

story:
Summary

At Carnivore House, we decided to take control, from sourcing the animals to ensuring that they were humanely raised and finished to controlling all ingredients used in the course of meat preparation, thus making sure that we and our families including yours eat healthy quality and blessed meat with the highest quality possible and it all starts from the farms we deal with and ends on your table mixed with love.

Our Story

Mummified Jerky was a result of many years of search for a high-quality Halal meat. All the available offerings lacked transparency in one thing or another.  From flavor profile, meat quality to the source of the meat and method of slaughter. We decided to take things into our own hands, we started sourcing our meat, scrutinizing our dry and wet ingredients, and developing our own recipes to suite the taste and dietary restrictions of our Halal consumers. Shortly later, we expanded our offerings to be one of the first to introduce  Lamb Jerky and more poultry Jerky.  As a result, Mummified Jerky was one of the sold Halal Jerky products and on Amazon's choice recommended products.

We received overwhelming positive feedback and encouragement from all of our customers and during food expos such as GulfFood, and Muslim Conferences such as MASICNA to take it one step further. This empowered our aspiration to fulfill the pressing need for unique Halal premium offerings beyond jerky.  We are bringing the same vision, passion and process of our Mummified Jerky brand to deliver fresh meats.  Expanding our products to include beef, lamb, goat, chicken and squabs.

We are determined to Halalify the experience using the best quality, grass fed and humanely raised Beef, Lamb, Goat and Poultry.  And taking it to the next level by offering deli meats and sausages and any meat cooking techniques that are very popular with Western style charcuterie and smoked products,

As a Result, we decided to create Carnivore House where we never buy frozen meat or any generic Halal meat where the source is not 100% known. We only sell what we can feed our families and Customers.

 

Risks & Challenges

To be able to deliver on our promise, we run a huge risk of fluctuating livestock market prices as well as availability of certain breeds. 
We plan to absorb any price differences and form alliances with multiple farmers to source our livestock to mitigate the availability risk.

Shortly later, we expanded our offerings to be one of the first to introduce  Lamb Jerky and more poultry Jerky.  As a result, Mummified Jerky was one of the sold Halal Jerky products and on Amazon's choice recommended products.
We received overwhelming positive feedback and encouragement from all of our customers and during food expos such as GulfFood, and Muslim Conferences such as MASICNA to take it one step further. This empowered our aspiration to fulfill the pressing need for unique Halal premium offerings beyond jerky.  We are bringing the same vision, passion and process of our Mummified Jerky brand to deliver fresh meats.  Expanding our products to include beef, lamb, goat, chicken and squabs.
We are determined to Halalify the experience using the best quality, grass fed and humanely raised Beef, Lamb, Goat and Poultry.  And taking it to the next level by offering deli meats and sausages and any meat cooking techniques that are very popular with Western style charcuterie and smoked products,
As a Result, we decided to create Carnivore House where we never buy frozen meat or any generic Halal meat where the source is not 100% known. We only sell what we can feed our families and Customers.
 
Risks & Challenges
To be able to deliver on our promise, we run a huge risk of fluctuating livestock market prices as well as availability of certain breeds. We plan to absorb any price differences and form alliances with multiple farmers to source our livestock to mitigate the availability risk.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, all I am Mason Snyder, and I am a Chef (and a rodeo cowboy and Veteran, stories for another time). I have one goal to make food local, to support the local economy, put the ownership back into small family farms, reduce carbon emissions from long haul transportation, there are endless reason to push local!

I want to do it through a mobile catering company in order to do that we need a food truck! We want to use the local farmers and wholesalers who buy local to be the core of the food we supply to every event we cater, birthday party, graduation, and wedding, it should be special and not just some catering company that tries to give you the cheapest quality food and charge you outstanding rates to "get by" on the event. We are here to do better, you should #DemandLocalCC

Q and A on Instagram

Want to know more about me, my goals with food, the business, how we want to make it happen, my experience, whatever: Every Thursday and Sunday starting 2/18 on Instagram I'll do a Q&A where you can ask anything you want @the.cowboy.chef so you know what and who you are helping. Its also when and where we'll do our weekly shoutouts!

What We Need & What You Get

Ideally we would want a new build out on a food truck which will cost around 70,000 dollars, that's a lot of dough(pun intended)! If you have worked in the food and beverage industry you know as a cook you don't make much so saving up for this venture of owning your own company is difficult, but we managed to get enough to get the business up and running, operating from commissary kitchens and private client homes is the current practice, but it doesn't give us the capabilities we need to do your events anywhere, anytime! 

If we get the 70,000 we are ready to roll to your home and put on a party, if we can at least reach 20,000 we will secure enough capital for a bank to agree to the rest. If we are still under we won't be quitting on this goal, we'll keep try, this isn't just a business it's an idea!

Every little bit helps!

The Impact

This isn't just a business to me, this is a way to change the food system to force the competition to compete and also use local food and farmers for sourcing. We want to not just use the business as a way to make money but as a platform to discuss food and where it comes from, to produce videos, on what farmers are doing, how to cook foods those foods, even how to approach find farmers for your food, forage for your own (check out our video with Yampatika) even get them to show you how to grow your own. 

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk, is this is this is a business and we need to compete, but I do believe we have a solid 5-year profit-and-loss projections that will help us overcome financial obstacles in a realistic fashion, I don't just hold a degree in Culinary Arts but also Business Administration which come's in handy to managing an efficient business.

We also need to be able to supply a variety of foods from the local environment and farms, we need to make those connections but also provide them with the right amount of business for them to work with us, getting the funding for the food truck puts us in that position to be mutually beneficial. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate that is more than ok, we could still use your help!

Please share this campaign!

Use our service! or

You could recommend our business to a friend!

story:
For recipes that require constant or occasional stirring, MasterSous is your hands-free assistant.

Now you can caramelize onions for an hour without standing over the pot. And if you're making a popular dish like risotto, it's even easier – just select the pre-programmed, one-touch setting and go.

MasterSous also allows you to program the stirring speed and stirring interval. For instance, you can set your grandma's pasta sauce to stir slowly every 2 minutes for 4 hours.

 

The digital controls allow for precise control of time and temperature, so that your food doesn’t overcook or burn.

MasterSous’ cooking temperature can range from 100°F to 450°F, and its infrared temperature sensor makes sure it’s precise. It also has pre-set food settings for more than eight types of common oils, so you can heat oil right up to its smoking point, without going over, for perfect crispness and moisture retention. 

 

With the MasterSous mobile app for iOS and Android devices, all of the settings that are available on the machine are at your fingertips, even when you’re out of the house. 

You can increase the cook time or temperature, know exactly when your food is done, keep the food warm or shut it off altogether. MasterSous will also alert you if cooking has been interrupted.

 

The beauty of MasterSous is that you can get rid of all the other bulky cookers that clutter your counters and replace them one modern, yet classic, device. Plus, it comes in four different colors, so you can choose what best matches your style.

MasterSous is the perfect accessory to every kitchen!

 

But, if keeping your cooking tools out isn’t your thing, MasterSous is only 16.5 inches tall and 18 inches wide, so it will easily fit tucked away. 

 

And don’t worry, just because it’s sleek doesn’t mean MasterSous isn’t roomy. MasterSous has plenty of space (6 quarts!) to cook large amounts of food for the whole family… and still have leftovers for friends!

 

All of the materials used to craft MasterSous are safe for cooking and never contain any chemicals like PFOA (Perfluorooctanoic Acid).

 

The MasterSous sensors make it easy to tell when your food is ready through the infrared temperature sensor. What’s more, the cooking interruption indicator will send a message straight to your smartphone should something interrupt your cooking. The sensors even enlist auto-shut off when your food is done. 

 

Take away the stigma of cleaning up with MasterSous. MasterSous’ non-stick materials make cleanup a cinch, so you can get to the fun stuff…eating!

 

MasterSous was designed with the intention of helping with three of life’s limited resources: time, space and money. MasterSous was imagined to be the ultimate sous chef, relieving us of the time-­consuming tasks involved in healthy cooking for our families, all while consolidating the functions to fewer devices which require less room and overall cost.

 

 
 

Dr. James Collins is a board-certified physician with 14+ years of medical experience spanning from outpatient, inpatient and emergency room settings. He graduated with honors while receiving his Bachelor’s Degree in Microbiology and Chemistry from the University of Florida and earned his medical degree from the University of Florida College of Medicine. In addition to serving as the Chief Resident during his residency training at the University of Wisconsin, Dr. Collins has held numerous leadership positions and served on multiple hospital committees. 

Dr. Collins has 27+ years of leadership and advisory experience that began as President and Founder of his first business after graduating high school. This continued during his undergraduate studies while holding the positions of Executive Director and Vice President of the nation’s largest Premedical Chapter of the American Medical Student Association with more than 500 members. 

Dr. Collins also served as a committee member on the Best Care Collaborative, a prominent committee assembled with the aim of improving patient outcomes through enhanced hospital processes that is comprised of multiple hospitals from the Minneapolis-St. Paul and Western Wisconsin area. He served on this committee from 2013 to 2015. 

As the inventor, Dr. Collins brings vision, motivation, inspiration, and team build in order to help engage and deliver MasterSous.

 

Started by Steve Casteel, Parallel Design opened its doors for business in 1998 as product development firm. Steve’s goal was to combine expert personnel with state of the art equipment to meet industry demand.

Partnering with John Cichello and now headquartered in Wooster, OH, Parallel Design is geared around product innovation and now services several Fortune 500 companies as well as many individual entrepreneurs.

Parallel Design provides all aspects of development including industrial design, engineering, advanced 3D CAD modeling and prototyping. Parallel Design delivers manufacturing services by partnering with select ISO certified manufacturing facilities located throughout Asia. Their team has worked closely with many leading companies, which include: Closet Maid, Coleman, Compaq, Dial Industries, Inc.,

Diebold, Appliance, GE Energy, GE Indust, Security, Gojo, Hoover, Kraftmaid Cabinetry Inc, Matco Tools, Moen, Playtex Products Inc, Rubbermaid, and Scotts Company. For more information, visit http://www.parallelinc.com/.

 

Edison Nation, Inc. is a vertically integrated innovation aggregation and full-service product development and manufacturing company, offering innovation sourcing, design, sales, fulfillment and shipping services. Edison Nation’s model is to provide a risk mitigated platform that connects innovators with companies to bring new products to market. For over 10 years, Edison Nation has been and continues to be the trusted destination for innovators, partners and consumers alike and the trusted leader for quality innovation. A partial list of leading companies that Edison Nation currently works with includes Bed Bath & Beyond, Procter & Gamble, Amazon, People, Home Shopping Network, and Rite Aid. For more information, please visit www.edisonnation.com.

 

We can’t thank you enough for checking out our project and helping us make MasterSous a reality. 

We know not everyone will be able to support us with a pledge, so even if you can’t give a dollar or purchase a MasterSous, if you’re a supporter of MasterSous, you can help us spread the word on Twitter, Facebook, Reddit, Instagram and anywhere else you can think of!

story:
Hello my name is Rickie Pongracz. I am a graduate of West Chester University of Pennsylvania . My wife and I just celebrated our one year wedding anniversary on October 10th, 2015! We have a dog named Winston who weighs all of about 8lbs and thinks he is the king of the house and neighborhood. Ice cream is a huge passion for me and something I would like to make a long career out of. I had the opportunity to study under one of the most well renowned ice cream inventors and creators in the world who helped major companies in the ice cream industry reinvent their products. I am very passionate about ice cream. Now, you're probably asking yourself how can someone be so passionate about a dessert like ice cream? I enjoy what ice cream does to a person and how it can make someone feel! It makes people happy! It's not just a food, people eat ice cream because they are happy! It can be a reward for some, or taking that special someone on a date, or just having that special memory. It's a lot bigger than just food. 

  The Fountain House is an up-and-coming ice cream experience selling the most amazing ice cream you will ever lay your tongue on! Our focus is to create super premium ice cream while using only the finest ingredients: imagine Blueberry Bacon Vanilla, or our famous Ricotta and Fig. In order to get started and eventually open our first store we need the community at large to taste our products. Unfortunately, the equipment is the most expensive hurdle to jump . We are in desperate need to purchase our very first ice cream machine. We need a little help from everyone who loves ice cream! With the support of our fellow ice cream lovers everywhere, we can turn our passion into a dream business.

If you love ice cream as much as we do then please support our funding goal and help us get ice cream into as many mouths as possible. Please please please! help us achieve our goal, so we can start to make happy memories for others.

While the machine is our first step for ice cream lovers to taste our products, we still face challanges to open the first store. A lot goes into an ice cream store, especially the equipment and supplies. This is in no way a "get rich campaign". We are simply looking for people in the community to enjoy our product as much as we do and eventually take a leap into opening our first store. Until we can make this a reality, we will continue the determination and drive and continue to dream BIG! 

We understand sometimes it might be hard to help contribute financially. Thats OK! Please help spread the word about our campaign throughout the community and continue to help The Fountain House turn our dream into a reality.


Thank you all!

-Rickie Pongracz 

The Fountain House

story:
Our dream:


Hello-before I begin here I would like to thank you for reading this and for being on this website. The fact that you are here shows that you are willing to help someone to fulfill their dream and people who are willing to take time out of their day and money from their wallets to do so are in short supply in this day and age so whether you choose to support myself or anyone else on this site I sincerely thank you.

A few years ago my wife and I answered an ad in our local paper for ice cream truck drivers. We thought it would be a fun way to earn some money and be able to spend time together while doing so. We were right. This job became much more than a job for us. The joy we were able to bring to people who were seeing the truck for the first time and to people who saw us and remembered seeing a neighborhood ice cream man 50 years ago was amazing and reflected by the joy in our hearts at being able to spend our days together enjoying the summer sun and earning a decent living.

While we found that we loved this job we also found, unfortunately, that we did not love the company we were working for nearly as much. There were a number of issues that forced us to leave the job we came to love and to begin our journey toward owning our own little piece of ice cream heaven. I'm not here to slander anyone so I am going to simply say that I do not agree with some of the business practices of my former employer and I am going to learn from what I feel are his mistakes and bring my community an ice cream truck that I can operate with pride.

Where your money (and ours) will go:

To fulfill our dream we need a total of about $10,000. Over the past few years we have been able to set aside around $5000. We are hoping to be able to raise enough to get out there this year but if not anything raised will go into the bank with what we have managed to save ourselves and perks for pledgers will be redeemable once we get rolling. Your generous contribution will go toward the following items:

-An ice cream truck (hopefully fully equipped with professional equipment)

-Any equipment we need to get the truck in shape

-Repairs/maintenance to ensure safety of truck and quality of product

-Repair fund so that an unexpected repair does not put us out of business any longer than necessary

-A facility (preferably with a garage) to repair and store equipment and products

-Insurance for equipment/facility

-Various fees for starting/incorporating business

-Starting stock (Ice cream, candy, pop, etc..)

-Application fees for solicitor's permits in towns of operation

-All other misc. equipment and costs

I have been planning this for a long time and have researched many hours to ensure our future success in this endeavor. I believe that with my experience and knowledge our ice cream truck will bring joy to the hearts of all we encounter for many years to come. Thank you for your time and don't forget to tell your friends about us!

story:
Getting More From Your Bottled Water

     If you are health conscious and feel water is a key part of your daily health regimen, then you will want to help us introduce a new bottled water that has whole body benefits.   As a physician passionate about helping people stay healthy and age gracefully, I believe in leveraging natural products.   I know that if I can get my patients to follow a simple daily pro-health regimen, that the benefits will be additive, and improve health and longevity.  And one of most important tips I offer is to hydrate daily, with balanced, purified water, in addition to taking supportive nutrients like collagen and other naturally occurring bio-active peptides.  For years I would see new beverages and bottled waters hit the market, but none with clinically proven bio-active peptides.   So with your help we can change that and bring the first whole body collagen support water to market.

    

     Our unique formulation will allow Collagen Renew to become the new standard in healthy hydration. Relative to our closest indirect competitor, coconut water,  Collagen Renew has virtually no calories, a clean natural taste and is priced 20% below the most popular coconut water brand. 

 

    

     If you are active and are concerned about wear and tear to your joints, muscles and connective tissue, our hydration solution is one of your best options.  Robust collagen production can lead to improved rejuvenation and a more youthful appearance.  Several studies have shown improvements in skin, hair and nails with measurable objective and subjective results. 

    

     We spent our time and worked with several nutritionists to evaluate a long list of supportive molecules with thousands of combinations to arrive at the selected formula.  Our ingredients are designed to work in synergy to boost production and support the longevity of your existing collagen through 3 mechanisms vs just one for a collagen only supplement.  We leverage select suppliers of hydrolyzed collagen from 2 sources to create a blend of type I, II and III collagen.

 

      

     Our mix of premium collagen, L-Carnosine, minerals and electrolytes create the crisp alkaline character of our water.  Though several have tried, no company has been able yet to produce a clear, crisp, premium water that contains several grams of collagen and other supportive peptides found in Collagen Renew.

*

     As we age we loose the cells (fibroblasts) that produce collagen so collagen supplementation becomes even more important to collagen production.  Our formula goes beyond supplementation and prolongs the life of existing fibroblasts by inhibiting the enzyme telomerase, via our second active ingredient L-Carnosine.  L-Carnosine also inhibits the stiffening and aging of existing collagen by inhibiting a process known as cross-linking.

 

 

     This support is most visible at the surface benefiting your body's largest organ, the skin.  And these benefits extend to your hair and nails.  To keep you looking naturally beautiful, most cosmetic specialists recommend daily nourishment and prevention of collagen damage.   Rather than spending a lot money after the fact, our water fits right into your daily health and beauty regimen and will pay dividends down the road.

Be First to Try Collagen Renew

 

We need your help but want to offer you something special in return:

  • We need your help because the bottled water market is dominated by large corporations that make it hard for small innovative players to get in the game.
  • We are looking to raise funds to assist in our production costs, and make a splash in the bottled water market.  
  • We want you to be the first to get our new bottled water and tell your friends and allow the product to gain a following that we can use to gain access to the hard to reach distribution channels that exists for bottled water and beverages.
  • Each contributor will get Renew Collagen shipped to their door.  (See perks)
  • All the funds raised will go towards our first production run of products which Indiegogo members and customers will be shipped as part of their participation.

 

The Impact

     With your help, we can create a new standard in healthy hydration and support good health and longevity for millions of people who can benefit from something as simple as an enhanced water.  In the past 20 years, I have developed several healthcare related products so I am confident that with your help we will be successful and create a new category in bottled water the leads to better health.

Our Special Cause

    Our founder, Dr. Giannulli knows first hand how childhood burns leave lasting wounds that are more than skin deep.  This is a special cause for the company which has committed to donate a portion of every sale to the Children's Burn Foundation (http://www.childburn.org).

 

Real Feedback from Pre-Market Tests

 

"Wow! Tastes like my favorite bottled water, and it has collagen!  It's like Botox in a bottle." 
-- GR Well known California jewelry designer

 

"I have been waiting for something like this.  I love the product. "
--TH Nutritionist and advocate for GMO free & Gluten free products

 

"Thanks for introducing this. I really need it. I forget my supplements and this makes it simple to ensure that I get what my body needs."
-- DL Media executive and cyclist

 

Risks & Challenges

Any new venture is risky, and the bottled water business has its own risks related to branding and distribution that make it a tough market to enter.  We feel that the exposure and customer support provided by Indiegogo will help us in several ways.  From an R & D perspective we have spent close to a year developing our unique collagen + L-carnosine complex that imparts the proven health benefits  along with the mineral and electrolyte formulation that allows our product to taste crisp and remain clear and clean.  We have also completed the packaging, banding, website and secured the proper IP in the form of trademark / trade-dress for the bottle design and brand name.   At this point, the biggest challenge before us is getting the initial production run completed and getting the word out that the product has arrived.  

So, we are asking you to contribute and get a case delivered to your door, or just use your social media prowess and help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign via the Indiegogo share tools!

* References

Oral Intake of Specic Bioactive Collagen Peptides Reduces Skin Wrinkles and Increases Dermal Matrix Synthesis
Proksch E., Schunck M., Zague V., Segger D., Degwert J., Oesser S.
Skin Pharmacol Physiology, December 2013

Oral Supplementation of Specic Collagen Peptides Has Benecial Effects on Human Skin Physiology: A Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study Proksch E., Segger D., Degwert J., Schunck M., Zague V., Oesser S.
Skin Pharmacol Physiology, August 2013
story_txt:
Getting More From Your Bottled Water
     If you are health conscious and feel water is a key part of your daily health regimen, then you will want to help us introduce a new bottled water that has whole body benefits.   As a physician passionate about helping people stay healthy and age gracefully, I believe in leveraging natural products.   I know that if I can get my patients to follow a simple daily pro-health regimen, that the benefits will be additive, and improve health and longevity.  And one of most important tips I offer is to hydrate daily, with balanced, purified water, in addition to taking supportive nutrients like collagen and other naturally occurring bio-active peptides.  For years I would see new beverages and bottled waters hit the market, but none with clinically proven bio-active peptides.   So with your help we can change that and bring the first whole body collagen support water to market.
    
     Our unique formulation will allow Collagen Renew to become the new standard in healthy hydration. Relative to our closest indirect competitor, coconut water,  Collagen Renew has virtually no calories, a clean natural taste and is priced 20% below the most popular coconut water brand. 
 

    
     If you are active and are concerned about wear and tear to your joints, muscles and connective tissue, our hydration solution is one of your best options.  Robust collagen production can lead to improved rejuvenation and a more youthful appearance.  Several studies have shown improvements in skin, hair and nails with measurable objective and subjective results. 
    
     We spent our time and worked with several nutritionists to evaluate a long list of supportive molecules with thousands of combinations to arrive at the selected formula.  Our ingredients are designed to work in synergy to boost production and support the longevity of your existing collagen through 3 mechanisms vs just one for a collagen only supplement.  We leverage select suppliers of hydrolyzed collagen from 2 sources to create a blend of type I, II and III collagen.
 

      
     Our mix of premium collagen, L-Carnosine, minerals and electrolytes create the crisp alkaline character of our water.  Though several have tried, no company has been able yet to produce a clear, crisp, premium water that contains several grams of collagen and other supportive peptides found in Collagen Renew.
 *
