story:
Who are you and where did you come from?

For those of you who don't know who we are, allow us to introduce ourselves! We are Kaylee Klein and Chris Sweeney. Partners in business and life.

Kaylee grew up in Tampa, Florida, working in the food industry through high school and beyond. After displaying an interest in the culinary world, she decided to attend pastry school in New York City at the French Culinary Institute (now International Culinary Center) to become a little more well rounded in the intersecting worlds of savory and sweet.. She ended up falling in love with pastry during her schooling and moved on to work her butt off in some amazing restaurants and bakeries in New York City, Tampa and then Nashville, where she met Chris Sweeney.

 

|||| Kaylee making sure the fridge is big enough in our first buildout ||||

Chris grew up in Nashville, Tennessee. He's been working in the food service industry since college, including such positions as running a well known and successful tap room. He is a great dishwasher, taste tester and strong coffee connoisseur.

---Chris doing what he does best, taste testing!---

We've now been in business for nearly two years and have reached capacity.  Like all things in the North Country, we must thrive... or die. So expand we must.  We have finally found the right spot for our expansion and will be moving on to Main Street, Littleton in November.

Where else can you get a seasonal pop tart with homemade sprinkles north of the notch?  Do you know of any establishment to support your duck fat breakfast sandwich addiction? Would you even survive without a carnival cookie stash?!?! We started this business wanting to bring big city tastes to a small town and translate it into a love and passion everyone feels when they take that first bite, and we think were succeeding. Starting a business is a wild and scary ride, but the relationships we've built over these past two years have helped shape what Crumb Bum Bakery has become. This is about community. This is about supporting each other. This is about working hard to bring something amazing to people you love. Everything we do, from birthday cakes, to huge wedding spreads, to farmers market baked goods, is a labor of love. Your reaction and continued attendance and support is the fruit of that labor! We wouldn't be here without the love and support of our community, and that will never be lost on us. We made a decision to invest in this awesome place we chose to call home, we hope you consider doing the same!

In order to provide our customers with the best experience and product we need your help. We are looking to raise $30,000 to renovate our newly acquired space and purchase new equipment.  Most of our existing equipment will follow us to Main Street, but to be open weekly, we need to drastically increase our production. Know what a dough sheeter is? It will allow us to make those delicious croissants you love way more frequently, while also saving Kaylee from some massive back problems one day! We also need a larger mixer, more refrigeration, and a second oven.

|||| our current kitchen ||||

With YOUR help, it would be the greatest honor to be Littleton's Main Street Bakery & Coffee Shop. Donate and you wont be disappointed! 

What We Need

Dough Sheeter - $3000

60 qt Mixer - $5000

Licensing Fee's - $1000.00

Build Out Costs - $5500

Starting Inventory - $1000.00

Salary - $5,000.00 

Luckily we have very talented friends that will be contributing to our build out to keep costs low while achieving a professional, up scale and eccentric vibe.

We want to do this expansion the right way, and one way to achieve that is purchasing a dough sheeter. Not only will this save a bunch of time, it will also save the ONLY baker's back from rolling pounds and pounds of dough on the regular. It's truly a life changer! 

Currently in our kitchen we only have a 20 qt Hobart mixer and a smaller professional kitchen aid. While we love both of them dearly it would save a bunch of time and energy to make bigger batches of our product, and that means investing in a 60 qt mixer.

We are currently licensed in our appointment only production kitchen, but to make everything available to you in this new setting we need a whole new set of licenses. To sell beer and wine we need another license. Theres just a whole bunch of licensing that needs to get done OK!

We're lucky to be renting an already amazing space! We don't have too much to do as far as demolition, but there are a bunch of things we need to change around to have the absolute best kitchen and cafe aesthetic! We want to blow a wall back to expose the kitchen for open viewing. We want to build cozy booth seating for our guests as well as a bar to house our espresso machine, bakery display case and beer and wine refrigeration.  We want to take out the drop ceiling and expose the beautiful original tin tiled ceiling. We'll be saving a bunch of money by doing it ourselves, like we said we have some very talented friends who are on board to help but we need funding for supplies. It's going to look AMAZING if we pull this off!

We need enough money to build up our inventory! Baked goods don't take too many ingredients, flour, sugar, butter, chocolate, almond flour, dairy, cocoa powder.... well maybe they do. We're able to keep our costs low by being smart with our money. We buy good quality products but don't necessarily waste our time any pre-made add ons. We make absolutely everything ourselves, from the sprinkles that top the cinnamon rolls to the syrups we soak our cakes in. We don't ever sacrifice quality, we use King Arthur Flour, Cabot Butter, Callebaut Chocolate, vegetables and fruit however local we can get it, meat from our friends that farm it. All these things add up though. To create a bakery that's open 6 days a week we need a pretty serious amount of goods to start out. This would help chip away at that! 

Last (but certainly not least) we need a salary for the two only employees/owners. We love what we do but we also need to support each other and our two year old son throughout this expansion. Kaylee is taking limited custom work throughout this time to focus on build out while Chris is working full time on this project. This money would help ensure that we pay our bills and our sons childcare throughout the first few months so the rest of the profit can go straight back into our growing business.

 

What You Get

Besides t-shirts, stickers, and other perks for you donation, you get a place to meet, eat, and be part of growing Littleton. Crumb Bum Bakery and Coffee will be here for you caffeine needs and dessert desires!

...and Thank You!

We are making this expansion with or with out your help, but your donations will insure our ability to produce enough product to satisfy the masses and still have something left for you! If we don't raise enough money to buy new equipment we will have more limited hours and days that we can be open, so please be there for us so we can be there for you. We're SO excited to be a staple in our community but we need our communities support. Tell ALL your friends and bear with us through our growth spurt! We'll see you on Main Street in November!
